quote: Healthy buildings help shape the competitive price scale for the real estate market and may soon become the dealmaker or breaker in commercial property decisions.
content:
By SHAZNI ONG / Pic By BLOOMBERG
THE rising number of chronic diseases linked to poor indoor air quality has brought to light the urgency for a better understanding in addressing the problem.
uHoo co-founder and CEO Dustin Onghanseng said sick building syndrome (SBS) or building-related illness (BRI) has been a cause of concern for most building occupants who fall ill due to poor indoor air quality.
However, he said recent innovations in low-cost air pollution sensors have enabled a new generation of air quality monitoring devices that provide actionable high-resolution data at a fraction of the cost of traditional monitoring systems.
“Air quality used to be something that people rely on manual methods for information.
“However, the technology behind the Internet of Things has improved dramatically that sensors are now so small that you can monitor the quality of air you breathe in your homes or offices,” he said at the launch of the Enviro InteliAQ System in Kuala Lumpur yesterday.
According to Onghansen, a survey revealed that tenants were willing to pay 25% higher rent on better healthy building systems.
“Healthy buildings help shape the competitive price scale for the real estate market and may soon become the dealmaker or breaker in commercial property decisions.
“Also, 64% (of the tenants) in Asia Pacific are willing to pay extra for products and services produced or offered from companies that are committed to positive social and environmental impact,” he said.
Onghanseng added that companies could save up to RM30,000 on return on investment productivity per person per year by enhancing the wellbeing of occupants.
“Having good indoor air quality would lead to the increase of productivity and better decision-making. This is important because we spend more than 80% of our time indoors,” he said.
The Enviro InteliAQ System, which features nine air quality sensors packed into a tiny device about the size of a coffee mug, is first launched in Malaysia before being introduced in other regional markets.
The system, launched by Enviro Group Asia through its subsidiary Enviroverks (M) Sdn Bhd, also saw the group partnering boutique hotel Alila Bangsar.
Its group CEO Nitesh Malani said the collaboration will be a gamechanger for the hospitality industry in the country as the company would help Alila Bangsar to ensure that its guests and staff are exposed to fewer pollutants and contaminations overall.
Enviro Group Asia has also entered into a collaborative distribution and research and development agreement with uHoo International, which will see the group expanding its regional footprint in the building sciences and environmental engineering sector.

quote: Dr Maszlee dikatakan wahabi liberal pulak.
content:
Dapatkan berita yang paling viral setiap hari:






Dr. Zakir Naik adalah seorang pendakwah terkenal dari India yang aktif memberikan ceramah di seluruh dunia. Mendapat pendidikan rasmi dalam bidang perubatan dan pembedahan di India, Zakir jadi individu yang dikehendaki lepas didakwa terbabit dengan serangan pengganas di Dhaka dan kes pengubahan wang haram.
Menurut Malaysiakini, kerajaan India telah membatalkan pasportnya setelah Zakir tidak mengendahkan permintaan untuk hadir di Badan Penyiasat Kebangsaan India bagi membantu siasatan. India juga telah membuat permohonan ekstradisi rasmi membawa Zakir pulang untuk disiasat.
Sumber: Blog
Pun begitu, Perdana Menteri Tun Dr. Mahathir Mohamad menegaskan bahawa kerajaan Malaysia tidak bercadang untuk menghantar Zakir pulang selagi dia tidak mencetuskan sebarang masalah kepada negara ini.
Atas sebab tu, tokoh Islam terkemuka dunia itu mengucapkan terima kasih kepada kerajaan Malaysia dan Tun M kerana membenarkannya tinggal di Malaysia. Zakir yang bertaraf kerakyatan penduduk tetap (PR) di negara ini bersyukur isunya diteliti dengan perspektif yang tidak bias.
Sumber: Malaysiakini
Pakar bedah itu juga berikrar untuk menjaga keharmonian di negara ini dan tidak akan melanggar undang-undang seperti yang disuarakan Tun M.
“Saya berterima kasih kepada kerajaan Malaysia, Tun Mahathir atas kebenaran saya tinggal di sini selagi saya patuhi undang-undang negara ini.”
“Saya merasa rendah hati menjadi sebahagian daripada kepelbagaian kaum di negara ini.”
Zakir meninggalkan India sejak tahun 2016 selepas didakwa terbabit mempromosikan keganasan. Namun dia menafikan sebarang penglibatan dengan segala aktiviti yang didakwa ke atas dirinya.
“Pemerhati akan sedar, sepanjang 25 tahun saya beri kuliah tentang Islam dan keamanan, saya tidak pernah promosi keganasan atas nama Islam atau sebaliknya.”
Semoga kes ni akan dapat diselesaikan dengan telus tak lama lagi.
Baca: “Dr Maszlee dikatakan wahabi liberal pulak…”

quote: wipe data and folders remotely on a lost device.
content:
PKR POLLS | PKR president-elect Anwar Ibrahim has chastised the "impetuous behaviour" which led to the arrest of one of the party's election officers over an alleged "cyber attack" in the Julau division polls.
It is believed that the election officer was detained following a police report being lodged, spurred by deputy presidential candidate Rafizi Ramli claiming that the officer had tampered with e-voting tablets in Julau.
"Another example of impetuous behaviour which ignores facts," Anwar said, referring to the arrest in a private text to PKR leaders.
He added that he has provided a lawyer to assist the detained election officer.
Malaysiakini has verified the text as authentic.
Anwar also pointed out that reports by members had previously led to the MACC arresting an officer from the PKR headquarters.
Commenting on Julau, he said the election committee had already lodged its own police report over the aborted polls in the division. 

He ended his text by saying: "In my statement to the media just now, I urged that party leaders be calm and accept the results as best as they can.
"Investigations can be done by police, MACC, and the MCMC."
'I cannot intervene'
In Port Dickson, Anwar was quoted as saying by Bernama that he cannot interfere in the party elections.
"Many have asked me to intervene, but I can't. This is what is not understood, including by the media.
"I can't interfere in the elections besides ensuring that there is no cheating and threats.
"I urge the election committee to appoint those who are truly independent and clean," he said.
Yesterday, Rafizi claimed that 'malware' by the name of Prey had been installed on the tablets in Julau.
Subsequently, the party's central election committee suspended the results from the division polls after what it claimed to be a "cyber attack".
Incumbent Julau PKR chief Semana Sawang, however, disputed Rafizi's version of events.
A tech expert later rubbished claims that Prey is malware.
On its website, Prey brands itself as an anti-theft software that enables users to track their devices but also “wipe data and folders remotely on a lost device."
It further allows users to manage and perform tasks on “thousands of devices” simultaneously.

quote: Seorang kanak-kanak dan orang yang berdekatan suspek turut dicederakan.
content:
Gempar wanita mengamuk di Wakaf Che Yeh




ZULHANIFA SIDEK
16 Disember 2018 10:22 PM


KOTA BHARU - Seorang wanita yang dipercayai ditinggalkan kekasih bertindak mengamuk sebelum mencederakan beberapa orang awam dalam kejadian di sebuah hotel di Wakaf Che Yeh di sini hari ini.

Dalam kejadian kira-kira pukul 4.45 petang, suspek yang berbogel serta berusia lingkungan 30-an itu menghadapi tekanan perasaan selepas ditinggalkan teman lelaki.
Lebih mengejutkan wanita itu yang berasal dari Wakaf Bharu, Tumpat turut menggunakan pisau semasa mengamuk.
Menurut rakan-rakan wanita itu, suspek berada dalam keadaan tertekan disebabkan hubungan cintanya yang tidak menjadi.
Seorang saksi yang enggan dikenali berkata, semasa tiba di lokasi kejadian dia melihat wanita berkenaan sedang mengamuk sambil mengacu-acukan pisau terhadap orang ramai.
"Seorang kanak-kanak dan orang yang berdekatan suspek turut dicederakan.
"Seorang pekerja hotel juga turut dicakar sehingga berdarah di tepi kening dan muka sebelum suspek melarikan diri. Saya betul-betul berada disebelahnya ketika itu," katanya ketika kepada Kosmo! Online.
Tambahnya, beberapa minit  kemudian anggota polis tiba dan bertindak menahan serta merampas pisau darinya.
“Wanita itu terus dibawa ke tempat tidak dipastikan untuk mengelak daripada orang awam merakamkan gambar,” katanya.
Sementara itu, Kosmo! Online sedang berusaha mendapatkan pengesahan daripada pihak polis berhubung kejadian tersebut. - K! ONLINE

quote: This probably produced a temporary dam effect which later broke when the landslide upstream occurred and resulted in the debris flow.
content:
Temporary dam likely sealed the fate of 8
Published on: Thursday, April 06, 2017

 TONGOD: A temporary dam built atop a hill to supply gravity-fed water to plantation workers in a 'kongsi' here is believed to have triggered the tragic mudslide in Tongod last Saturday.     
Although several landslides have been recorded along the terraced oil palm estate owned by Sen Fu Sdn Bhd, only this one was fatal.     
The April 1 incident had so far claimed five people, including two boys, after the man-made dam burst due to an overflowing catchment before dawn on April 1 following continuous rainfall.        
Only three of the 11 workers in the quarters have survived and police believe all are foreign relatives of Bajau descent working for the estate.     
Plantation workers at a second workers' quarters in the said there was nothing unusual about building a dam there.     
But Fire and Rescue Department Deputy Director Zuraidah Latip believed the dam was not properly built pointing out that the victims were rudely awakened around 1am or 2am.     
"The people from a nearby settlement across Sungai Pinangah overlooking the 'kongsi' actually shouted to alert those in the kongsi, when water came crashing first followed by mud, rocks and timber debris after sweeping aside everything in its path. The onlookers were not able to do much when it swept away the workers' quarters where the 11 victims were," she said.     
The workers' quarters was located right at the foot of the hill some 800 metres from a small stream settlers identified as Sungai Lidan.     
Sungai Lidan is directly connected to Sungai Pinangah, a main tributary that flows into the Kinabatangan River.     
It is understood the workers' kongsi was built in the path of the Sungai Lidan watercourse leading to Sungai Pinangah and Zuraidah said the force of the flowing mudslide had expanded the small stream from merely a foot wide to between 60 and 80-feet.      ADVERTISEMENT
The force of the mudflow destroyed everything in its path with Zuraidah noting the area was filled with logging activities, including where the Sen Fu Sdn Bhd Estate was, where thick forests were cleared to make way for oil palm about five years ago.     
"It's actually a catchment area but was purposely dug up by workers to allow water to be supplied to the estate workers," she explained.     
Universiti Malaysia Sabah geologist, Dr Felix Tongkul, who happened to be at the scene for a survey, also confirmed the presence of what appeared to be a dam.    
He said: "Based on our aerial drone survey, we saw two major landslides upstream responsible for the debris flow.     
"One of the landslides, located further downstream appears to have blocked the path of the stream.     
"This probably produced a temporary dam effect which later broke when the landslide upstream occurred and resulted in the debris flow.     
"The landslides appear to be related to the clearing of the forest for oil palm plantation.      ADVERTISEMENT
Numerous small landslides occurred in the surrounding areas," he added.     
The survivors, a man, his wife and son, are recuperating at the Sandakan Hospital and Zuraidah said hopes to find more survivors near the workers' quarters are growing slim as Fire and Rescue personnel mission here entered day five without any clue of finding survivors.     
"There are no further clues here at the moment. By now if there had been any more bodies, the dead should have given out a smell and the scent could be easily picked up," she said.     
Zuraidah noted a canine unit, 32 men highly-trained personnel from the Fire and Rescue Department's Special Tactical Operation Rescue Malaysia (Storm) unit and Multi-Skill Team (Mastim) from various stations from the West Coast are presently scouring the debris for survivors underneath the thigh-deep mud and boulders.     
"An excavator will be called in to clear the remnants of the five-door 'kongsi' as a last ditch attempt to look for survivors and we may wrap up the search if nothing is to be found.     
"We may shift our focus to the river (Sungai Pinangah) instead," said Zuraidah, adding that a scuba team along with police based in Sandakan are already on the job since day one, scouring the waters from Kinabatangan into Sungai Pinangah.     
She believed chances of finding them along the river were more likely following the discovery of the first survivor, the wife of three living survivors by civilians, some two hours or 2km downriver Sungai Pinangah.    
The discovery of the five more bodies, in Pinangah, on Tuesday further reinforced this notion, Zuraidah noted.      
To date, three remain missing. - Jason Santos

quote: 2018 was our busiest year yet and we are anticipating further growth in 2019.
content:
By SHAZNI ONG
Senai International Airport in Johor handled 3.52 million passengers last year, a 13% increase from the number of passengers recorded in 2017.
Senai Airport Terminal Services Sdn Bhd (SATSSB) CEO Md Derick Basir said the growth was mainly driven by domestic passengers with an increase of 9% or 234,650 passengers, from 2.68 million in 2017 to 2.91 million last year.
He also said international passenger traffic rose by 37% or 163,127 to 600,000 in 2018, while commercial aircraft movements were 8% higher with a total of 32,574 landings and takeoffs. 
“2018 was our busiest year yet and we are anticipating further growth in 2019.
“The growth was fuelled by the southern region’s rigorous economic activities, escalating the demand for business and corporate travel, as well as the leisure sector,” he said in a statement yesterday.
Md Derick added that the rise in total passenger traffic in 2018 was mainly attributed by the introduction of new routes.
“This includes Seoul by Jin Air; Sanya and Haikou by Malindo Air; as well as Alor Setar and Ipoh by AirAsia, in addition to the increase of flight frequencies for the existing sectors such as Kuala Lumpur, Penang, Kota Kinabalu, Langkawi and Bangkok. 
“We are aggressively collaborating with industry players including tourism bodies and airlines to promote Johor as a destination, ultimately the aim is to encourage the demand for more air connectivity,” he said.
Md Derick said the airport aims to handle 3.76 million passengers this year.
“It is going to be a busy and exciting year for us now that we have also expanded our portfolio to manage Kertih Airport in Terengganu.” 
SATSSB, a member of MMC Group, is the airport operator for Senai International Airport or formerly known as Sultan Ismail International Airport.
Recently, Senai International Airport was awarded “Asia Pacific Regional Airport of the Year 2018” under the less than 10 million annual passengers category by CAPA (Centre for Aviation) for its leading role in using new biometrics technology and its support of the low-cost carrier model. 
Its retail offerings have also improved with the opening of international brands such as Pizza Hut, Gong Cha, WH Smith, O’Briens Irish Sandwich Bar, Boost Juice and Burger King. 
The new outlets offer more value and choices for the airport’s users, in line with its aim to increase both international and local retail brands to cater to the growth of passengers’ movement. 
“Today, it is not just ‘an airport’ for travelling passengers, but has become ‘the place’ for the surrounding working communities to meet for business discussions,” Md Derick said.

quote: had approached the witness to make a statement in her favour
content:
(MMO) – The Sessions Court today set bail at RM2 million for Datin Seri Rosmah Mansor who earlier claimed trial to 17 charges under an anti-money-laundering law over the misappropriation of RM7 million in funds linked to 1Malaysia Development Berhad (1MDB).
Judge Azura Alwi also set two conditions for bail: that Rosmah surrenders her passport to court, and that she not disturb the witnesses or potential witnesses in her case.
“RM500k today, the remaining to be paid by or before October 11,” Justice Azura said in her decision on the bail payment.
Rosmah’s lawyers had asked for payment to be paid in installments.
The prosecution, led by Datuk Seri Gopal Sri Ram, had earlier sought for a RM10 million bail with the two conditions, citing the severity of the offences.
He also told the court that the second condition was necessary as he claimed Rosmah had previously attempted to influence a potential witness’ statement.
He said the 66-year-old wife of former prime minister Datuk Seri Najib Razak “had approached the witness to make a statement in her favour”.

quote: Suspek yang juga merupakan jiran kepada suami isteri itu ada menyatakan ketidakpuasan hati terhadap pasangan berkenaan namun dia tidak menjelaskan dengan lebih lanjut.
content:
Suspek tikam suami isteri di Rawang positif dadah




EDDY HAMIDI
12 Disember 2018 2:23 PM


GOMBAK - Polis mengesahkan suspek yang menikam sepasang suami isteri sehingga mengakibatkan salah seorang daripada mereka maut dalam satu kejadian di sebuah pasar di Batu 16, Rawang dekat sini semalam positif dadah jenis methamphetamine.

Ketua Polis Daerah Gombak, Asisten Komisioner Samsor Maarof berkata, ujian air kencing yang dilakukan ke atas suspek telah mengesahkan bahawa dia berada di bawah pengaruh dadah.
"Suspek yang juga merupakan jiran kepada suami isteri itu ada menyatakan ketidakpuasan hati terhadap pasangan berkenaan namun dia tidak menjelaskan dengan lebih lanjut.
"Siasatan akan diteruskan bagi mengenalpasti motif sebenar kejadian serangan tersebut," katanya ketika dihubungi di sini hari ini.
Kosmo! hari ini melaporkan sepasang suami isteri diserang oleh seorang lelaki yang merupakan jiran mereka dengan menggunakan sebilah pisau sehingga mengakibatkan kematian si isteri.
Dalam kejadian kira-kira pukul 6.40 pagi itu, mangsa, Chong Yoke Wa, 61, cedera di perut manakala isterinya, Yap Choon Mooi, 41, disahkan mati ketika menerima rawatan di Hosptal Selayang di sini akibat tikaman pada bahagian dada.
Menurut Samsor, permohonan reman terhadap suspek telah dibenarkan oleh Mahkamah Sesyen Selayang selama tujuh hari bermula hari ini sehingga 18 Disember depan. - K! ONLINE

quote: Kualiti udara terutamanya di kawasan bandar akan turut meningkat melalui penggunaan biodiesel dengan pengurangan pelepasan debu dan asap hitam ke udara.
content:
PUTRAJAYA: Kerajaan akan melaksanakan program Biodiesel B10 – iaitu adunan 10 peratus biodiesel sawit dan 90 peratus diesel fosil – dalam sektor pengangkutan untuk kegunaan semua jenis kenderaan diesel mulai 1 Feb tahun depan, kata Perdana Menteri Tun Dr Mahathir Mohamad.
Beliau berkata penggunaan 10 peratus biodiesel sawit di Malaysia bagi kenderaan seperti pacuan empat roda, lori dan bas akan mengurangkan pelepasan gas rumah hijau sebanyak 1.6 juta tan karbon dioksida setara setahun.
Program B10, katanya, akan menyumbang kepada pengurangan pembebasan gas karbon dioksida sebanyak 10 peratus daripada jumlah kenderaan diesel setahun di negara ini.
"Kualiti udara terutamanya di kawasan bandar akan turut meningkat melalui penggunaan biodiesel dengan pengurangan pelepasan debu dan asap hitam ke udara. 
"Pelaksanaan Program B10 adalah tepat pada masa ini memandangkan harga biodiesel sawit yang rendah berbanding dengan diesel petroleum," katanya melancarkan Pelaksanaan Program Biodiesel B10 di Sektor Pengangkutan di Dataran Putra di sini hari ini.
"Saya yakin program B10 untuk sektor pengangkutan akan berjalan dengan lancar dan dapat meningkatkan permintaan minyak sawit dalam negara mulai Disember 2018,” katanya.
Dr Mahathir turut meminta pengeluar kenderaan dan pengeluar peralatan tulen (OEM) bekerjasama dengan kerajaan dalam menjayakan pelaksanaan Program B10 termasuk sebarang program biodiesel pada masa akan datang.
"Malaysia perlu meningkatkan kadar adunan lebih tinggi pada masa hadapan bagi mengukuhkan permintaan domestik minyak sawit," katanya.
Memberi contoh Indonesia yang telah melaksanakan program B20 – iaitu adunan 20 peratus biodiesel sawit dan 80 peratus diesel fosil – dalam sektor pengangkutan tanpa sebarang masalah sejak 2016, Dr Mahathir berharap semua pihak bersedia untuk meningkatkan kadar adunan kepada B20 menjelang 2020.
"Penggunaan biodiesel sawit akan memberi impak yang positif terhadap industri sawit melalui pengurangan stok minyak sawit dan seterusnya menstabilkan harga minyak sawit. Melalui usaha ini, pekebun kecil sawit seramai 650,000 akan terus menikmati harga sawit yang lebih stabil dan meningkatkan pendapatan,” katanya.
Program Biodiesel negara juga akan membantu negara mencapai objektif mobiliti karbon rendah seperti yang digariskan dalam kajian separuh penggal Rancangan Malaysia Kesebelas (RMK-11), katanya.
Dr Mahathir juga mahu program biodiesel diberi perhatian serius dalam Dasar Automotif Kebangsaan (NAP) yang sedang dirangka Kementerian Perdagangan Antarabangsa dan Industri (MITI). 
"Kita seharusnya memastikan pada masa akan datang, hanya kenderaan diesel yang boleh menerima biodiesel lebih daripada 10 peratus dijual di Malaysia,” katanya.
Perdana Menteri berkata industri sawit Malaysia juga harus berani meneroka pasaran baru dan membuktikan bahawa kualiti minyak sawit di Malaysia adalah antara yang terbaik di dunia.
Dalam pada itu, Dr Mahathir menegaskan kerajaan akan terus berusaha menangkis semua tuduhan yang dilemparkan kepada minyak sawit sebagai punca kemusnahan hutan dan biodiversiti melalui apa sahaja cara yang mampu dilakukan.
Bagi mengatasi tuduhan itu, perdana menteri berkata kerajaan sudah mengambil inisiatif untuk mewujudkan skim pensijilan mampan seperti Minyak Sawit Lestari Malaysia (MSPO) namun negara pengimport terus berdegil dengan mengenakan pelbagai sekatan ke atas minyak sawit.
“Saya ingin menegaskan, kerajaan akan terus memelihara alam sekitar di mana pada ketika ini litupan hutan di Malaysia merangkumi kira-kira 55.3 peratus daripada keluasan negara.
"Ini melebihi komitmen kerajaan melalui ikrar pada Sidang Kemuncak Bumi di Rio pada 1992 untuk memastikan sekurang-kurangnya 50 peratus tanah di Malaysia dilitupi hutan,” katanya.
Terdahulu, Dr Mahathir telah memandu sendiri kereta berenjin diesel iaitu Peugeot model 508 yang menggunakan biodiesel B10 dari pejabat beliau di Perdana Putra ke tapak majlis pelancaran.
Pada majlis yang sama, Perdana Menteri turut merasmikan pengedaran biodiesel di seluruh negara di seluruh negara secara simbolik dengan upacara pelepasan lima buah lori tangik dari Petronas, Shell, Petron, BH Petrol dan Caltex. 
Sementara itu, menurut Kementerian Industri Utama dalam satu kenyataan, Lembaga Minyak Sawit Malaysia (MPOB) telah mengadakan ujian penggunaan lapangan sejak Ogos lalu termasuk kenderaan yang dipandu oleh perdana menteri tanpa sebarang masalah melibatkan penggunaan 150,000 liter biodiesel B10.
Katanya penjualan biodiesel B10 pertama bermula hari ini ditawarkan oleh Shell Malaysia Trading Sdn Bhd melalui Stesen Jet Melati di Gombak, Selangor.
Biodiesel berasaskan sawit adalah tenaga boleh baharu yang dihasilkan oleh tanaman sawit yang diusahakan secara mampan, dan penggunaan satu  tan biodiesel berasaskan sawit adalah bersamaan dengan pengurangan pelepasan tiga tan gas karbon dioksida di udara, katanya. 
Penggunaan biodiesel sawit secara mandatori di Malaysia telah dimulakan pada 2011 dengan Program B5 (adunan 5 peratus biodiesel sawit dengan 95 peratus diesel petroleum) bagi sektor pengangkutan. 
Kandungan biodisel sawit ditingkatkan kepada tujuh peratus bermula November 2014 secara berperingkat, dan pelaksanaan program B10 bagi sektor pengangkutan bermula pada 1 Dis lepas. B10 akan dilaksanakan secara mandatori pada 1 Feb tahun depan, katanya. - Bernama

quote: We were fortunate to get a draw.
content:
MILAN: Cristiano Ronaldo converted a penalty to seal a hard-fought 2-1 win for Juventus against Lazio in Rome on Sunday (Jan 27) to pull 11 points clear in Serie A.Juventus had trailed after an Emre Can own-goal after an hour before substitute Joao Cancelo pulled the champions level and then earned the penalty which Ronaldo slotted in with two minutes to go.
An eighth straight Serie A title beckons for Massimiliano Allegri's side who soar clear of second-placed Napoli who were held to a goalless draw at AC Milan on Saturday.Inter Milan are 19 points behind the leaders after losing 1-0 at Torino earlier on Sunday.Lazio drop to eighth place - three points off the Champions League spots - after their second defeat in a row after losing to Napoli by the same score last weekend."It must have been the kitman's fault, giving us ten shirts of different colours because we couldn't pass the ball to each other," said Allegri.
"For sixty minutes it was the worst Juventus of the year," said captain Giorgio Chiellini."Paradoxically after the goal disadvantage we found the motivation to win it."We've got players who make the difference. (Goalkeeper Wojciech) Szczesny kept us on our feet, we were lethal in the end."The champions had struggled for the first hour in the Stadio Olimpico as Lazio piled on the pressure.Daniele Rugani pulled off a goal-line clearance, after Joaquin Correa dribbled past Can and Leonardo Bonucci, with Szczesny denying Luis Alberto and Marco Parolo.German midfielder Can's woes were compounded just before the hour mark when he ducked down and instead deflected the ball into his own net off a corner.But Allegri's side could count on the depth of their bench with second half substitutes Cancelo and Federico Bernardeschi proving pivotal.A solo run by Bernardeschi down the left set up the equaliser which Cancelo fired in off a rebound after Lazio goalkeeper Thomas Strakosha had initially cleared a Paulo Dybala shot.Ronaldo - whose penalty was saved last week against Chievo - finished off to score in his eighth consecutive away match to bring his league tally to 15 goals.ROMA WASTEFULInter Milan fell at Torino with defender Armando Izzo scoring the only goal after 35 minutes, as Roma threw away a three-goal lead to draw 3-3 against Atalanta.Roma could have overtaken AC Milan in fourth but Colombian forward Duvan Zapata continued his goal-scoring streak to snatch a point.Roma had been three goals up following an Edin Dzeko brace, with Stephan El Shaarawy adding a third five minutes prior to the break, before the Romans faded under the driving rain in northern Italy.Roma coach Eusebio Di Francesco lamented: "What drives me crazy is the lack of consistency from this team, even during the same match."It's absurd to see a team with the same players put in such a different performance from one half to the next."We were fortunate to get a draw."Dzeko broke through after just three minutes for his first goal in Serie A since October, adding a second half an hour later, with teenage compatriot Nicolo Zaniolo providing two assists.Atalanta fought back with content:
PKR POLLS | PKR president-elect Anwar Ibrahim has chastised the "impetuous behaviour" which led to the arrest of one of the party's election officers over an alleged "cyber attack" in the Julau division polls.
It is believed that the election officer was detained following a police report being lodged, spurred by deputy presidential candidate Rafizi Ramli claiming that the officer had tampered with e-voting tablets in Julau.
"Another example of impetuous behaviour which ignores facts," Anwar said, referring to the arrest in a private text to PKR leaders.
He added that he has provided a lawyer to assist the detained election officer.
Malaysiakini has verified the text as authentic.
Anwar also pointed out that reports by members had previously led to the MACC arresting an officer from the PKR headquarters.
Commenting on Julau, he said the election committee had already lodged its own police report over the aborted polls in the division. 

He ended his text by saying: "In my statement to the media just now, I urged that party leaders be calm and accept the results as best as they can.
"Investigations can be done by police, MACC, and the MCMC."
'I cannot intervene'
In Port Dickson, Anwar was quoted as saying by Bernama that he cannot interfere in the party elections.
"Many have asked me to intervene, but I can't. This is what is not understood, including by the media.
"I can't interfere in the elections besides ensuring that there is no cheating and threats.
"I urge the election committee to appoint those who are truly independent and clean," he said.
Yesterday, Rafizi claimed that 'malware' by the name of Prey had been installed on the tablets in Julau.
Subsequently, the party's central election committee suspended the results from the division polls after what it claimed to be a "cyber attack".
Incumbent Julau PKR chief Semana Sawang, however, disputed Rafizi's version of events.
A tech expert later rubbished claims that Prey is malware.
On its website, Prey brands itself as an anti-theft software that enables users to track their devices but also “wipe data and folders remotely on a lost device."
It further allows users to manage and perform tasks on “thousands of devices” simultaneously.

quote: 2018 was our busiest year yet and we are anticipating further growth in 2019.
content:
By SHAZNI ONG
Senai International Airport in Johor handled 3.52 million passengers last year, a 13% increase from the number of passengers recorded in 2017.
Senai Airport Terminal Services Sdn Bhd (SATSSB) CEO Md Derick Basir said the growth was mainly driven by domestic passengers with an increase of 9% or 234,650 passengers, from 2.68 million in 2017 to 2.91 million last year.
He also said international passenger traffic rose by 37% or 163,127 to 600,000 in 2018, while commercial aircraft movements were 8% higher with a total of 32,574 landings and takeoffs. 
“2018 was our busiest year yet and we are anticipating further growth in 2019.
“The growth was fuelled by the southern region’s rigorous economic activities, escalating the demand for business and corporate travel, as well as the leisure sector,” he said in a statement yesterday.
Md Derick added that the rise in total passenger traffic in 2018 was mainly attributed by the introduction of new routes.
“This includes Seoul by Jin Air; Sanya and Haikou by Malindo Air; as well as Alor Setar and Ipoh by AirAsia, in addition to the increase of flight frequencies for the existing sectors such as Kuala Lumpur, Penang, Kota Kinabalu, Langkawi and Bangkok. 
“We are aggressively collaborating with industry players including tourism bodies and airlines to promote Johor as a destination, ultimately the aim is to encourage the demand for more air connectivity,” he said.
Md Derick said the airport aims to handle 3.76 million passengers this year.
“It is going to be a busy and exciting year for us now that we have also expanded our portfolio to manage Kertih Airport in Terengganu.” 
SATSSB, a member of MMC Group, is the airport operator for Senai International Airport or formerly known as Sultan Ismail International Airport.
Recently, Senai International Airport was awarded “Asia Pacific Regional Airport of the Year 2018” under the less than 10 million annual passengers category by CAPA (Centre for Aviation) for its leading role in using new biometrics technology and its support of the low-cost carrier model. 
Its retail offerings have also improved with the opening of international brands such as Pizza Hut, Gong Cha, WH Smith, O’Briens Irish Sandwich Bar, Boost Juice and Burger King. 
The new outlets offer more value and choices for the airport’s users, in line with its aim to increase both international and local retail brands to cater to the growth of passengers’ movement. 
“Today, it is not just ‘an airport’ for travelling passengers, but has become ‘the place’ for the surrounding working communities to meet for business discussions,” Md Derick said.

content:
Suspek tikam suami isteri di Rawang positif dadah




EDDY HAMIDI
12 Disember 2018 2:23 PM


GOMBAK - Polis mengesahkan suspek yang menikam sepasang suami isteri sehingga mengakibatkan salah seorang daripada mereka maut dalam satu kejadian di sebuah pasar di Batu 16, Rawang dekat sini semalam positif dadah jenis methamphetamine.

Ketua Polis Daerah Gombak, Asisten Komisioner Samsor Maarof berkata, ujian air kencing yang dilakukan ke atas suspek telah mengesahkan bahawa dia berada di bawah pengaruh dadah.
"Suspek yang juga merupakan jiran kepada suami isteri itu ada menyatakan ketidakpuasan hati terhadap pasangan berkenaan namun dia tidak menjelaskan dengan lebih lanjut.
"Siasatan akan diteruskan bagi mengenalpasti motif sebenar kejadian serangan tersebut," katanya ketika dihubungi di sini hari ini.
Kosmo! hari ini melaporkan sepasang suami isteri diserang oleh seorang lelaki yang merupakan jiran mereka dengan menggunakan sebilah pisau sehingga mengakibatkan kematian si isteri.
Dalam kejadian kira-kira pukul 6.40 pagi itu, mangsa, Chong Yoke Wa, 61, cedera di perut manakala isterinya, Yap Choon Mooi, 41, disahkan mati ketika menerima rawatan di Hosptal Selayang di sini akibat tikaman pada bahagian dada.
Menurut Samsor, permohonan reman terhadap suspek telah dibenarkan oleh Mahkamah Sesyen Selayang selama tujuh hari bermula hari ini sehingga 18 Disember depan. - K! ONLINE

Poland's Kaczynski cancels campaign appearance due to health problems


                                Polish ruling party chief Jaroslaw Kaczynski has cancelled a campaign event on Sunday ahead of European Parliament elections due to poor health, officials said, amid uncertainty in Poland over his ability to run the conservative grouping.








                        



FILE PHOTO: Jaroslaw Kaczynski, the leader of the ruling Law and Justice (PiS) party, attends regional elections, at a polling station in Warsaw, Poland, October 21, 2018. REUTERS/Kacper Pempel/File Photo





13 Jan 2019 08:21PM


Bookmark






KRAKOW, Poland: Polish ruling party chief Jaroslaw Kaczynski has cancelled a campaign event on Sunday ahead of European Parliament elections due to poor health, officials said, amid uncertainty in Poland over his ability to run the conservative grouping.Last year, questions over Kaczynski's health weighed on the stock market, as investors worried about political instability were he to step down without a clear successor. Poland's de facto leader was absent from public life for months.
Under Kaczynski's leadership, the eurosceptic Law and Justice (PiS) party has sought to take more control over the economy, public media and the justice system, leading to Poland's isolation within the European Union.It was unclear why Kaczynski cancelled the appearance.Education Minister Jaroslaw Gowin said in a speech to supporters only that he "wished Kaczynski gets over a virus quickly".(Reporting by Wojciech Zurawski; Writing by Anna Koper; Editing by Kirsten Donovan)

KUALA LUMPUR – Srikandi Parti Pribumi Bersatu Malaysia (Bersatu)
menyerah kepada kebijaksanaan Perdana Menteri, Tun Dr Mahathir Mohamad dalam isu desakan agar P Waytha Moorthy digugurkan sebagai menteri.
Ketuanya, Datuk Seri Rina Mohd. Harun berkata, kes tersebut mendapat banyak pandangan yang diberi oleh rakyat dan netizen kerana Menteri di Jabatan Perdana Menteri itu dilihat tidak berjaya mereda keadaan isu Kuil Sri Maha Mariamman ketika itu.
“Secara peribadi beliau perlu melihat dan mengambil ikhtibar serta mendengar pandangan rakyat. Saya tidak pasti kalau beliau boleh memohon maaf bagi meredakan keresahan rakyat.

quote: Saya berpuas hati dalam pertemuan dengan pihak SPRM. Saya amat berterima kasih kerana diberi peluang oleh SPRM untuk membuat penjelasan dengan bukti.
content:
Isu RM90 juta: Nasharudin serah dokumen




MUHAMMAD AYMAN GHAFFA
08 Februari 2019 3:07 PM


PUTRAJAYA - Bekas Timbalan Presiden Pas, Datuk Dr. Nasharudin Mat Isa menyerahkan dokumen penyata kewangan dan akaun bank peribadinya kepada Suruhanjaya Pencegahan Rasuah Malaysia (SPRM) bagi membantu siasatan berhubung dakwaan wang berjumlah RM90 juta yang dimasukkan ke dalam akaun beberapa pemimpin Pas.

Menurut Nasharudin, beliau juga menyerahkan penyata kewangan Yayasan Gerakan Kesederhanaan Global (YGMM) yang dipimpinnya sebelum ini sebagai bukti yang menyokong keterangannya dalam siasatan kes tersebut.
Jelasnya, beliau juga telah memberi keterangan mengenai sumber kewangan dan dana dikeluarkan berdasarkan semua dokumen yang termaktub dalam penyata kewangannya.
"Saya berpuas hati dalam pertemuan dengan pihak SPRM. Saya amat berterima kasih kerana diberi peluang oleh SPRM untuk membuat penjelasan dengan bukti.
"Apabila SPRM diberi ruang untuk membuat siasatan, saya harap semua pihak contohnya mereka yang mengatakan mempunyai bukti untuk tampil ke hadapan dan membawa bukti berkenaan," katanya.
Beliau berkata demikian ketika ditemui pemberita selepas memberi keterangan lebih tiga jam di ibu pejabat SPRM di sini hari ini berhubung dakwaan kes tersebut.
Kosmo! Online semalam melaporkan SPRM akan memanggil empat saksi hari ini untuk membantu siasatan kes tersebut.
Keempat-empat saksi itu terdiri daripada ahli politik dan individu dalam pertubuhan bukan kerajaan (NGO). SPRM juga sedang mendapatkan beberapa dokumen dari pihak bank.
SPRM akan memulakan siasatan ke atas dakwaan beberapa pemimpin Pas menerima wang sebanyak RM90 juta disyaki daripada 1Malaysia Development Bhd. (1MDB).
Selain Nasharudin, Ahli Jawatankuasa Pas Pusat, Nik Mohamad Abduh Nik Abdul Aziz turut hadir memberi keterangan berhubung siasatan kes sama di SPRM Kelantan.
Naib Presiden Parti Amanah Negara (Amanah), Datuk Husam Musa yang dilaporkan akan hadir ke SPRM hari ini untuk memberi keterangan berhubung kes sama bagaimanapun tidak kelihatan di ibu pejabat suruhanjaya itu.
Menurut sumber, Husam tidak dimaklumkan untuk tampil ke SPRM di sini untuk membantu siasatan kes tersebut.
Sementara itu, Nasharudin berkata, beliau memberi sepenuh kepercayaan kepada SPRM untuk menyiasat dakwaan berhubung kes itu.
Jelasnya, beliau yakin dengan profesionalisme pihak SPRM dan menyerahkan siasatan sepenuhnya kepada suruhanjaya itu.
"Biar SPRM siasat dan buat kenyataan sekiranya ada atau tidak mengenai dakwaan itu untuk merungkai kebenaran," katanya. - K! ONLINE

quote: Bomba menerima panggilan kecemasan pada pukul 7.25 malam dan tujuh anggota bomba telah bergegas ke lokasi kejadian.
content:
Empat sekeluarga sesat daki Bukit Melati, ditemui selamat



SEREMBAN - Empat sekeluarga termasuk seorang kanak-kanak lelaki yang sesat selama kira-kira satu jam ketika mendaki Bukit Melati di Nilai dekat sini semalam, berjaya ditemui dalam keadaan selamat.

Pegawai Bomba Kanan II Balai Bomba dan Penyelamat Seremban 2, Raihan Che Mat berkata, empat mangsa yang terdiri daripada seorang lelaki, dua wanita dan seorang kanak-kanak lelaki berusia lima tahun ditemui kira-kira pukul 7.40 malam.
"Bomba menerima panggilan kecemasan pada pukul 7.25 malam dan tujuh anggota bomba telah bergegas ke lokasi kejadian.
"Pasukan penyelamat mendapati kesemua mangsa gagal mencari jalan keluar dan dikhuatiri sesat selepas mendaki bukit berkenaan, namun sejam kemudian mereka ditemui selamat di lokasi 'check point' di Cobra Hill dan dibawa turun ke kaki bukit," katanya ketika dihubungi di sini.
Raihan berkata, kesemua mangsa dibenarkan pulang selepas disahkan tidak mengalami sebarang kecederaan. - Bernama

quote: able to see into the future
content:
Sometime in December 2014, Mahathir chaired a high profile roundtable in London that discussed plans to overthrow Dato’ Seri Najib Tun Razak, the (then) Prime Minister of Malaysia. 
The meeting was attended by Tun Daim Zainuddin and some of Malaysia’s foremost capitalists, the most prominent among them being Tan Sri Ananda Krishnan, the person who ended up selling Tanjong Energy Holdings Sdn Bhd to 1MDB for USD2.81 billion. 
Another prominent capitalist who attended the meeting was Dato’ Justin Leong, the man who architected Getting Malaysia’s expansion in the United Kingdom (UK). 
During the meeting, Daim set a ballpark figure of RM2 billion as the amount needed to trigger a world media campaign against Najib and to grease the palms of some forty to fifty Members of the Malaysian Parliament from across the political divide.

THE THIRD FORCE
(republished, first published in December 2016)
In 1969, the world’s most notorious anarchist-billionaire, George Soros, founded the Double Eagle Fund for Arnhold & S. Bleichroeder, a New York based investment bank he was then the vice-chairman of. With every intent of funding terrorist related activity, Soros decided to set the company up as an offshore entity on the island of Cura&ccedil in the Netherlands Antilles to operate beneath the radars of federal regulators. Now, it didn’t take long before the billionaire earned a reputation for being “able to see into the future” and “predict what was to come” like no other.


The thing is, Soros was able to anticipate circumstances in the financial market with a degree of accuracy that remains unparalleled to this day. However, that accuracy had nothing to do with foresight or a knack for seeing into the future. He simply had friends high up in media who would help him manipulate the market with biased forecasts that served to his intrigues. Soros would later use these friends to publish subversive material which he would then use to trigger regime changes around the world.

Back then, he engaged in extremely convoluted holding schemes that made it virtually impossible to trace the ownerships of his companies. In 1970, he went on to establish the Soros Management Fund (which later came to be known as the Soros Fund) and filled every position in the company with non-Americans. Today, the fund has on board a group of highly notorious Swiss and Italian financiers who are in one way or the other linked to the Rothschilds. These are the very same people running companies linked to the Open Societies Foundation (OSF) that helped Bersih and the Centre to Combat Corruption and Cronyism (C4) bankroll anti-Najib activity.

Early in 2015, the OSF and Quantum began funding a cabal of media hitmen to assist Dr Mahathir Mohammad launch spite filled campaigns against 1MDB and the (then) Prime Minister of Malaysia, Dato’ Seri Najib Tun Razak. Unbeknownst to many, some managers within the Caymans based Quantum Partners LP were complicit with Soros in channelling the funds.
Plans to destroy Khadem Al Qubaisi
Soros’ hitmen weren’t the only hands hired to destroy Najib. Sometime in December 2014, Mahathir chaired a high profile roundtable in London that discussed ways to overthrow the (then) Malaysian premier. The meeting was attended by Tun Daim Zainuddin and some of Malaysia’s foremost capitalists, the most prominent among them being Tan Sri Ananda Krishnan, the person who ended up selling Tanjong Energy Holdings Sdn Bhd to 1MDB for USD2.81 billion.
Another prominent capitalist who attended the meeting was Dato’ Justin Leong, the man who architected Getting Malaysia’s expansion in the United Kingdom (UK). During the meeting, Daim set a ballpark figure of RM2 billion as the amount needed to trigger a world media campaign against Najib and to grease the palms of some forty to fifty Members of the Malaysian Parliament from across the political divide.

By then, Mahathir had long sealed an agreement with Clare Rewcastle Brown to run the gamut of conspiracy against Najib and 1MDB. The agreement came two months after people linked to former British premier Tony Blair offered Clare a glimpse into information that pertained 1MDB and its dealings with the Mideast. Soros, who put Blair up to the idea, wanted Clare to jolt Chinese and Mideast investors out of their existing partnership agreements with the Malaysian fund.
Jumbled in Blair’s stack of information were details to an agreement 1MDB had entered with the Abu Dhabi based International Petroleum Investment Company (IPIC). The agreement was for the funds to guarantee obligations (principal and associated interests) undertaken by two of 1MDB’s subsidiaries, 1MDB Energy Limited and 1MDB Energy (Langat) Limited. The obligations related to bonds worth USD3.5 billion that the subsidiaries issued to raise funds needed for the acquisition of two independent power producers (IPPs), Tanjong Energy Holdings Sdn Bhd and Genting Sanyen Power Sdn Bhd.
Needless to say, the manner in which 1MDB muscled its way into power generation compounded to the frustrations Clare’s husband, Andrew Brown. If you recall, I detailed in part three (READ HERE OR FOLLOW LINK BELOW) how Clare and Andrew were perturbed by the multi-billion dollar agreement the State Grid Development Corporation of China (SGCC) entered with 1MDB. Andrew wanted his wife to funnel into the minds of the Chinese the idea that the Government of Malaysia (GoM) was prone to shady business deals.
As the story goes, both Blair and Soros intended to implicate Khadem Al Qubaisi, then the Managing Director of IPIC, as a key figure in a scheme to siphon millions upon millions of dollars from 1MDB. The duo was not pleased that Qubaisi had blackmailed the chair of IPIC by refusing to return company assets worth some USD20 billion or so. Qubaisi had obtained beneficial interests in those assets while serving as Chairman of Aabar Investments PJS (Aabar), a subsidiary of IPIC fully owned by the government of Abu Dhabi.
To be continued…

quote: MAHB will continue to be among the most profitable Malaysian companies for many years to come.
content: Regulators and policymakers in the airline industry have been urged to rebuff the additional RM23 passenger service charge (PSC), which AirAsia believes is an unfair and unreasonable attempt by Malaysia Airports Holdings Bhd (MAHB).AirAsia Malaysia CEO Riad Asmat said MAHB had argued it needs more profits to operate smaller loss-making airports on behalf of the government, but it is obvious from its exponential growth in profits over the last three years, even after taking into account losses in its Turkish operations, that this is not the case.The airport operator used its monopoly to enrich itself further by revisiting and rescinding the decision to raise the PSC, he said, adding that the additional PSC to be collected would amount to more than RM100 million a year that will go straight to MAHB’s bottom line rather than to the government.“MAHB will continue to be among the most profitable Malaysian companies for many years to come.“But this will come at a cost to the wider Malaysian economy and at the expense of engines of growth such as AirAsia and AirAsia X,” he said in a statement today.MAHB has already imposed a RM50 PSC.Meanwhile, AirAsia X Malaysia CEO Benyamin Ismail opposed the price hike from each passenger travelling through KLIA2, saying it is “unjustified high charges” given its “passenger-unfriendly airport” environment.“Furthermore, since KLIA2 opened, there have been constant flight disruptions and cancellations due to major apron and runway defects, unscheduled closure of runways, ponding of water on the best of days and fuel pipeline ruptures.“We will not be part of this scheme to burden the travelling public by making them pay more for below par services,” he added.- Bernama

quote: but we are not an antidote to gridlock or just bad policy
content:
By AFP
NEW YORK • Most never needed help from a food pantry. But a month since the US government shutdown began, dozens of federal employees have been lining up in Brooklyn for basics.
Customs, tax and emergency management officials are all among the crowd, having gone unemployed since Dec 22.
Others deemed “essential” like transportation workers or prison guards are forced to continue working without pay, taking advantage of their lunch breaks to stock up.
Volunteers are manning distribution tables in the lobby of the New York borough’s Barclays Centre, which usually hosts concerts or sporting events rather than charity drives.
Those in need first register and then fill plastic bags with canned goods, potatoes, chicken, grapes and basic toiletries.
Furloughed federal workers gathering bags of food and milk
“I came here to grab some goods, to be honest,” said Antoinette Peek-Williams, an employee of the Homeland Security Department, who came an hour by subway from Harlem.
“Any way I can save money and put towards something else — that’s what I am trying to do.”
Since the budget impasse began, the 62-year-old lives “day to day — watching what I eat, watching what I spend, not spending”.
“Praying that they make a decision sooner than later.”
She hopes to return to work on Feb 1 — an optimism of which she’s no longer so certain.
“I am a person where the glass is always half-full,” said the mother of a college student.
“I have to stay hopeful,” she said.
“If you don’t have hope, you don’t have anything.”
It’s a sentiment echoed by Chante Johnson, a tax administrator.
But “it’s getting rough”, the 48-year-old said. “It’s coming, like, to the end of everything.”
She provides for a daughter along with her mother, and said she hasn’t been able to sleep or eat healthy since being out of work.
“I just want them to open it up,” she said. “Start talking and open up the government.”
For those federal workers forced to work without pay, the situation is even more tense.
They can only testify anonymously, sworn to confidentiality.
“It is very stressful,” said one 39-year-old single mother, who works as a prison guard at Brooklyn’s federal detention facility.
She came to the food pantry on her lunch break seeking enough to prepare a few meals.
Her daughter is nearing the end of high school, and as students apply for universities, she laments being unable to pay her child’s application fees.
She managed to postpone the monthly bill for her cell phone — which she needs for work — albeit with a late penalty.
But she won’t be able to make it after mid-February.
“After that, I won’t be able to go to work,” she said, adding that she won’t have money to fill her car’s fuel tank.
The shutdown has exacerbated an already precarious situation in a city where soaring rents are pushing more and more families into poverty, said Francisco Tezen, head of development at the Food Bank for New York City.
The non-profit, the city’s largest food assistance organisation, hosted the distribution along with corporate sponsors.
“Something like this is unprecedented, it’s almost equivalent to times when we have had to activate response and services in response to a disaster,” said Tezen.
“Just the length of period of time, and the volatility and the unknowns.” Organisations like his “can be of assistance and help”, he said — “but we are not an antidote to gridlock or just bad policy”.
He refrained from pointing specific blame for the political stalemate, but many in New York, a Democratic stronghold, pin culpability on US President Donald Trump.
In Johnson’s view, the border situation is not dire enough to require the US$5.7 billion (RM23.6 billion) the president has demanded to build a wall.
“What happened? Did a Mexican beat him up as a little boy so he is so gung-ho on this wall?” she asked. “Talk about it and get us back to work.
“Get us back the work that we love doing.”

content:
“Kami Pun Tak Sangka!” - Bersyukur Kerana Masih Kekal di GV5, Elite Terlalu Gembira


Kumpulan Elite yang dianggotai oleh Sasha, Azza dan Linda bersyukur kerana dapat mara ke minggu ketiga Gegar Vaganza 5 (GV5).
Minggu kedua GV5 yang berlangsung malam tadi menyaksikan Safura menjadi bintang pertama yang tersingkir apabila mendapat kutipan markah paling rendah.
“Terima kasih kepada Allah kerana memberikan peluang lagi kepada kami. Kami juga berterima kasih kepada pihak Astro dan produksi kerana memberikan kami ruang untuk bertanding di musim kelima ini.
“Perasaan itu terlalu gembira, kami pun tak sangka dapat kekal bertahan. Kami mengambil setiap komen juri sebagai satu pembakar semangat. Kami berusaha untuk memperbaiki persembahan kami setiap minggu,” kata Azza.
Menyampaikan lagu Bulan Cinta nyanyian asal Amelina, mereka sering berbincang untuk mencapai kata sepakat.
“Sebagai peserta berkumpulan, perbincangan itu memang penting. Jika peserta solo, latihan itu boleh dilakukan bersendirian, tetapi kami harus berkumpul terlebih dahulu.
“Memandangkan kami masing-masing sibuk dengan kerjaya dan keluarga, selalunya kami berbincang menerusi WhatsApp.
“Alhamdulillah, kami saling memahami dan masing-masing berusaha untuk memberikan yang terbaik saban minggu,” kata Linda.
Bersiaran selama lapan minggu, GV5 boleh disaksikan secara langsung di saluran Astro Ria (104) dan Ria HD (123) pada setiap Ahad jam 9malam.
Layari laman web www.gegarvaganza.com.my untuk segala informasi lanjut mengenai GV5.

quote: wide range of alternative sources
content:
SINGAPORE: The local retail price of eggs increased by about 4 per cent between June and November last year, according to Minister for Trade and Industry Chan Chun Sing.He revealed this in a written parliamentary reply on Monday (Jan 14) in response to a question from Non-Constituency Member of Parliament Associate Professor Daniel Goh on the cause behind the increase in the price of eggs in the past six months and whether profiteering has been a factor.
Mr Chan said the import prices of eggs from some of Singapore's import sources have gone up significantly between June and November 2018, some by up to 50 per cent."However, we also have other import sources where the import prices have either remained stable or shown slight declines of up to 7 per cent. As such, the local retail price of eggs has increased around 4 per cent over the same period," he said.Mr Chan added that the price of eggs, and for that matter any food item, is determined by factors that include import prices, exchange rates, logistics costs and profit margins which suppliers can command.To safeguard consumers' interests against sharp and erratic price changes, Mr Chan said a multi-prong strategy must be adopted.
Singapore must first continually and consciously diversify its supply sources and supply chains to avoid being held to ransom by supply discontinuities or supply chain disruptions."This includes sourcing from different countries and building up a certain amount of local capacity where we can and when it makes economic sense," Mr Chan said.Singapore should also maintain a stable and strong Singapore dollar for the benefit of its consumers and to preserve the nation's purchasing power. Lastly, Singapore should maintain an open competitive market structure to prevent any unethical profiteering, he said.Mr Chan added that there is currently "no substantive information" for the authorities to conclude that the recent rise in egg prices was caused by anti-competitive practices.Malaysia said last month that it was looking into limiting or stopping the export of eggs to ensure sufficient supply for its domestic market.In response, Singapore's Agri-Food and Veterinary Authority said that Singapore has a “wide range of alternative sources” for eggs, in line with its food diversification strategy."Our importers are still getting their usual egg supplies from Malaysia," said the authority. "Nevertheless, in line with our overall food diversification strategy, we have a wide range of alternative sources for our eggs, including our local farms."In 2017, egg imports from Malaysia made up 73 per cent of Singapore's egg consumption.Malaysia’s Agriculture and Agro-based Industry Minister Salahuddin Ayub has said that a recent increase in egg prices in the country was partly due to bird flu, which caused a disruption to supply.

Lastly, Singapore should maintain an open competitive market structure to prevent any unethical profiteering, he said.Mr Chan added that there is currently "no substantive information" for the authorities to conclude that the recent rise in egg prices was caused by anti-competitive practices.Malaysia said last month that it was looking into limiting or stopping the export of eggs to ensure sufficient supply for its domestic market.In response, Singapore's Agri-Food and Veterinary Authority said that Singapore has a "wide range of alternative sources" for eggs, in line with its food diversification strategy."Our importers are still getting their usual egg supplies from Malaysia," said the authority. "Nevertheless, in line with our overall food diversification strategy, we have a wide range of alternative sources for our eggs, including our local farms."In 2017, egg imports from Malaysia made up 73 per cent of Singapore's egg consumption.Malaysia's Agriculture and Agro-based Industry Minister Salahuddin Ayub has said that a recent increase in egg prices in the country was partly due to bird flu, which caused a disruption to supply.

quote: Air quality used to be something that people rely on manual methods for information.
content:
By SHAZNI ONG / Pic By BLOOMBERG
THE rising number of chronic diseases linked to poor indoor air quality has brought to light the urgency for a better understanding in addressing the problem.
uHoo co-founder and CEO Dustin Onghanseng said sick building syndrome (SBS) or building-related illness (BRI) has been a cause of concern for most building occupants who fall ill due to poor indoor air quality.
However, he said recent innovations in low-cost air pollution sensors have enabled a new generation of air quality monitoring devices that provide actionable high-resolution data at a fraction of the cost of traditional monitoring systems.
“Air quality used to be something that people rely on manual methods for information.
“However, the technology behind the Internet of Things has improved dramatically that sensors are now so small that you can monitor the quality of air you breathe in your homes or offices,” he said at the launch of the Enviro InteliAQ System in Kuala Lumpur yesterday.
According to Onghansen, a survey revealed that tenants were willing to pay 25% higher rent on better healthy building systems.
“Healthy buildings help shape the competitive price scale for the real estate market and may soon become the dealmaker or breaker in commercial property decisions.
“Also, 64% (of the tenants) in Asia Pacific are willing to pay extra for products and services produced or offered from companies that are committed to positive social and environmental impact,” he said.
Onghanseng added that companies could save up to RM30,000 on return on investment productivity per person per year by enhancing the wellbeing of occupants.
“Having good indoor air quality would lead to the increase of productivity and better decision-making. This is important because we spend more than 80% of our time indoors,” he said.
The Enviro InteliAQ System, which features nine air quality sensors packed into a tiny device about the size of a coffee mug, is first launched in Malaysia before being introduced in other regional markets.
The system, launched by Enviro Group Asia through its subsidiary Enviroverks (M) Sdn Bhd, also saw the group partnering boutique hotel Alila Bangsar.
Its group CEO Nitesh Malani said the collaboration will be a gamechanger for the hospitality industry in the country as the company would help Alila Bangsar to ensure that its guests and staff are exposed to fewer pollutants and contaminations overall.
Enviro Group Asia has also entered into a collaborative distribution and research and development agreement with uHoo International, which will see the group expanding its regional footprint in the building sciences and environmental engineering sector.

quote: 300 artis meminjam Ah Long kerana tiada pekerjaan
content:
PETALING JAYA – Seorang anggota polis memberitahu Mahkamah Majistret di sini, hari ini bahawa pelakon dan pengarah Datuk Farid Kamil Zahari menjerit-jerit di balai polis dan berkata “adakah hang tau aku sapa Aku Datuk Farid Kamil!”
Konstabel Muhammad Nizam Jamaluddin, 24, yang ketika kejadian bertugas sementara di Balai Polis Kota Damansara berkata Farid mengeluarkan kata-kata itu sambil berdiri selepas dia dengan tiba-tiba naik angin setelah beliau memberitahu dia (Farid) tidak boleh membuat laporan polis berhubung satu artikel kerana balai itu mengendalikan kes trafik.
Menceritakan kejadian itu, saksi kedua pendakwaan itu berkata pada pukul 1 tengah hari 11 Jan lepas, Farid telah dibawa oleh saksi pertama kes itu, Ashraf Ahmad, 35, yang memberitahu Farid ingin membuat laporan polis kerana kemalangan.
“Sejurus tiba di kaunter pertanyaan, Farid telah menunjukkan kepada saya sebuah artikel bertajuk “300 artis meminjam Ah Long kerana tiada pekerjaan” dan bertanya kepada saya sama ada artikel itu benar.
“Saya kemudian berkata sekiranya dia mahu membuat laporan mengenai kes itu, dia harus pergi ke balai lain yang berdekatan kerana balai ini hanya mengendalikan kes-kes trafik,” katanya semasa pemeriksaan utama oleh Timbalan Pendakwa Raya Alia Sumayyah Amran pada hari ketiga perbicaraan empat kes jenayah pelakon itu.
Saksi itu memberitahu Farid kemudian tiba-tiba naik angin dan terus berdiri serta menjerit-jerit mengeluarkan kata-kata itu.
“Ashraf cuba menenangkan Farid yang masih dalam keadaan terjerit-jerit di dalam balai namun Ashraf telah ditampar dan saya dengan pantas cuba menghalang tindakan itu dengan berkata “Datuk tidak boleh buat begini, Datuk tak boleh pukul orang awam” sebelum saya juga ditampar olehnya.
“Selain pedih dan sakit di pipi kiri akibat ditampar, namun yang lebih memalukan kerana saya sedang memakai pakaian seragam polis trafik dan kejadian tersebut berlaku di hadapan orang ramai di dalam balai tersebut,” katanya.
Menurut Muhammad Nizam lagi, keadaan Farid yang agresif ketika itu memaksanya untuk menggari tertuduh namun fizikal Farid yang besar dan lebih tinggi daripadanya menyukarkan beliau untuk berbuat demikian.
“Beberapa kali saya mencuba untuk menggarinya namun tidak berjaya tetapi setelah dibantu Ashraf dan seorang lagi orang awam yang berada di dalam balai, Farid akhirnya digari dalam keadaan meniarap,” katanya.
Pada 16 Jan lepas, Farid mengaku tidak bersalah atas empat pertuduhan iaitu dua pertuduhan mendatangkan cedera, menggunakan kekerasan jenayah dan berkelakuan tidak senonoh dengan mengeluarkan perkataan kurang sopan di Balai Polis Trafik Kota Damansara.
Dalam prosiding itu, Farid diwakili peguam Megat Syazlee Mokhtarom dan perbicaraan di hadapan Majistret Nor Ariffin Hisham bersambung esok.
— BERNAMA

quote: Keadaan kesihatan ADUN Pilah semakin positif walaupun banyak cerita kurang tepat yang timbul. daripada cerita perkara tidak baik saya nasihatkan lebih baik kita doakan kesihatannya.
content:
KUALA PILAH – Semua pihak diminta agar tidak menyebarkan khabar angin yang tidak benar berkaitan kedudukan Ahli Dewan Undangan Negeri (ADUN) Pilah, Mohamad Nazaruddin Sabtu, berikutan masalah kesihatan yang dialaminya ketika ini.
Ahli Parlimen Kuala Pilah, Eddin Syazlee Shith berkata sebaliknya, mereka seharusnya mendoakan kesihatan Mohamad Nazaruddin yang juga merupakan Pengerusi Jawatankuasa Bertindak Kesenian, Kebudayaan dan Adat Istiadat Melayu negeri, bagi membolehkan beliau kembali menjalankan tugas seperti biasa.
“Keadaan kesihatan ADUN Pilah semakin positif walaupun banyak cerita kurang tepat yang timbul… daripada cerita perkara tidak baik saya nasihatkan lebih baik kita doakan kesihatannya.
“Saya percaya dan melihat kepada perkembangan positif beliau dari semasa ke semasa, insya-Allah dalam tempoh sesegera mungkin beliau dapat melaksanakan tanggungjawabnya sebaik mungkin,” katanya kepada pemberita selepas majlis penutup Hari Intervensi Kesihatan Kampung Dioh: Jom Tahu dan Amal Kanser Pangkal Rahim dan Kanser Prostat, di sini, hari ini.- BERNAMA

quote: Saya nasihatkan menteri wilayah supaya dapatkan penasihat bertaraf dunia yang boleh memikirkan perkara baru lebih relevan dengan perkembangan yang berlaku di dunia hari ini.
content:
Ketua Umno Seputeh, Mohd Razlan berkata, penerbitan akhbar tersebut semestinya menelan belanja yang besar, tambahan lagi ia diberi percuma.
KUALA LUMPUR: Langkah Kementerian Wilayah Persekutuan menerbitkan akhbar mingguan baru, WilayahKu merupakan pembaziran dana kerajaan, kata pemimpin Umno tempatan, Datuk Mohd Razlan Rafii.
Naib ketua Umno Bahagian Seputeh itu berkata, langkah tersebut bertentangan dengan apa yang dilaungkan kerajaan Pakatan Harapan (PH) kononnya negara perlu berjimat kerana hutang negara begitu besar.
Selain itu katanya, idea menerbitkan akhbar tersebut juga adalah langkah terkebelakang sekiranya ia dibuat sebagai usaha untuk membangunkan negara kerana akhbar cetak tidak lagi menjadi bacaan popular, terutama di bandar besar.
“Dalam bandar besar orang lebih membaca akhbar melalui media elektronik, sebaliknya menteri melancarkan akhbar bercetak,” katanya kepada FMT.
Beliau juga mendesak Khalid mendedahkan kepada umum
kos operasi dan percetakan akhbar tersebut jika kerajaan benar-benar telus.
Katanya, penerbitan akhbar tersebut semestinya menelan belanja yang besar, tambahan lagi ia diberi percuma.
Semalam, Khalid melancarkan akhbar akhbar mingguan baru, WilayahKu dengan berkata, akhbar tersebut tidak boleh dilihat sebagai medium propaganda kerajaan PH, sebaliknya sebagai penghubung antara kerajaan dan masyarakat di ibu kota, Putrajaya dan Labuan.
Khalid berkata, akbar WilayahKu merupakan medium dan usaha menyebarkan inisiatif mensejahterakan rakyat di samping menjadi media penghubung antara kerajaan dan masyarakat.
Akhbar WilayahKu diterbitkan oleh syarikat Wilayah Media Sdn Bhd, sebuah anak syarikat Yayasan Wilayah Persekutuan dan dikendalikan oleh 6 orang kakitangan.
Ia akan diketuai oleh Zulkifli Sulong, yang juga merupakan setiausaha akhbar menteri Wilayah Persekutuan sebagai ketua pengarang, manakala pengarangnya ialah bekas penolong pengarang berita akhbar Kosmo, Helmi Mohd Foad.
Akhbar tersebut dijangka diberikan secara percuma dan diedarkan di masjid, pusat ibadat, surau dan pejabat kerajaan di sekitar Wilayah Persekutuan Kuala Lumpur, Putrajaya dan Labuan.
Pada peringkat permulaan, akhbar berkenaan akan dicetak sebanyak 20,000 naskhah dan jumlahnya ditambah dari semasa ke semasa.
Akhbar untuk jaga kroni?
Razlan yang juga bekas ketua Pemuda Umno Wilayah Persekutuan mendakwa kewujudan akhbar tersebut tidak lebih untuk memberi projek kepada kroni, bukannya membantu rakyat.
Beliau turut mempersoalkan kewajaran Khalid melantik setiausaha akhbarnya sendiri untuk menjadi ketua pengarang akhbar berkenaan.
“Untuk apa akhabar ini diterbitkan? Adakah untuk menjaga kroni dan bazirkan duit Yayasan Wilayah Persekutuan?
“Saya nasihatkan menteri wilayah supaya dapatkan penasihat bertaraf dunia yang boleh memikirkan perkara baru lebih relevan dengan perkembangan yang berlaku di dunia hari ini.
“Rakyat bandar bergantung harap kepada kerajaan untuk terus membangunkan dan membelanjakan wang cukai kepada perkara yang bertaraf dunia tanpa meningkatkan kos kehidupan mereka,” katanya.

quote: Avoid suspicion among each other. Focus fully on efforts to fulfil the hopes of the rakyat which has chosen us to govern.
content: BERSATU AGM | Bersatu president Muhyiddin Yassin has urged Pakatan Harapan to forge better ties at every level in order to fulfil its mandate to the people."Avoid suspicion among each other. Focus fully on efforts to fulfil the hopes of the rakyat which has chosen us to govern."This is the time to rebuild Malaysia," he said. "Do not fight among ourselves. It will only bring damage to us all,” Muhyiddin said in his opening address at the start of the Bersatu national assembly in Putrajaya today.He said Bersatu had to attribute its achievements to being part of the Harapan coalition."The victory of PKR, DAP and Amanah was also because they were part of Harapan. We cannot be alone in this struggle."It is impossible to administer this country alone. We need each other," he said.Muhyiddin also urged Bersatu's women and youth wings to improve efforts to recruit new talent.Muhyiddin had special commendations for Bersatu Youth because of their efforts during the campaign for the May 9 elections."We remember the time when Bersatu Youth was attacked repeatedly by our rivals. However, thanks to your spirit and efforts, we never wavered."Bersatu Youth went forth with courage until our rivals were defeated. I congratulate you," he said.

quote: Dalam tempoh bertudung saya cuba bulatkan hati
content:
GARA-gara memuat naik foto seksi ketika bercuti di Phuket, Thailand, netizen di laman sosial mengaitkan pelakon Sweet Qismina dengan isu Emma Maembong membuka tudung.
Menurut Sweet, 22, dia beranggapan ia mungkin waktu tidak sesuai untuk berkongsi foto tersebut memandangkan isu mengenai Emma hangat diperkatakan.
Bagaimanapun, pemilik nama Farhanna Qismina Supandi ini mengambil komen negatif dan teguran netizen itu secara positif.
ARTIKEL BERKAITAN: Tak salah Sweet Qismina nak keluar dengan Adam Lee
ARTIKEL BERKAITAN: “Dalam tempoh bertudung saya cuba bulatkan hati” - Emma Maembong akhirnya buka tudung


Netizen kaitkan Sweet dengan isu Emma Maembong.
"Kalau ikutkan, saya pernah saja muat naik foto seperti itu ketika bercuti di pulau. Tapi waktu itu tak ada pula nak dikecohkan.
"Mungkin kali ini, waktu tidak sesuai sebab orang tengah hangat perkatakan isu tersebut sebab itu saya dikaitkan dengan Emma.
"Tapi saya ambil sahaja komen dan teguran netizen itu secara positif. Saya anggap mereka tegur sebab nak kita jadi lebih baik," katanya kepada mStar Online.
Sweet diminta mengulas mengenai komen-komen segelintir netizen di laman sosial yang mengatakan dia sama seperti Emma berpakaian seksi ketika berada di luar negara.

Foto Sweet ketika bercuti di Phuket mengundang kecaman.
Dalam pada itu, pelakon drama Cinta Tiada Ganti ini memilih untuk menutup ruang komen di foto tersebut disebabkan tidak mahu ibunya membaca kata-kata netizen yang keterlaluan.
