quote: for their perceived disloyalty to the government and the Chinese Communist Party.
content:
GENEVA: Rights groups urged the United Nations Monday (Feb 4) to send investigators to China's northwestern Xinjiang province to probe the mass detainment of ethnic Uighur and other Muslim minorities."The abuse in Xinjiang today is so severe that it cries out for international action," Human Rights Watch chief Kenneth Roth told reporters in Geneva.
HRW and more than a dozen other human rights and civil society organisations including Amnesty International and the World Uighur Congress, published an appeal for the UN's human rights body to send an international fact-finding mission to the region.Up to a million Uighurs and members of other mostly Muslim minority groups are being held in extrajudicial detention in camps in Xinjiang, according to a group of experts cited by the UN.



                    

UN rights chief Michelle Bachelet has voiced concern about "deeply disturbing allegations of large-scale arbitrary detentions of Uighurs and other Muslim commnities in so-called reeduction camps across Xinjiang" AFP/PETER PARKS


Dolkun Isa of the World Uighur Congress told reporters via video link from Oslo that his group believes the numbers detained in Xinjiang had reached "maybe three million".
Beijing says the "vocational education centres" help people steer clear of terrorism and allow them to be reintegrated into society.But critics say China is seeking to assimilate Xinjiang's minority population and suppress religious and cultural practices that conflict with Communist ideology and the dominant Han culture.In their statement, the organisations insisted that the sites were in fact "political education" camps, where people are sent "for their perceived disloyalty to the government and the Chinese Communist Party."REPORTS OF TORTURE, SUICIDES"In these camps, they are subjected to forced political indoctrination, renunciation of their faith, mistreatment, and in some cases torture," the statement said."There have been reports of deaths inside the facilities including suicides of those unable to bear the mistreatment," Amnesty International head Kumi Naidoo said in a video statement.HRW's Roth lamented "the still muted global outcry.""China gets away with this extraordinarily brazen abuse because first, few people know who the Uighurs are," he said, adding that the lack of outcry was also linked to the fact that "China has shown itself willing to use its economic clout to suppress criticism."Roth pressed UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres "to say something"."He has been notably silent on one of the most important, ... the most brazen human rights abuses, ... because he is worried about upsetting the Chinese," Roth said.UN rights chief Michelle Bachelet has addressed the situation, voicing concern last September before the Human Rights Council at "deeply disturbing allegations of large-scale arbitrary detentions of Uighurs and other Muslim communities in so-called reeduction camps across Xinjiang."She has said her office is seeking access to Xinjiang to check reports about the camps, with Beijing insisting UN officials can come only if they agree to stay out of the country's internal affairs.In their statement, the NGOs insisted that "an international fact-finding mission mandated by the Human Rights Council is needed to uncover the truth."They stressed that China's membership in the 47-seat Human Rights Council "does not exempt it from scrutiny in the face of serious allegations."The reports of "sweeping violations", they said, "require immediate and urgent attention".

quote: Beliau dilaporkan memberi amaran jangan mempertikaikan pelantikan wakil DAP sebagai ahli lembaga pengarah Yadim.
content: Anggota Parlimen Kuala Terengganu Kuala Terengganu Ahmad Amzad Hashim menolak amaran menteri agama Mujahid Yusof dalam isu lantikan anggota lembaga pemegang amanah Yayasan Dakwah Islamiah Malaysia (Yadim).“Menteri di Jabatan Perdana, Mujahid Yusof jangan ingat amaran dari beliau digeruni oleh umat Islam. “Beliau dilaporkan memberi amaran jangan mempertikaikan pelantikan wakil DAP sebagai ahli lembaga pengarah Yadim. “Ingat , 63 peratus rakyat Malaysia adalah umat Islam yang ada had kesabarannya dan tidak teragak-agak mempertahankan Islam jika terus diganggu.“Ingat, amaran Allah SWT mengatasi amaran beliau (Mujahid),” kata wakil rakyat PAS itu menerusi kenyataannya, hari ini.Pelantikan Anggota Dewan Undangan Negeri (Adun) DAP Paloh Sheikh Omar Sheikh Ali sebagai anggota lembaga pemegang amanah Yadim dikritik banyak pihak, terutamanya pembangkang.Bagaimanapun, Mujahid mempertahankan pelantikan itu dan menjelaskan bahawa ia dibuat atas kelayakan Sheikh Omar.Sementara itu, Ahmad Amzad mendakwa DAP berusaha menghalang usaha memperkasakan institusi mahkamah syariah dengan pelbagai alasan.“PAS beri amaran jangan berterusan memberi laluan campur tangan DAP dalam urusan Islam.“DAP berterusan cuba menghalang usaha memperkasakan institusi mahkamah syariah dengan pelbagai alasan,” katanya.

quote: I urge everyone not to take any provocative actions or statements which could lead to unrests.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR – Politicians from both the government and opposition blocks and the leaders of non-government organisations (NGOs) are advised to be careful when issuing statements on the Sri Maha Mariamman temple riots.
According to Prime Minister Tun Dr Mahathir Mohamad, nobody should take advantage on this issue by making it worse.
“I urge everyone not to take any provocative actions or statements which could lead to unrests.
“We want to surrender this issue to the authorities. Thus, I urge everyone in this hall and also the public to be careful when issuing statements or sharing news about the incident as there are many fake news being circulated now.
“Politicians and leaders of non-government organisations, please do not take advantage in this situation,” he said at the Dewan Rakyat today.
Although Malaysia practises the freedom of speech, Mahathir said, everyone needs to ensure that their words were not meant to threaten national peace, especially in causing racial tensions.
“It is not the intention of the government to control your freedom of speech, but, if what is said is untrue and could lead to social unrests, we will not hesitate to take actions.
“The government has promised not to stop news reporting and communications. Howeverm this freedom must be used responsibly and not to create sentiments which can lead to disharmony between the multi-racial nation,” he added.
He is also satisfied with the Royal Malaysia Police (PDRM) which managed to control the situation and at the same time, do not want to blame any quarter.
“This is not the time for finger pointing. The police is entrusted to maintain peace and investigate into the matter,” he said.
Earlier, Minister and Prime Minister’s Department, P. Waytha Moorthy blamed the police in a statement at the Parliament for their slow response during the temple riot.
Selangor Exco V Ganabatirao also used the Facebook to voice his opinion on the commotion by blaming a group of ‘Muslims’ for being involved in the incident, which he later edited to ‘gangsters’. -MalaysiaGazette

quote: deeply disturbing allegations of large-scale arbitrary detentions of Uighurs and other Muslim commnities in so-called reeduction camps across Xinjiang
content:
GENEVA: Rights groups urged the United Nations Monday (Feb 4) to send investigators to China's northwestern Xinjiang province to probe the mass detainment of ethnic Uighur and other Muslim minorities."The abuse in Xinjiang today is so severe that it cries out for international action," Human Rights Watch chief Kenneth Roth told reporters in Geneva.
HRW and more than a dozen other human rights and civil society organisations including Amnesty International and the World Uighur Congress, published an appeal for the UN's human rights body to send an international fact-finding mission to the region.Up to a million Uighurs and members of other mostly Muslim minority groups are being held in extrajudicial detention in camps in Xinjiang, according to a group of experts cited by the UN.



                    

UN rights chief Michelle Bachelet has voiced concern about "deeply disturbing allegations of large-scale arbitrary detentions of Uighurs and other Muslim commnities in so-called reeduction camps across Xinjiang" AFP/PETER PARKS


Dolkun Isa of the World Uighur Congress told reporters via video link from Oslo that his group believes the numbers detained in Xinjiang had reached "maybe three million".
Beijing says the "vocational education centres" help people steer clear of terrorism and allow them to be reintegrated into society.But critics say China is seeking to assimilate Xinjiang's minority population and suppress religious and cultural practices that conflict with Communist ideology and the dominant Han culture.In their statement, the organisations insisted that the sites were in fact "political education" camps, where people are sent "for their perceived disloyalty to the government and the Chinese Communist Party."REPORTS OF TORTURE, SUICIDES"In these camps, they are subjected to forced political indoctrination, renunciation of their faith, mistreatment, and in some cases torture," the statement said."There have been reports of deaths inside the facilities including suicides of those unable to bear the mistreatment," Amnesty International head Kumi Naidoo said in a video statement.HRW's Roth lamented "the still muted global outcry.""China gets away with this extraordinarily brazen abuse because first, few people know who the Uighurs are," he said, adding that the lack of outcry was also linked to the fact that "China has shown itself willing to use its economic clout to suppress criticism."Roth pressed UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres "to say something"."He has been notably silent on one of the most important, ... the most brazen human rights abuses, ... because he is worried about upsetting the Chinese," Roth said.UN rights chief Michelle Bachelet has addressed the situation, voicing concern last September before the Human Rights Council at "deeply disturbing allegations of large-scale arbitrary detentions of Uighurs and other Muslim communities in so-called reeduction camps across Xinjiang."She has said her office is seeking access to Xinjiang to check reports about the camps, with Beijing insisting UN officials can come only if they agree to stay out of the country's internal affairs.In their statement, the NGOs insisted that "an international fact-finding mission mandated by the Human Rights Council is needed to uncover the truth."They stressed that China's membership in the 47-seat Human Rights Council "does not exempt it from scrutiny in the face of serious allegations."The reports of "sweeping violations", they said, "require immediate and urgent attention".

Dolkun Isa of the World Uighur Congress told reporters via video link from Oslo that his group believes the numbers detained in Xinjiang had reached "maybe three million".

extraordinarily brazen abuse because first, few people know who the Uighurs are," he said, adding that the lack of outcry was also linked to the fact that "China has shown itself willing to use its economic clout to suppress criticism."Roth pressed UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres "to say something"."He has been notably silent on one of the most important, ... the most brazen human rights abuses, ... because he is worried about upsetting the Chinese," Roth said.UN rights chief Michelle Bachelet has addressed the situation, voicing concern last September before the Human Rights Council it from scrutiny in the face of serious allegations."The reports of "sweeping violations", they said, "require immediate and urgent attention".

quote: Hopefully I still give myself the best chance to be in the semifinals.
content:
LONDON – Novak Djokovic moved a step closer to a record-equalling sixth ATP Finals crown with a 6-4, 6-1 win over Germany’s Alexander Zverev in London on Wednesday.
The 31-year-old Serb is now unbeaten at the top of the Guga Keurten group with a 2-0 record.
Djokovic will advance to his eighth year-end championships semi-final if American John Isner beats Marin Cilic or if Cilic wins in three sets after the evening session.
The world number one broke late in the first set and twice in the second set to complete the victory in 76 minutes.
“I don’t think it was breathtaking tennis, but a win is a win,” said Djokovic.
“He wasn’t close to his best in the second set so it looked a bit easier than expected because he served very well in the first set, but it dropped in the second set and allowed me to step in.”
However, Zverev had the first two break point opportunities at 4-4 after Djokovic double-faulted, but the Wimbledon and US Open champion escaped with a drop shot to remain ahead.
And a double-fault from Zverev in the next game gifted Djokovic the set after 48 minutes.
“Obviously I had chances in the first set,” said the 21-year-old world number five.
“If I break him at 4-All, we’ll see where the match goes. I think the match was much closer than the score says.
“Hopefully I still give myself the best chance to be in the semifinals.”
Djokovic’s run of 22 matches unbeaten ended at the Paris Masters final with a defeat to Karen Khachanov. Djokovic was struggling with flu symptoms at the time.
The same issue returned in London, where Djokovic often used tissues to wipe his nose between games.
“Somehow I managed to gather the strength when I needed it,” said Djokovic.
“I think also it seemed like Sascha was not feeling really great, definitely not playing well, especially from the back of the court. He made a lot of errors.”
The second set was much quicker as more unforced errors started to build to a match total of 36 for Zverev, and a long backhand conceded the first break for a 3-1 Djokovic lead.
“I just started missing unnecessary balls,” said Zverev.
“Novak, when he’s in the rallies, he’s obviously very hard to beat. He’s playing with a lot of confidence.”
Djokovic broke again for 5-1 with a determined forehand winner before brushing the baseline to open match point and concluded the contest with an overpowering delivery. -DPA

content: Anggota Jawatankuasa Pusat PAS Nik Abduh Nik Abdul Aziz hari ini tampil mengakui rakaman audio yang dikaitkan dengannya sebelum ini.Dalam kenyataan panjang di Facebook hari ini, Ahli Parlimen Bachok itu berkata penafiannya sebelum ini dibuat selepas pimpinan PAS berkeras agar beliau berbuat demikian.Nik Abduh juga berkata keputusan untuk menafikan rakaman audio yang tular sekitar Mac tahun lalu itu mendapat restu Presiden PAS Abdul Hadi Awang."Apabila saya merujuk kepada beberapa pimpinan parti yang sudah pun memahami isu ini dengan baik, mereka memutuskan agar saya menafikannya. "Sengit juga saya enggan dan menolak, tetapi mereka berkeras meminta saya menafikannya. Fitnah mesti ditutup, itu hujah mereka. "Saat itu, bahang PRU14 semakin terasa. Pakatan Harapan (PH) sedang bermaharajalela menyerang PAS dengan pelbagai fitnah sesudah mereka kehilangan punca untuk mencari kecacatan dan kesalahan PAS."PH hanya mampu bersenjatakan fitnah, senjata yang terlarang di dalam Islam dan PAS."Dalam kesukaran, saya memohon jawaban daripada tuan guru Presiden PAS. Segera Presiden PAS merestukan keputusan agar saya segera menafikannya. Saya akur dan gembira menerima mandat," katanya.Untuk rekod, Nik Abduh sebelum ini menafikan rakaman audio yang didakwa mengandungi pengakuan penerimaan dana dari Umno itu, dengan beberapa pimpinan PAS turut mendakwa ia bukan suara Nik Abduh.Bagaimanapun, Setiausaha Agung PAS, Takiyuddin Hassan semalam mengesahkan rakaman audio itu mengandungi suara anggota parlimen Bachok Nik Mohamad Abduh Nik Abdul Aziz.Isu rakaman audio itu muncul semula selepas kes saman fitnah Abdul Hadi terhadap editor Sarawak Report, Clare Rewcastle-Brown ditarik balik dan diselesaikan di luar mahkamah.Rakaman audio yang dikaitkan dengan Nik Abduh itu sempat menjadi pertikaian dalam kes saman fitnah berkenaan.Dalam kenyataan di Facebook hari ini, Nik Abduh memberikan enam "pintu" bagi menjelaskan isu berkenaan.Berikut kenyataan penuh Nik Abduh:Fitnah Audio: Jawaban SayaIni adalah buku kecil, tetapi panjang juga catatannya. Maka saya jadikannya beberapa pintu. Bagi yang kesuntukan masa, tetapi mahukan jawaban, sila ke pintu dua sahaja. Ia mencukupi. Jika lapang masa, silalah berkelana..Pintu 1:Pada pagi 7 Febuari 2019, saya menulis tiga catatan ringkas serentak di FB saya ini.Pertama, saya sifatkan pencinta fitnah adalah seperti lalat yang mengerumuni sampah. Walaupun sampah, akan tetap ada makhluk Allah yang menjadikannya sebagai makanan untuknya. Manusia tidak diciptakan untuk bersifat buruk sebegitu. Jauhi fitnah.Kedua, saya alu-alukan SPRM untuk menyiasat PAS selepas banyak laporan polis dibuat terhadap PAS yang didakwa menerima wang rasuah politik daripada Umno termasuk wang 1MDB. Saya menyatakan bahawa jika PAS diberi kuasa, SPRM akan semakin teguh dan berkuasa.Ketiga, saya memberi sinisan terhadap 'bebudak terlebih tenaga' yang ingin terus menyepak bola walaupun wisel penamat 90 minit telah dibunyikan. Ia adalah sindiran saya terhadap 'Kumpulan 40' yang dikatakan bersedia menjadi saksi benarnya rakaman yang saya sifatkan sebelum ini sebagai 'audio fitnah' terhadap saya.Ia juga adalah isyarat daripada saya bahawa saya sudah bersedia untuk bermain di padang baru. Itu jika padang dibuka.Selepasa cacatan pendek itu diluncurkan, segera sahaja pada petangnya, SPRM menghubungi saya untuk hadir memberi keterangan di pejabat SPRM Kota Bharu pada Jumaat keesokannya pada jam 10.30am.Keesokannya saya hadir dengan penuh kerasmian dan penghormatan terhadap SPRM. Seorang diri dengan memandu sebuah Mercedez Benz mewah rekaan barat.Pintu 2:Pada awal 2018, sebelum PRU14 berlangsung, tular di media baru sebuah rakaman yang didakwa sebagai ucapan Nik Abduh bin Nik Abdul Aziz. Ia mengejutkan ramai kerana isi ucapan itu yang didakwa membenarkan dakwaan musuh politik PAS bahawa PAS telah menerima wang sogokan berjuta-juta daripada Umno.Ia tidaklah begitu mengejutkan saya. Saya sudah pun dimaklumkan lebih awal bahawa akan dibocorkan rakaman ucapan saya di dalam program dalaman parti kepada umum. Cuma saya menggaru-garu kepala, sampai ke tahap ini mereka?Sebaik tular, saya ada dua pilihan di hadapan. Pertama, bercakap benar dan mengesahkannya. Kedua, menafikannya. Ia adalah ucapan dalam majlis tertutup dengan audien tertentu sahaja. Terlalu tertutup. Maka hak saya adalah menjaga kerahsiaan dan tidak sama sekali mengkhianatinya.Kedua-dua pilihan adalah syar'ie.Saya memilih yang pertama. Ia mudah. Bercakap benar akan membebaskan kita. Bohong adalah penjara yang memerangkap diri sendiri. Saya memilih untuk berterus terang sahaja. Saya yakin isi ucapan saya akan mudah sahaja difahami jika difahami konteksnya.Tetapi saya sedar, ia bukan sekadar soal nama baik peribadi saya. Saya mewakili parti PAS dalam masyarakat. Rakaman itu walaupun bertujuan menjatuhkan reputasi saya, ia segera sahaja disambar oleh musuh sebaik tular untuk menjatuhkan PAS. Belum sempat ahli PAS marahkan saya, musuh-musuh politik PAS telah merayakannya. Nyamuk belum mati, api sudah menyambar kelambu.Apabila saya merujuk kepada beberapa pimpinan parti yang sudah pun memahami isu ini dengan baik, mereka memutuskan agar saya menafikannya. Sengit juga saya enggan dan menolak, tetapi mereka berkeras meminta saya menafikannya. Fitnah mesti ditutup, itu hujah mereka. Saat itu, bahang PRU14 semakin terasa. PH sedang bermaharajalela menyerang PAS dengan pelbagai fitnah sesudah mereka kehilangan punca untuk mencari kecacatan dan kesalahan PAS.PH hanya mampu bersenjatakan fitnah, senjata yang terlarang di dalam Islam dan PAS.Dalam kesukaran, saya memohon jawaban daripada tuan guru Presiden PAS. Segera Presiden PAS merestukan keputusan agar saya segera menafikannya. Saya akur dan gembira menerima mandat.Alhamdulillah, api fitnah gagal merebak. PAS memasuki pilihanraya umum ke14 dengan gagah dan berjaya menambah kekuatannya di Parlimen dan DUN-DUN.Pintu 2 adalah pemberitahuan bahawa jawaban pertama saya dulu adalah dengan keputusan oleh parti PAS.Pintu 3Ada tiga institusi yang berhak mengubah keputusan pertama saya itu. Pertama, parti PAS. Ia adalah tuan saya. Kedua, Mahkamah. Ia adalah neraca menegak keadilan di dunia. Ketiga,kKerajaan Malaysia melalui siasatan oleh pihak polis atau SPRM. Malaysia adalah negara saya yang berhak ke atas saya.Dengan erti, saya akan kekal menyimpan rahsia sehingga salah satu daripada tiga institusi itu memutuskan sebaliknya.Apabila perempuan Inggeris itu menjadikan rakaman ucapan saya itu sebagai bahan buktinya di Mahkamah London, saya dipanggil oleh pihak peguam yang mewakili presiden PAS untuk memohon pengesahan. Saya kata, mahkamah berhak menerima kebenaran. Ia akan membebaskan saya dengan penuh hormat. Isi-isi ucapan saya adalah amat mudah difahami dalam konteksnya. Presiden PAS menerima kehendak saya dengan senang hati. Maka saya telah membuat kenyataan saya di hadapan peguam presiden PAS beberapa bulan lepas.Saya jangka keputusan oleh Mahkamah London nanti dalam kes Presiden PAS vs perempuan Inggeris itu akan menjadi jawaban kedua saya. Tetapi ia tidak berlaku. Kes itu ditutup di pertengahan jalan.Sebelum SPRM memanggil saya untuk siasatan, saya sudah pun dipanggil oleh pihak polis beberapa bulan lepas di Kuala Lumpur untuk memberi keterangan terhadap isu rakaman ucapan saya yang tular itu.Kenyataan saya kepada ketiga-tiga institusi tersebut adalah sama. Saya mengakui kebenaran suara saya itu. Saya juga menegaskan di hadapan mereka untuk saya terus menafikannya di hadapan publik sebagai hak menjaga kerahsiaan yang ditekankan oleh agama.Semasa saya mempertegaskan hak kerahsiaan ini di hadapan pegawai SPRM beberapa hari lepas, mereka menjawab, "Ya. Kami pegawai kerajaan, apatah SPRM diwajibkan dan diajar untuk menjaga kerahsiaan." Mereka membenarkan saya.Akhirnya, semalam, Dato Takiyudin Hasan, SUA PAS mengesahkan rakaman itu sebagai ucapan saya. Pagi ini, presiden PAS turut mengesahkannya.Pintu 3 adalah pemberitahuan bahawa PAS telah bersetuju untuk saya memberi jawaban kedua yang menukarkan jawaban pertama saya dulu. Saya menerimanya dengan senang hati sebagaimana yang pertama dulu.Ini saya sedang menulis..Pintu 4Mari saya memanggil mereka sebagai 'bebudak terlebih tenaga' atau 'kumpulan 40'. Tidak perlulah saya menyebut nama.Pintu 4 adalah pendedahan terhadap konteks perbincangan di dalam perjumpaan tertutup 'tahap dewa' tersebut. Bukankah saya berkali-kali mengingatkan kerahsiaan itu? #SumpahJadiAbu haha..Ada dua isi utama ucapan saya:1) Meminta 'kumpulan 40' ini berhenti daripada kegiatan menyiasat dan menghukum pimpinan parti.2) Menerangkan hukum agama berkaitan mengambil wang musuh politik. Secara khusus, wang Umno.Perlu difahami bahawa perjumpaan itu bukanlah yang pertama dan terakhir. Ia selang seli di antara beberapa pertemuan dan tindakan yang berbeza.Maka memang agak sukar bagi pendengar di rakaman tular itu untuk memahaminya sepenuhnya. Apatah ia soal kerahsiaan dalaman.KAMI adalah kumpulan yang terbentuk pada saat krisis dalaman PAS sebelum 2015. Kami adalah rakan-rakan yang bersama menyusun strategi memahamkan ahli PAS bahawa beberapa pimpinan parti telah lari daripada halatuju perjuangan dan wajar diturunkan lalu diganti dengan kepimpinan baru yang lebih berwibawa untuk memimpin PAS.Adalah sukar untuk memahamkan. Ahli PAS diajar untuk taat dan thiqah kepada kepimpinan parti. Adalah sukar bagi kami untuk menyebut kesalahan-kesalahan mereka secara terbuka. Ia janggal di dalam parti yang begitu menjaga keutuhannya daripada retak.Ringkasnya, dengan perancangan yang baik, kami berjaya meyakinkan ahli parti di semua peringkat untuk bangkit mempertahankan kepimpinan ulamak, kepimpinan tuan Presiden PAS dan kekuasaan Majlis Syura Ulamak PAS daripada diruntuhkan secara sistematik oleh kumpulan yang kini dihimpunkan oleh DAP di dalam parti PAN.Dalam erti, kami merancang setelah mereka telah lama merancang. Mereka terlalu kuat sehingga beberapa pimpinan lama PAS gugur dengan perancangan mereka tanpa disedari oleh ahli-ahli PAS yang ikhlas berjuang.Saat kekuasaan mereka memuncak untuk mengubah hala tuju PAS dengan faham Islam Moderate, Rahmatan Li 'rambutan' dan macam-macam lagi, kami anak muda PAS bangkit untuk meneguhkan kembali halatuju perjuangan PAS.Kami adalah himpunan ratusan ulamak dan ulamak muda, golongan profesional baru dan lama, muslimat dan pemuda serta ahli-ahli PAS di banyak peringkat.Ringkasnya, pada Muktamar PAS 2015, kepimpinan baru PAS mengambil alih. Selepas itu, kesamaran bertukar kejelasan. DAP hanya mencapai matlamat kedua mereka. Tertubuh PAN. Matlamat utama mereka menghancurkan PAS dari dalam telah gagal.Inilah kami.Selepas selesai, kepimpinan kami memutuskan agar kami bubar dan kembali kepada kerja asal membangunkan parti yang hampir berwajah baru. Ia adalah keputusan yang amat benar.Tetapi sebahagian daripada kami berkata, kerja belum selesai. Masih ada saki baki yang akan merosakkan PAS. Mangsa pertama adalah YAB Dr Ahmad Samsuri. Beliau dituduh sebagai ejen Umno, makan dedak Umno bla bla.. kemudian Nasrudin Hasan Tantawi, Nurul Islam. Akhirnya Nik Abduh naik nama sebagai pemakan wang Umno.Mereka dinasihatkan agar berhenti. Bukti-bukti yang mereka kemukakan adalah lemah. Ia hanyalah sangka buruk. Malang, mereka terus mengasak dan menuduh.Kerja mereka adalah mengintip dan menyelongkar. Bagi mereka ia adalah jihad besar menyelamatkan parti PAS daripada perkara haram bersekongkol dengan UMNO.Apabila diingatkan bahawa kepimpinan parti lebih mengetahui halatuju dan strategi parti, mereka meremehkan dan mendakwa mereka lebih tahu.Mereka melampaui batas. Bertindak sendiri tanpa restu kepimpinan. Beberapa perjumpaan diadakan. Tetapi tiada apa yang berubah.Apabila ahli PAS sukar menerima mereka, mereka memilih jalan berapi demi mencapai matlamat. Mereka, atas nama menyelamatkan parti, mendedahkan rakaman ucapan tertutup saya itu.Mereka mengadakan perjumpaan tertutup 'tahap dewa' itu, tetapi mengkhianati majlis mereka sendiri dengan merakamnya secara sulit. Setelah gagal, mereka khianat lagi dengan mendedahkannya kepada awam. Setelah gagal lagi mencapai matlamat, mereka bangkit beramai-ramai ingin menjadi saksi. Pelik, mereka nafi dedah, tetapi sanggup jadi saksi?!Cuba anda bayangkan bagaimana kerasnya mereka dalam salah satu tulisan terbaru mereka, mereka anggap saya seperti mendiang Marcos.. Dahsyatkan? Marah orang PAN pada saya, rasanya taklah seteruk itu dilabel hehe..Pintu 5Kekhilafan besar adalah dalam soal hukum mengambil wang orang UMNO. Mereka mendakwa, mengambil wang UMNO adalah rasuah semuanya. UMNO adalah musuh dan sebarang terimaan adalah berunsur rasuah.Saya dalam rakaman tersebut, selepas berkali-kali di luar sebelum itu, cuba menjelaskan bahawa ia adalah hukum yang salah dan merbahaya.Saya jelaskan bahawa menerima wang sesiapa pun daripada UMNO adalah haram hanya apabila ianya adalah berbentuk rasuah atau sogokan atau dedak yang bermaksud kita dengan pemberian itu terpaksa menjual perjuangan dengan mencairkan pendirian parti atau menyokong tindakan UMNO yang bersalahan dengan polisi parti.Adapun pemberian biasa seperti kekeluargaan, persahabatan, derma, kebajikan dan lain-lain, maka ia adalah harus. quote: Anggota polis mengarahkan suspek berhenti namun tidak diendahkan malah dia memecut menghala ke Taman Debunga.
content:
Pemandu kereta cuba lari pemeriksaan polis parah langgar tembok




ATIKAH DALI
20 Oktober 2018 6:53 PM


JASIN - Seorang pemandu kereta parah selepas kereta yang dipandunya terbabas dan melanggar tembok rumah ketika melarikan diri daripada polis di Taman Debunga, Merlimau di sini hari ini.

Dalam kejadian pada pukul 6.30 pagi itu, suspek yang berusia 30 tahun dari Cheras, Kuala Lumpur dapat diberkas polis dan pemeriksaan lanjut menemui tiga paket dadah jenis heroin di dalam kereta jenis Proton Wira yang dipandunya.
Ketua Polis Daerah Jasin, Deputi Superintendan Arshad Abu berkata, sebelum kejadian sepasukan anggota polis yang melakukan rondaan terserempak dengan kereta suspek yang dipandu dalam keadaan mencurigakan berhampiran masjid Kampung Simpang.
"Anggota polis mengarahkan suspek berhenti namun tidak diendahkan malah dia memecut menghala ke Taman Debunga.
"Kenderaan tersebut bagaimanapun hilang kawalan sebelum terbabas melanggar sebuah kenderaan jenis Naza Ria yang diparkir di hadapan rumah dan tembok rumah di taman berkenaan," katanya dalam satu kenyataan di sini hari ini.

Kenderaan yang dipandu suspek rosak teruk selepas melanggar kereta lain dan tembok rumah.

 
Menurut Arshad, pemeriksaan lanjut pihaknya menemui tiga paket disyaki heroin dan sebilah sabit di dalam kereta yang dipandu suspek.
Katanya, suspek yang mengalami kecederaan serius dihantar ke Hospital Melaka bagi mendapatkan rawatan dan ditahan untuk siasatan lanjut.
"Ujian air kencing mendapati pemandu kereta itu positif dadah jenis syabu. Dia juga mempunyai 22 rekod jenayah berkaitan dadah dan jenayah selain turut dikehendaki polis," katanya.
Kes tersebut disiasat di bawah Seksyen 42 (1) Akta Pengangkutan Jalan 1987 dan Seksyen 39  (A)(1) Akta Dadah Berbahaya 1952 serta Seksyen 6 (1) Akta Barang Hakisan dan Senjata Berbahaya. - K! ONLINE

content:
The leap in rents comes as Spain is still reeling from a devastating economic crisis that kicked off in 2008
By AFP
MADRID • Capsule flats, price rises forcing tenants out: Rents in Spain are soaring post-crisis, fuelling concerns of a new “bubble” in a country still traumatised by the collapse of its housing sector.
Ruth Melida is in a jam. In April, she found out that the monthly rent of her flat where she lives with her unemployed husband and two children would rise from €605 (RM2,946) to €999.
That leaves the family with under €200 to spare for other expenses. And the situation could get worse if her husband’s unemployment benefits run out next month.
“What do we do, those of us who don’t have the means? Do we go live in the woods?” asked the 41-year-old, who lives in San Sebastian de los Reyes outside Madrid.
Like her, more and more Spaniards are having trouble paying their rising rents, with many forced to move, particularly in Madrid and Barcelona, as they struggle on low salaries or benefits.
“People who have lived all their lives in a neighbourhood have to leave for increasingly peripheral districts that are adapted to their budget,” warned Marta Montero, spokeswoman of an association for the right to housing in Madrid.
In the second quarter (2Q), rents rose 15.6% year-on-year (YoY) in Spain, according to real-estate website Idealista.
Since 2010, they have increased by 35% in Barcelona and 30% in Madrid.
“Every time I’ve left an apartment, its price has then risen €50 to €100 on Idealista,” said Angel Serrano, a consultant in Madrid.
Spain Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez has promised a housing law whose exact details remain unclear, but would likely include a rise in the minimum length of a rental contract from three to five years.
The leap in rents comes as Spain is still reeling from a devastating economic crisis that kicked off in 2008 when a housing bubble burst, leading to the eviction of thousands of indebted families who had bought their homes on credit.
As a result, “most people resorted to renting by necessity”, said Beatriz Toribio, head of research for realestate web portal Fotocasa.
One company caused a scandal this month in Barcelona, offering tiny, three sq m (32 sq ft) “capsule” rooms built one on top of the other in a house with shared living spaces for €200 a month.
According to the European Union (EU) Eurostat statistics agency, 43% of Spaniards who rent private housing spent more than 40% of their earnings on rent in 2016, compared to an average of 28% in the EU.
Waiting for Eviction
“We’re living in a rent bubble,” said Montero, who blames investment funds that have snapped up billions of euros in real-estate assets from banks, which themselves seized them from indebted families.
That’s what happened to Melida’s flat complex, which was social housing when she moved there in 2014, but was then snapped up by an investment fund that raised rents, forcing dozens of residents to leave. They can’t pay the new rent and are waiting to be evicted.
But for Fernando Encinar, co-founder and head of research at Idealista, talking about a “bubble” is wrong as he said the current rise in rents is not due to speculation, but the consequence of an economic recovery that began in 2014.
Spain forecast economic growth of 2.7% — this after three years of growth of 3% or over.
Encinar said lower rental prices “weren’t real” several years ago and corresponded to “a crisis situation”.
From 2010, thousands of homeowners chose to rent out their places rather than sell them as there were no buyers in a country where the norm had been to own your flat or house, and they had to charge low prices.
Still, faced with the current rise, Madrid’s left wing city hall is battling Airbnb-type seasonal rentals they accuse of driving up prices.
The city hall in Barcelona is trying to encourage owners of empty housing to rent their properties out.
Far-left party Podemos, meanwhile, has submitted a bill in Parliament regulating rents and banning the eviction of tenants who cannot be re-housed. But others said that’s not the solution.
Toribio said more social housing should be built in a country where it only represents 2.5% of all housing, according to the Housing Europe foundation.
The government wants to build 20,000 units of social housing in four to six years.

Iraq must move away from economic reliance on Iran - British official


                                Iraq must wean itself off economic reliance on Iran and become more energy self-sufficient, Britain's foreign office minister for the Middle East said on Sunday.








                        



FILE PHOTO: Iraq's President Barham Salih attends the Rome Mediterranean summit MED 2018 in Rome, Italy November 22, 2018. REUTERS/Max Rossi





28 Jan 2019 01:20AM


Bookmark






BAGHDAD: Iraq must wean itself off economic reliance on Iran and become more energy self-sufficient, Britain's foreign office minister for the Middle East said on Sunday.Alistair Burt visited Iraq after a flurry of high-profile diplomacy in Baghdad this month that followed U.S. President Donald Trump's surprise announcement he was pulling American troops out of Syria.
U.S. allies worry the withdrawal, even if it proceeds more slowly than initially planned, will embolden Iran, whose influence has grown in Iraq and Syria in recent years.Washington hopes to counter Iranian influence through renewed sanctions, and has pressured Iraq to halt imports of Iranian gas."To expect Iran to have no influence in Iraq is fanciful," Burt said in an interview with Reuters at the British Embassy in Baghdad."What is important is that Iraq finds the opportunity to follow its own future in terms of foreign relations and that its economy is strong, and isn't reliant on Iran."
Burt said Iraq must convert oil resources to become more self-sufficient. "The sooner all its oil wealth can come on stream and can capture all the energy that is sometimes not used as effectively as possible ... the better," he said.Iraq's oil export capacity is nearly 5 million barrels per day, although it is pumping below capacity in line with an OPEC agreement to reduce production to stabilise prices. Washington hopes it can reduce its gas flaring to satisfy domestic energy needs and rely less on Iranian power imports.Burt said there were ideas for more power projects in Iraq, without elaborating.U.S.-IRAN TENSIONS MOUNTHe doubted that a military escalation between the United States and Iran in Iraq or Syria was imminent, but warned of "confrontation which might occur should there be a miscalculation."Tension has ramped up between Washington's chief regional ally Israel, and Iran and its allies in Syria and Iraq in recent weeks. Israel struck what it said were Iranian targets near Damascus on Monday in an increasingly open assault on Iran's presence there.Burt said Britain remained concerned about the threat from Islamic State in the region especially after the U.S. decision to withdraw troops, and that London would continue to support Baghdad's efforts against remaining IS militants who have stepped up insurgent-style attacks in Iraq.(Reporting by John Davison; Editing by Andrew Cawthorne)

content:
269 PATI diserbu ketika tidur




MOHD. YUNUS YAKKUB
02 Januari 2019 1:48 PM


KLANG - Seramai 269 pendatang asing tanpa izin (PATI) yang sedang nyenyak tidur hanya mampu terkedu apabila dikejutkan pihak berkuasa dalam OP Bersepadu Cegah Jenayah Ambang Tahun Baharu di tiga lokasi berasingan di daerah ini awal kelmarin.

Dalam serbuan selama lapan jam bermula pukul 10 malam itu, kesemua PATI yang ditahan berusia 20 hingga 50 tahun.
Ketua Polis Daerah Klang Utara, Asisten Komisioner Nurulhuda Mohd. Salleh berkata, operasi dilakukan di sekitar rumah kongsi dan premis perniagaan di sekitar Bandar Sultan Sulaiman, Jalan Klang Sentral dan Taman Sungai Kapar Indah hasil maklumat awam dan risikan pihaknya.
Katanya, tangkapan itu juga hasil pemeriksaan terhadap 274 warga asing di tiga lokasi berkenaan.
"Kesemua PATI yang ditahan melibatkan 253 lelaki dan 16 wanita.
"Mereka terdiri daripada warga Bangladesh (123), India (51), China (49), Myanmar (25), Indonesia (16), Nepal (2) dan masing-masing seorang bagi Kemboja, Vietnam dan Pakistan," katanya dalam kenyataan di sini hari ini.
Menurut beliau, kesemua mereka didapati melakukan kesalahan mengikut Seksyen
6(1)(c) dan 15(1)(c) Akta Imigresen dan diserahkan kepada Jabatan Imigresen untuk tindakan lanjut.
Nurulhuda turut memberitahu, pihaknya turut menahan dua lelaki masing-masing berusia 18 dan 31 tahun atas kesalahan dadah serta merampas sepeket dadah jenis ganja seberat 4.09 gram.
"Seorang daripada suspek yang  dipercayai pengedar dadah sejak tiga tahun lalu ditahan mengikut Seksyen Seksyen 3(1) Akta Dadah Berbahaya (Langkah-langkah Pencegahan Khas) 1952," katanya. - K! ONLINE

quote: As of now we mourn the loss of three human lives and 172 injured people are receiving aid
content:
by BERNAMA / pic by AFP
HAVANA – A rare and powerful tornado has devastated sections of Havana, overturning cars, uprooting trees and leaving homes in shambles. 
Three people were killed and 172 injured, Cuban President Miguel Diaz-Canel said.
A shaken resident, recalling a night of terror, said she clutched her daughter and crouched down in her kitchen as the tornado came roaring in Sunday night.
“It was as if rocks were falling – it was hail – and I felt things beginning to fall. It lifted my entire roof, and took everything away,” Canaima Hernandez, 36, said, sobbing.
Hernandez’s Havana neighbourhood, Regla, was one of the hardest hit by the tornado, which state media said was comparable in strength to the most powerful hurricanes.
Residents picked their way through overturned vehicles, collapsed walls, overturned lampposts, and uprooted trees on Monday morning.
Diaz-Canel, who toured the city’s darkened streets visiting emergency crews, wrote on Twitter that damage was “severe.”
In the city’s Luyano neighbourhood storm debris – including parts of a balcony ripped off an old building – blocked the streets.
As emergency sirens blared across the city, firefighters and ambulances rushed about on rescue missions, their flashing lights giving light to blacked out areas.
“As of now we mourn the loss of three human lives and 172 injured people are receiving aid”, Diaz-Canel tweeted.
He added that several emergency teams were working hard to restore power to blacked-out areas.
At the Hijas de Galicia maternity hospital staff were forced to evacuate the building due to storm damage.
The tornado, spawned by a powerful storm that originated in the Gulf of Mexico, hit western Cuba with winds of up to 100kmh.
“Islanders are used to these warnings, but they did not suspect the magnitude of what was approaching,” said Granma, the Communist Party daily.
People described the tornado as having “the sound of a jet engine”, and reported feeling changes in the environmental pressure when it arrived, Armando Caymares with the Institute of Meteorology said.
The tornado “caught me in the street, in the car with my wife and children,” actor Luis “Panfilo” Silva wrote on his social media account.
“I had to dodge fallen trees, flooded areas and strong winds until I managed to get home. We experienced great fear,” he wrote.
High winds sent sea water surging over the city’s famed Malecon esplanade and several meters into the city. The western provinces of Pinar del Rio, Artemisa and Mayabeque also were affected by the storm.

quote: Yusri bersetuju untuk menyambung kontrak setahun lagi sehingga 2019 bersama pasukan The Red Warriors yang mana pada musim ini dia dipertanggungjawab mengendalikan pasukan sebagai pemangku jurulatih.
content:
Yusri dilantik ketua jurulatih The Red Warriors



KOTA BHARU - Persatuan Bola Sepak Kelantan (KAFA) secara rasmi melantik Yusri Che Lah sebagai Ketua Jurulatih The Red Warriors bagi menghadapi saingan Liga Malaysia (Liga-M) musim depan.

Presidennya, Bibi Ramjani Ilias Khan berkata, keputusan tersebut diambil selepas mengadakan perbincangan dengan jurulatih kelahiran Perlis itu pada 12 November lepas.
"Yusri bersetuju untuk menyambung kontrak setahun lagi sehingga 2019 bersama pasukan The Red Warriors yang mana pada musim ini dia dipertanggungjawab mengendalikan pasukan sebagai pemangku jurulatih.
"Ia satu keputusan positif (kepada pasukan) memandangkan kita mempunyai Petunjuk Prestasi Utama (KPI) untuk kembali ke Liga Super musim 2020," katanya dalam satu kenyataan di sini hari ini.
Musim ini Yusri diberikan kepercayaan mengemudi TRW  sebagai pemangku jurulatih sebanyak dua kali selepas KAFA memecat jurulatih dari Thailand, Sathit Bensoh pada awal musim dan peletakan jawatan jurulatih dari Syria, Fajr Ibrahim pada pertengahan musim ini. - Bernama

Dapatkan berita yang paling viral setiap hari:






Bukan senang nak jadi ahli politik, kejap kena berbaik dengan orang tu, kejap kena berbaik dengan orang ni. Tak suka macam mana pun pada seseorang, mereka semua tetap kena bekerjasama demi kepentingan rakyat.
Contohnya Dr. Mahathir yang dulu habis-habisan perangi Anwar Ibrahim, tapi sekarang dia dah jalinkan hubungan baik dengan ketua pembangkang tu. Disebabkan hal ni, PM Najib kita menyifatkan yang Dr. M layak dapat anugerah lakonan.
Dr. M layak dapat Anugerah Pelakon Terbaik Academy Awards
Menurut Sinar Harian, calon Perdana Menteri pembangkang tu layak dapat Anugerah Pelakon Terbaik di Academy Awards sebab kelakuannya yang macam talam dua muka. PM Najib memberitahu yang tingkah laku Dr. M agak pelik sebab sekarang dia bersekongkol pulak dengan musuh.

quote: Nama saya bukan Muhammad Sajjad.
content:
Nur Sajat. Foto Bernama
SELEPAS nama Muhammad Sajjad kecoh sehingga mencetuskan kontroversi ekoran kes mahkamah, usahawan kosmetik yang lebih dikenali sebagai Nur Sajat Kamaruzzaman tampil memperkenalkan nama baharunya.
Pengumuman yang dibuat pada pagi Selasa memaklumkan bahawa nama Nursajadiah menjadi pilihan Sajat untuk akaun Instagramnya yang baru dibuka pada Isnin.
Menerusi satu video yang dimuat naik di akaun Instagram @coach_yin, Sajat memberitahu Nursajadiah merupakan akaun 'back up' sebagai ganti kepada akaunnya sebelum ini.
"Ramai betul yang buat IG (Instagram) Nursajat sekarang ni. Dan ramai yang DM (mesej secara langsung) saya, tanya mana satu IG Nursajat yang betul. 
"Untuk menjawab semua pertanyaan netizen-netizen, ini IG terbaharu Nursajat @nursajadiah," kata Coach Yin atau nama sebenarnya Mohd Tishrin Mohd Adnan.
ARTIKEL BERKAITAN: “Nama saya bukan Muhammad Sajjad…”
ARTIKEL BERKAITAN: Akhirnya Jakim Dedah Identiti Sajat


Pengumuman mengenai akaun baharu Instagram Sajat.

Sajat sebelum ini mempunyai akaun Instagram @nursajat23, bagaimanapun difahamkan ia dipadam oleh pengendali laman sosial itu berikutan akaun tersebut didakwa melanggar syarat dan panduan pengguna.

Sejak itu, banyak akaun media sosial palsu mula diwujudkan dengan menggunakan nama ahli perniagaan berusia 34 tahun itu.

Pada Disember tahun lalu, nama Muhammad Sajjad mencetuskan kekecohan selepas nama berkenaan didedahkan ketika Sajat dihadapkan ke mahkamah membabitkan kesalahan Akta Cukai Barang dan Perkhidmatan (GST) 2014.

Bagaimanapun menurut laporan, Sajat menafikan nama tersebut sebagai tidak benar dan menjelaskan namanya yang sebenar adalah Sajat Kamaruzzaman.



Akaun baharu Instagram Sajat dengan nama Nursajadiah.
Nur Sajat didenda RM2,700 oleh Mahkamah Sesyen Shah Alam selepas mengaku bersalah terhadap tiga pertuduhan gagal mengemukakan penyata GST kepada Ketua Pengarah Kastam Malaysia.

Mengikut semua pertuduhan, Nur Sajat didakwa gagal mengemukakan penyata perniagaan kepada Ketua Pengarah Kastam Malaysia mengikut cara yang ditetapkan sepanjang 1 April 2015 hingga 30 Jun 2015, 1 Oktober 2015 hingga 31 Disember 2015 dan 1 Januari 2016 hingga 31 Mac 2016.

Nur Sajat didakwa melakukan kesemua kesalahan itu di Jabatan Kastam Diraja Malaysia, Kompleks Kastam Wilayah Persekutuan Kuala Lumpur di Kelana Jaya, Petaling Jaya, antara 22 Oktober 2015 hingga 16 Jun 2016.
Dia dihukum mengikut Seksyen 41 (6) Akta GST yang memperuntukkan hukuman denda maksimum RM50,000 atau penjara maksimum tiga tahun atau kedua-duanya sekali.
Pendakwaan dikendalikan oleh Pegawai Pendakwa Kastam, Noor Asyikin Md Rodhi sementara ahli perniagaan itu tidak diwakili peguam

quote: Saya sendiri melancarkan penempatan semula perkampungan Orang Asli Sungai Ruil di Cameron Highlands. Kita boleh lihat sendiri betapa rumah kediaman mereka ketika ini sangat selesa.
content:
PEKAN – Bekas Pengerusi Barisan Nasional (BN) Datuk Seri Najib Razak yakin parti itu dapat mengekalkan kemenangan pada Pilihan Raya Kecil (PRK) Parlimen Cameron Highlands pada 26 Jan ini.
Beliau berkata, jangkaan itu dibuat selepas mengambil kira ‘mood’ semasa rakyat yang kecewa dengan kerajaan Pakatan Harapan (PH) yang beliau dakwa gagal menunaikan banyak janji semasa berkempen pada Pilihan Raya Umum Ke-14 (PRU-14).
“Ia (gagal menunaikan janji) boleh menjadi faktor utama penolakan oleh pengundi di kawasan terbabit. Kita (BN) ada peluang baik untuk mempertahankan kerusi Parlimen Cameron Highlands berdasarkan suasana dan mood rakyat ketika ini.
“Kalau semua jentera BN menggunakan strategi yang betul maka tiada masalah untuk kita kekalkan kerusi (Parlimen Cameron Highlands) itu,” katanya selepas merasmikan Majlis Penyampaian Bantuan Awal Persekolahan anjuran Yayasan Pahang dan Pejabat Anggota Parlimen Pekan di Sekolah Menengah Agama (SMA) Tengku Ampuan Fatimah dekat sini, hari ini.
PRK Parlimen Cameron Highlands diadakan selepas Mahkamah Pilihan Raya pada 30 Okt lepas, membatalkan kemenangan calon BN Datuk C. Sivarraajh pada PRU14 ekoran berlaku unsur rasuah untuk mendapatkan undi.
Suruhanjaya Pilihan Raya (SPR) menetapkan 12 Jan ini sebagai tarikh penamaan calon.
Pada perkembangan lain, Najib yang juga Anggota Parlimen Pekan menempelak dakwaan Penasihat DAP Lim Kit Siang yang mendakwa kerajaan BN sebelum ini tidak banyak membantu masyarakat Orang Asli.
Beliau menyifatkan dakwaan itu berniat untuk mengelirukan rakyat terutamanya masyarakat Orang Asli, khususnya di Cameron Highlands kerana ‘BN telah banyak membantu golongan tersebut di seluruh negara’.
“Saya sendiri melancarkan penempatan semula perkampungan Orang Asli Sungai Ruil di Cameron Highlands. Kita boleh lihat sendiri betapa rumah kediaman mereka ketika ini sangat selesa.
“Memang banyak lagi yang kita rancang untuk membantu masyarakat berkenaan dan kita kena tengok faktor geografi kawasan penempatan mereka… ada yang jauh di kawasan pedalaman yang mengambil masa untuk pelaksanaan projek pembangunan yang dirancang.
“…namun untuk mengatakan bahawa kerajaan BN tidak mempedulikan nasib masyarakat Orang Asli adalah tidak benar sama sekali,” katanya. – MalaysiaGazette

quote: There was suddenly a deafening silence in the car. All I heard were the sounds of fireworks and that was how I knew it was midnight.
content: GPS navigation apps are useful tools, but these apps can lead you astray.They can provide head-scratching, circuitous and in a few cases, dangerous directions.CASE 1Before setting out on a spontaneous trip to Port Dickson on New Year’s Eve years ago, Maslinda Mahmud had envisioned the perfect way to usher in the new year.She had pictured watching the New Year fireworks display in Teluk Kemang with her husband and two young children, along with hundreds of other merrymakers by the beach.Noisy and celebratory were what she was expecting for the year ahead.Instead, it was a nightmarish experience when at the stroke of midnight, she found herself and her family in the middle of a cemetery in Port Dickson after being led there by a road navigation application from Kuala Lumpur.Maslinda, 42, and her husband, Hezree Baba Ahmad, 39, a personal trainer, had keyed in a search for their hotel and had trusted the navigation to take them to their destination.“We thought we were being taken to a shortcut and we passed by the back of Port Dickson Hospital, entered a housing area before arriving at a village, where houses were scattered and there were tall bushes on the left and right.“We then came to a road, which looked like a dead end, but the navigation asked us to turn right and we did. We realised that we were in a Muslim cemetery, where there is only a narrow tarred road and the graves are 10 to 15 metres from us.“There was suddenly a deafening silence in the car. All I heard were the sounds of fireworks and that was how I knew it was midnight.“My husband and I panicked. It was midnight and we were in a cemetery. It felt eerie. Our hearts raced and I felt goosebumps.“And one of my children, who was 8 at that time, had innocently asked “What is that white thing over there?” while looking out of the window at the cemetery. It spooked us and I told the kids to just look in front, and not to say or ask anything.“I said this is what a cemetery looks like and told them no questions as I feared that their answers would make the situation even more tense.“They became quiet, but of course they continued to look around, being curious kids. It was bizarre that we welcomed the year at a cemetery. We will never forget this experience, which still traumatises us,” she said, explaining the “white thing” that her child had pointed out were the gravestones.Maslinda said Hezree made a U-turn out of the cemetery and went back to the road they had come from.They decided against following the application, shut it down and drove along the road, wherever it would lead them to.Fortunately for them, a car happened to pass by and they tailed it, eventually arriving at the main road.CASE 2Muhd Amirul Zikri Norizan, 22, and his housemate, Emyrizal Badrul Hizan, 23, will stay away from a Malaysian favourite, satay, for a while after a trip to a shop turned out to be a misadventure to a cemetery instead.Amirul and Emyrizal, who wanted to satisfy their cravings for satay after a hard day’s work, had no idea where to head for and went to Google for help.Amirul said they had then set out from his office in Taman Klang Selatan to the nearest satay shop in Meru, Klang.“We have never been to that satay shop and it was our first time using the application to get there. We drove there. At first, we were on familiar ground, but suddenly, we entered a dark area. There were no houses or shops around.“The road took us into an alley of a Muslim cemetery. We were shocked and quickly checked the application.“We stopped to double confirm if the address was right. It showed that we were only 300m away. The address on the application was the same as the satay stall. We were horrified,” said Amirul, who is a medical assistant at a private company.CASE 3Racing against time to pick up her friend who flew in from Brunei last month, Nurul Nadia Zainal Adnan searched for the quickest way to the Kuala Lumpur International Airport (KLIA) from Shah Alam.A frequent user of the navigation app, the 32-year-old opted for the route that was recommended as it was her first time driving to KLIA.Trusting that it would take her to KLIA in the shortest amount of time given the peak-hour evening congestion, Nurul Nadia, a secretary, was set on making the journey to KLIA, where she was expected to arrive an hour earlier than the flight’s landing.The first part of the journey saw Nurul Nadia whizzing through highways. It wasn’t long before her “nightmare” began.“I was instructed to enter a road which goes into a oil palm plantation. It was strange, but I thought it was a shortcut to KLIA, so I just followed. But as I drove deeper into the plantation, which was a dirt road, I knew something was not right as I could see the highway just next to me.“It was about 8pm when I was there and the plantation looked abandoned. There was tall grass on my left and right. It was pitch dark and only my car headlights illuminated the narrow road, which seemed never-ending.“It was scary as there was no one there. I shudder to think what I would do if something unfortunate happened to me.“I was terrified and recited prayers, hoping to get out of the road fast. I tried to search for another route on the application, but it showed that was the only way to get to KLIA. I drove on for about 40 minutes before making a U-turn,” said Nurul Nadia.CASE 4A charity mission to deliver goods to an underprivileged family in Kuang saw volunteer Ruwaida Md Zain and her three friends circling an unfamiliar village for two hours several years ago. The 28-year-old had left Shah Alam for Kuang via Sungai Buloh near the Sungai Plong area. “The app took us to a dirty road, riddled with potholes. Even though it was in broad daylight, there were no houses and obviously we were very scared as we had to drive through a jungle.“We phoned our friends repeatedly to get directions, but somehow, we just couldn’t find the way out.“Eventually, the phone battery went dead. We broke out in cold sweat even though the air-conditioner in the car was running. We kept on driving and finally saw houses. We were relieved to see people along the road.“With their help, we made our way out. They must have felt strange seeing our car circling the place a few times. We were two hours late for our appointment,” she said.First reported incident involving navigation app failure THE case of the woman whose car got stuck in mud after a navigation application led her into a palm oil plantation in Bandar Saujana Putra is the first for the Selangor Fire and Rescue Department.The department’s operations management chief, Alimaddia Bukri, said no other emergency calls related to navigation app failure had been made prior to this.“This was a rare case. Most users, when led to foreign places by the navigation, would not proceed ahead.“They will normally turn back and try to use another recommended route instead of following the instructions when they are lost,” Alimaddia told the New Sunday Times.In the Jan 10 incident, the victim, a midwife from Ulu Yam, was on her way to a customer’s house, when she got lost in the plantation for nearly an hour.Responding to her call, six Fire and Rescue team were sent to the location to help the woman and found her 10 minutes later.The woman said her navigation app took her to the road, and she panicked when her car tyres got stuck in the mud.

content: GPS navigation apps are useful tools, but these apps can lead you astray.They can provide head-scratching, circuitous and in a few cases, dangerous directions.CASE 1Before setting out on a spontaneous trip to Port Dickson on New Year’s Eve years ago, Maslinda Mahmud had envisioned the perfect way to usher in the new year.She had pictured watching the New Year fireworks display in Teluk Kemang with her husband and two young children, along with hundreds of other merrymakers by the beach.Noisy and celebratory were what she was expecting for the year ahead.Instead, it was a nightmarish experience when at the stroke of midnight, she found herself and her family in the middle of a cemetery in Port Dickson after being led there by a road navigation application from Kuala Lumpur.Maslinda, 42, and her husband, Hezree Baba Ahmad, 39, a personal trainer, had keyed in a search for their hotel and had trusted the navigation to take them to their destination.“We thought we were being taken to a shortcut and we passed by the back of Port Dickson Hospital, entered a housing area before arriving at a village, where houses were scattered and there were tall bushes on the left and right.“We then came to a road, which looked like a dead end, but the navigation asked us to turn right and we did. We realised that we were in a Muslim cemetery, where there is only a narrow tarred road and the graves are 10 to 15 metres from us.“There was suddenly a deafening silence in the car. All I heard were the sounds of fireworks and that was how I knew it was midnight.“My husband and I panicked. It was midnight and we were in a cemetery. It felt eerie. Our hearts raced and I felt goosebumps.“And one of my children, who was 8 at that time, had innocently asked “What is that white thing over there?” while looking out of the window at the cemetery. It spooked us and I told the kids to just look in front, and not to say or ask anything.“I said this is what a cemetery looks like and told them no questions as I feared that their answers would make the situation even more tense.“They became quiet, but of course they continued to look around, being curious kids. We drove there. At first, we were on familiar ground, but suddenly, we entered a dark area. There were no houses or shops around.“The road took us into an alley of a Muslim cemetery. We were shocked and quickly checked the application.“We stopped to double confirm if the address was right. It showed that we were only 300m away. The address on the application was the same as the satay stall. It wasn’t long before her “nightmare” began.“I was instructed to enter a road which goes into a oil palm plantation. It was strange, but I thought it was a shortcut to KLIA, so I just followed. But as I drove deeper into the plantation, which was a dirt road, I knew something was not right as I could see the highway just next to me.“It was about 8pm when I was there and the plantation looked abandoned. There was tall grass on my left and right. It was pitch dark and only my car headlights illuminated the narrow road, which seemed never-ending.“It was scary as there was no one there. I shudder to think what I would do if something unfortunate happened to me.“I was terrified and recited prayers, hoping to get out of the road fast. I tried to search for another route on the application, but it showed that was the only way to get to KLIA. I drove on for about 40 minutes before making a U-turn,” said Nurul Nadia.CASE 4A charity mission to deliver goods to an underprivileged family in Kuang saw volunteer Ruwaida Md Zain and her three friends circling an unfamiliar village for two hours several years ago. We broke out in cold sweat even though the air-conditioner in the car was running. We kept on driving and finally saw houses. We were relieved to see people along the road.“With their help, we made our way out. They must have felt strange seeing our car circling the place a few times. We were two hours late for our appointment,” she said.First reported incident involving navigation app failure THE case of the woman whose car got stuck in mud after a navigation application led her into a palm oil plantation in Bandar Saujana Putra is the first for the Selangor Fire and Rescue Department.The department’s operations management chief, Alimaddia Bukri, said no other emergency calls related to navigation app failure had been made prior to this.“This was a rare case. Most users, when led to foreign places by the navigation, would not proceed ahead.“They will normally turn back and try to use another recommended route instead of following the instructions when they are lost,” Alimaddia told the New Sunday Times.In the Jan 10 incident, the victim, a midwife from Ulu Yam, was on her way to a customer’s house, when she got lost in the plantation for nearly an hour.Responding to her call, six Fire and Rescue team were sent to the location to help the woman and found her 10 minutes later.The woman said her navigation app took her to the road, and she panicked when her car tyres got stuck in the mud.

quote: In the previous matches there were moments where we could have been a lot better. But to be better than we were against France will be very difficult.
content: ROTTERDAM (Reuters) - The Netherlands have put behind them the poor form that saw them miss out on the last two major tournaments and even coach Ronald Koeman is pleasantly surprised by Friday's victory over world champions France."We've have shown we are broken the slump but I did not expect that we would be so much better through 90 minutes," said a delighted Ronald Koeman after a 2-0 win in Rotterdam inflicted a first defeat on the French since they won the World Cup in Russia.The result means the Netherlands can win the group if they draw in Gelsenkirchen against Germany on Monday, usurping the last two World Cup winners to advance to next June's Nations League finals."I also did not expect that this team would be as far in their reading of a match. We’ve shown on such a night that we’ve made enormous steps. From the beginning to the end we played really well," Koeman said.Georginio Wijnaldum scored just before halftime and Memphis Depay converted a late penalty as the Dutch dominated against the world champions, looking much changed from the side that missed out on the 2016 European Championship and the last World Cup in Russia.The Netherlands beat Germany 3-0 last month in the Nations League to signal their potential but Koeman, appointed coach in February, then tried to temper the euphoria.But he was fulsome in his praise after the latest victory."In the previous matches there were moments where we could have been a lot better. But to be better than we were against France will be very difficult."It has given the team a lot of self-confidence. France did not come to play and try and make a decent game of it. It made it difficult to stay patient and to pick out moments. We had many chances a second goal but their keeper (Hugo Lloris) was tremendous, otherwise the final score could have been 3-0 or 4-0."Depay said that the young team were on the right track. "I'm enjoying how the team is developing and if, in games like this, are able to get result, then we are on the right path." (Reporting by Mark Gleeson; Editing by Amlan Chakraborty)

quote: surge in requests for rescue missions
content:
SEOUL: The leader of one of South Korea's largest animal rights groups has been accused of secretly exterminating hundreds of rescued dogs - despite a declared no-kill policy - to ensure a continued stream of donations.South Korean attitudes on canines are divided - about one million dogs are eaten every year in the country, often as a summertime delicacy.
But the tradition is declining as the nation increasingly embraces the idea of dogs as pets, with eating them now something of a taboo among young South Koreans.For years, Coexistence of Animal Rights on Earth (CARE) has spearheaded campaigns to rescue canines from dogmeat farms across the country, accumulating some 23,000 members and around two billion won (US$1.8 million) in annual donations.South Korean President Moon Jae-in - who is a known animal lover with several dogs - adopted a small black and white mongrel from CARE when he came to office in 2017.Staff members at CARE told the Hankyoreh newspaper that the organisation's head, Park So-yeon, had more than 230 rescued dogs destroyed because of a shortage of space at the shelter.
The number was equivalent to around a quarter of the animals the group rescued in the period, according to the newspaper.Only 10 per cent of the dogs were suffering from incurable illnesses and most were killed because of their large size, a CARE employee was quoted as saying. The animals were then listed as having been adopted.CARE has often appealed for donations to carry out more rescues, and needs to continue operations to justify the funding requests.The organisation has long asserted in those appeals that it does not kill dogs even if they are not adopted.But Park said in statement that a "small number" of exterminations had been "inevitable" since 2015 due to a "surge in requests for rescue missions".She added that only severely aggressive dogs or those with incurable illnesses were destroyed, and only after extensive efforts to treat them first.CARE staff members mounted a protest in the organisation's offices at the weekend to demand Park's resignation.According to a 2017 survey, 70 per cent of South Koreans do not eat dogs, but far fewer - about 40 percent - believe the practice should be banned. It also found 65 per cent support raising and slaughtering dogs in more humane conditions.

quote: We can have differences in opinion but not on who the eighth PM should be.
content:
Outgoing PKR vice-president Rafizi Ramli says differences in opinion are welcomed in the party except on the issue of Anwar Ibrahim becoming prime minister. (Bernama pic)
SHAH ALAM: Outgoing PKR vice-president Rafizi Ramli today urged the party to be united in ensuring Anwar Ibrahim becomes the eighth prime minister.
Claiming there were some senior PKR leaders who had mocked Anwar’s ability to be prime minister, Rafizi said such actions must stop.
“We can have differences in opinion but not on who the eighth PM should be.
“Some are saying that his (Anwar’s) time is up and that the party should let new blood step in. All this must stop now,” Rafizi said in his winding up speech at the PKR National Congress here.
Whatsapp messages ridiculing efforts to make the PKR incoming president the next prime minister have been making the rounds.
This is not the first time Anwar’s much-publicised ascension to the prime minister’s post has come under the spotlight.
In August, Kapar MP Abdullah Sani Abdul Hamid said there were elements attempting to stop Anwar from becoming the next prime minister, and named Daim Zainuddin as among those out to stop the PKR leader.
The remarks drew condemnation from PPBM leaders. Abdullah has since apologised.
In September, Prime Minister Dr Mahathir Mohamad said he would honour the agreement among Pakatan Harapan (PH) partners that he would serve as interim prime minister for two years before handing over the reins to Anwar.
In his speech, Rafizi also said that what sets PKR apart from other parties was the fact that its strength lies in the difference of opinion among its members.
“Our strength is not in our similarities, but our differences. Carrying the same objective, our differences act as different strengths. This united strength was the reason for our victory.
“Therefore we must defend and respect our differences which separate us from the divided Umno, divided PAS, where our party will never be divided no matter how bad our differences are.
“We learn to control our differences in a polite, educated manner that doesn’t go astray from our initial struggles,” he said.
Rafizi also reminded PKR leaders in the Cabinet not to stop fighting for the people.
He warned that a failure to serve the people would likely result in Pakatan Harapan losing in the 15th general election (GE15).
He said the party and incoming PKR president Anwar Ibrahim would then be blamed for it.
“To my friends in the ministries, please don’t go to your ministerial meetings and not talk about the people. You must continue to defend the people, if not then the blame will fall on Anwar and the whole party,” he said today in his winding-up speech at the PKR National Congress here.
He was talking about how Anwar would be facing a big challenge when he becomes the eighth prime minister, and it would require party members to support their leader by fulfilling the party’s initial struggle of reform and defending the people.

quote: Umno sentiasa membuka pintu kepada sesiapa sahaja yang ingin menyertai dan menjadi ahli Umno.
content:
Timbalan Presiden Umno Datuk Seri Mohamad Hasan berkata Umno belum menerima permohonan daripada anggota Parlimen parti itu yang sebelum ini telah keluar untuk menyertai kembali parti.
Beliau yang kini menjalankan tugas-tugas presiden Umno berkata bagaimanapun parti itu terbuka untuk menerima sesiapa sahaja yang ingin menyertainya.
“Umno sentiasa membuka pintu kepada sesiapa sahaja yang ingin menyertai dan menjadi ahli Umno.


“Syarat dan proses untuk menjadi ahli adalah tertakluk kepada seperti apa yang diperuntukkan oleh perlembagaan dan peraturan pentadbiran parti,” katanya dalam kenyataan hari ini.
Beliau berkata demikian bagi mengulas mengenai ura-ura enam anggota Ummo yang sebelum ini meninggalkan parti tersebut mahu kembali seperti yang dilaporkan media semalam.
Enam Anggota Parlimen, yang kini anggota Bebas selepas meninggalkan Umno pada 14 Disember lepas, ialah Anggota Parlimen Hulu Terengganu, Datuk Rosol Wahid; Anggota Parlimen Mersing, Datuk Dr Abdul Latiff Ahmad dan Anggota Parlimen Tasik Gelugor, Datuk Shabudin Yahaya,
Anggota Parlimen Larut, Datuk Seri Hamzah Zainudin; Anggota Parlimen Sabak Bernam, Datuk Mohamad Fasiah Mohd Fakeh dan Anggota Parlimen Tanah Merah, Datuk Seri Ikmal Hisham Abdul Aziz. ― Bernama

quote: Laporan yang dibuat oleh saya ini kerana ingin mencari keadilan apabila pemberian wang itu sama dengan kes saya di mahkamah hingga dilucutkan jawatan sebagai ahli parlimen.
content:
PUTRAJAYA – Penasihat DAP, Lim Kit Siang yang mengakui individu yang berbaju Pakatan Harapan (PH) mengagihkan wang kepada Orang Asli di Cameron Highlands baru-baru ini sebagai bayaran balik kos petrol para sukarelawan.
Jadi, selain gambar yang tular, kenyataan Kit Siang itu boleh dijadikan bukti untuk Suruhanjaya Pencegahan Rasuah Malaysia (SPRM), kata bekas Ahli Parlimen Cameron Highlands, Datuk C. Sivarrajh.
Beliau juga hari inii membuat laporan di SPRM berhubung dakwaan wujudnya politik wang pada kempen Pilihan Raya Kecil (PRK) di parlimen itu yang bermula pada 13 Januari lalu.
Sivarrajh yang juga Naib Presiden MIC itu menambah, gambar pemberian wang oleh wakil atau ejen calon DAP yang tular di media sosial kini juga perlu dijadikan bahan bukti dan perlu disiasat oleh SPRM.
“Laporan yang dibuat oleh saya ini kerana ingin mencari keadilan apabila pemberian wang itu sama dengan kes saya di mahkamah hingga dilucutkan jawatan sebagai ahli parlimen.
“Malah hakim kes saya turut menyebut pemberian wang petrol atau rokok tetap dikira rasuah.
“Jadi saya menjadi mangsa kerana petisyen yang dibuat calon DAP sebelum ini hanya cakap-cakap tetapi kempen ketika ini gambar pemberian wang sudah menjadi viral dan diakui sendiri oleh Kit Siang,” katanya pada sidang media selepas membuat laporan di Ibu Pejabat SPRM di sini hari ini.
Bekas Ahli Parlimen Cameron Highlands, Datuk C. Sivarraajh bercakap kepada media ketika hadir untuk membuat laporan dakwaan salah laku di bawah Akta Pilihanraya calon DAP Cameron Highlands, Manogaran di PRU14 dan di PRK Cameron Highlands di Ibu Pejabat Suruhanjaya Pencegahan Rasuah Malaysia (SPRM), Putrajaya. foto AFFAN FAUZI, 15 JANUARI 2019
Kempen PRK Cameron Highlands ketika menjadi kontroversi apabila gambar tular seorang individu memakai baju berlogo Pakatan Harapan mengagihkan wang kepada beberapa individu lain.
Kit Siang mengakui individu berkenaan adalah seorang sukarelawan Impian Malaysia dan wang yang diagihkan itu adalah bayaran balik kos petrol para sukarelawan.
PRK parlimen itu menyaksikan calon Barisan Nasional (BN), Ramli Mohd. Nor berdepan dengan tiga lawan dalam saingan empat penjuru pada PRK Parlimen Cameron Highlands pada 26 Januari ini.
Ramli ditentang oleh calon Pakatan Harapan (PH) yang juga bekas calon parlimen itu pada  PRU-14, M. Manogaran serta dua calon bebas iaitu Sallehudin Ab. Talib dan Wong Seng Yee.
Pada 30 November lalu, Mahkamah Tinggi Kuala Lumpur memutuskan kemenangan Sivarraajh bagi kerusi Parlimen Cameron Highlands dalam PRU-14 adalah terbatal dan tidak sah akibat rasuah.
Oleh itu, Hakim Datuk Azizah Nawawi memerintahkan agar pilihan raya kecil diadakan bagi kerusi parlimen itu. – MalaysiaGazette
Bayar RM20 kepada 60 Orang Asli bukan beli undi, kata Kit Siang

quote: We have a draft of the framework that has to be fleshed out before it becomes an agreement.
content:
U.S. envoy in charge of the quest for a peace deal in Afghanistan encouraged by recent progress, but hurdles remain.
It’s telling that the biggest news about the ongoing Afghan peace process is that negotiators have “agreed to agreements in principle” on some key issues. On Monday, following six days of talks in Qatar with Taliban representatives, U.S. envoy Zalmay Khalilzad said in a statement that progress on vital issues had been made and the two sides had “agreed to agreements in principle on a couple of very important issues.”
Khalilzad went on to acknowledge that more work needs to be done. According to the Associated Press, the statement continued: “There is a lot more work to be done before we can say we have succeeded in our efforts but I believe for the first time I can say that we have made significant progress.”
In an interview with the New York Times, Khalilzad said “We have a draft of the framework that has to be fleshed out before it becomes an agreement.” Back in Kabul as of Sunday, Khalilzad said,“The Taliban have committed, to our satisfaction, to do what is necessary that would prevent Afghanistan from ever becoming a platform for international terrorist groups or individuals.”Enjoying this article? Khalilzad was named Special Representative for Afghanistan Reconciliation in September 2018 by U.S. Secretary of State Mike Pompeo. A former U.S. Ambassador to Afghanistan and also Iraq, Khalilzad was tasked with finding a peace settlement for the war in Afghanistan. Since, Khalilzad has engaged in significant shuttle diplomacy, bouncing around the Middle East and South Asia. In the last month alone, Khalilzad led a delegation to India, the United Arab Emirates, China, Afghanistan, and Pakistan before heading to Qatar and then Afghanistan again.
Reuters quoted a Qatari Foreign Ministry official in reporting that the two sides have “agreed tentatively to reconvene on February 25.”
An apparent draft of the deal, referenced by the New York Times and Reuters, reportedly contains provisions for a withdrawal of U.S. troops and a pledge by the Taliban to not allow Afghan soil to be used by others, presumably al-Qaeda and the Islamic State.
On Twitter, Khalilzad said meetings in Qatar were “more productive than they have been in the past. We made significant progress on vital issues.”
“[We] will build on the momentum and resume talks shortly,” he continued. “We have a number of issues left to work out. Nothing is agreed until everything is agreed, and ‘everything’ must include an intra-Afghan dialogue and comprehensive ceasefire.”
A Taliban official speaking to the New York Times didn’t comment on the issue of a ceasefire and direct talks between the Taliban and the Afghan government. These two issues are the most difficult to surmount. The Taliban has steadfastly refused direct talks with the Afghan government, casting the leaders in Kabul as American puppets. Meanwhile, fighting continues across Afghanistan with the Taliban enjoying influence over an estimated half of the country’s districts. 
Back in Kabul for consultations, Khalilzad will continue to serve as a bridge between the Afghan government and the Taliban. For its part, the Afghan government led by President Ashraf Ghani continues to work with Khalilzad while trying to reassure the Afghan people that they will not be abandoned. As Tolonews reported it, on Monday Ghani gave a national address calling on the Taliban to enter direct talks, assuring “the people that their rights will not be compromised in the name of peace and that the country’s sovereignty will be upheld.”
On Monday in Kabul, Khalilzad told Afghan media that there is a “moment of opportunity for peace.”
“The key for finding the solutions for Afghan problems is at the hands of Afghans now,” he said.
It’s important to reiterate that nothing has actually been agreed to, not even the principles. The checklist to achieving peace is long, with each side having different priorities for what ought to come first. For the Taliban, a U.S. troop withdrawal is a top item; for the United States, a ceasefire would be among the top priorities but as hinted last month, the Trump administration is keen to drawdown troop levels too; and for the Afghan government, both a ceasefire and direct talks are near the top of the list, with the troop withdrawal much further down and contingent on security improvements that at this stage are far from realized.
The next iteration of talks for Khalilzad are reportedly set for late February.
