quote: Various promotional Islamic activities have worked in our favour.
content:
by BLOOMBERG / pic credit: www.syariahmandiri.co.id
Shariah banking assets have broken out of the ‘5% market trap’ that it was in for a long time, says Subari
JAKARTA • With demand for financial products conforming to Islamic principles soaring, Shariah banking in Indonesia is poised for a phase of rapid growth, according to the nation’s largest Islamic bank. 
Shariah banking assets have broken out of the “5% market trap” that it was in for a long time thanks to a wave of halal lifestyle sweeping the world’s largest Muslim-majority country, said Toni Eko Boy Subari, president director of PT Bank Syariah Mandiri. The lender expects its financing to expand 11% to 12% this year, a second straight year of double-digit growth, he said. 
Even with Muslims making up almost 90% of Indonesia’s 265 million population, Shariah financial products have struggled to gain much ground as conventional banks dominated the financial industry. That may be about to change as the government and central bank drive the promotion of Shariah banking and other financial instruments among the followers of Islam.
“Previously, not many people knew what Islamic banking is, what the products are and what they can offer,” said Subari, whose bank is the country’s largest Islamic lender with more than 20% market share. “Various promotional Islamic activities have worked in our favour.” 
Indonesia’s 182 Islamic banks and 20 Shariah business units had a combined 451.2 trillion rupiah (RM132.5 billion) of assets at the end of November, or about 5.7% of the total of the banking industry, data from the Financial Services Authority show. That’s only a fraction of the US$2.1 trillion (RM8.61 trillion) in Islamic finance worldwide in 2017.
Indonesia plans to make halal certification mandatory for all consumer products from October this year as it seeks a slice of the global halal economy that has tripled to US$6.4 trillion in six years. 
The country’s halal food spending alone was US$170 billion in 2017, the highest among the top consuming nations including Turkey, Pakistan and Egypt, according to the State of the Global Islamic Economy Report. 
As more Indonesians become aware of the halal products, they turn to Islamic banks to deposit their funds because of increased consciousness of the religious doctrine underpinning the two, Subari said in an interview. Syariah Mandiri’s customer deposits rose by 12.2% last year, accelerating from 11.4% in 2017, he said. 
Syariah Mandiri, part of the state-owned PT Bank Mandiri, expects to benefit from a new rule that allows Shariah banks to manage civil servants’ payrolls, which may open up a pool of lowcost funds, Subari said. The bank plans to prioritise infrastructure, health and education for wholesale financing, while retaining its focus on retail and consumer sectors, he said. 
“There are still many potentials to tap into,” Subari said. “Why bother going abroad? This is the market to be in.” — Bloomberg

quote: Suspek turut menunjukkan isyarat lucah dan kemaluannya kepada pengadu serta mengintai pengadu dan anak pengadu ketika sedang mandi.
content:
Gambar hiasan 

MIRI: Seorang lelaki yang cuba menceroboh rumah jirannya serta menunjukkan isyarat lucah dan kemaluan akhirnya ditangkap polis di sebuah rumah di Kampung Muhibbah, Kuala Baram di sini petang kelmarin. 
Ketua Polis Daerah Miri ACP Lim Meng Seah berkata, suspek berusia 41 tahun itu kemudiannya dibawa ke Balai Polis Lutong. 
“Semasa berada di Balai Polis Lutong, suspek telah bertindak agresif dan hendak melarikan diri dengan merempuh pintu utama balai menggunakan kepalanya sehingga menyebabkan pintu balai pecah. 
“Kejadian ini turut disaksikan oleh tiga orang awam. Suspek telah dibawa ke Hospital Miri,” katanya dalam satu kenyataan media di sini, semalam. 
Beliau berkata, suspek kini dalam keadaan stabil dan mengalami luka di bahagian kepala dan tangan kanan. Terdapat satu jahitan di kepala dan lima jahitan di tangan kanan suspek. 
Lim menjelaskan, suspek ditangkap susulan laporan polis dibuat seorang suri rumah berusia 59 tahun yang mendakwa suspek yang juga jiran dikenalinya cuba memasuki rumah pengadu pada jam 3.24 petang hari yang sama. 
“Suspek turut menunjukkan isyarat lucah dan kemaluannya kepada pengadu serta mengintai pengadu dan anak pengadu ketika sedang mandi. 
“Siasatan awal mendapati suspek telah mula mengganggu pengadu sejak awal tahun ini,” katanya. 
Suspek yang ditangkap disiasat di bawah Seksyen 447 dan 509 Kanun Keseksaan serta Seksyen 427 kanun sama.

quote: Panggilan telefon itu dibuat oleh salah seorang mangsa culik terus kepada isterinya.
content:
TIGA NELAYAN YANG HILANG DI PEGASUS REEF MANGSA CULIK: OMAR


Oleh Mohd Adam Arinin

KOTA KINABALU: Polis hari ini mengesahkan tiga nelayan yang dilaporkan hilang berhampiran lokasi kejadian serangan bot tunda Magtrans 2, di perairan Pegagus Reef, Kinabatangan, minggu lepas, telah diculik.
Pesuruhjaya Polis Sabah Datuk Omar Mammah berkata pengesahan terkini ini dibuat daripada isteri salah seorang mangsa yang mengakui telah dihubungi oleh suaminya yang mereka telah diculik.
Pesuruhjaya Polis Sabah, Datuk Omar Mammah. Gambar SNT/Mohd Adam Arinin
“Panggilan telefon itu dibuat oleh salah seorang mangsa culik terus kepada isterinya.

quote: Transgender dies after phone row
content: LETTER | Must we fear for our lives? Crime and death increased dramatically, so says a newspaper headline.Indeed it was a headline on Jan 1, 2019, when we as Malaysians came together celebrating the start of a new calendar year, full of anticipation what the year of 2019 might bring.Except that the headlines in newspapers do not speak the truth. Rather than stating the obvious, the newspapers and official statements report on illegal money lenders/loan sharks, theft/robbery and loose cannon/bad-mouthing. Why? On Jan 1, 2019, the victim of a murder was a transgender woman.This is not an individual case and we are tired of being told differently. These reportings and statements are maligning the facts that have caused the deaths and murders of transgenders in our country. Too often, officials have also given out their statements to the press, without intense investigations made shortly after the crime.How do headlines and the content of newspapers cause deaths?It is fact that the tone and voice of journalists, official bodies, politicians and institutions form and influence society. Speaking about the topic of transgenders in public also increases noises from non-expert opinion leaders who want to voice their disapproval and stigmatise the community further by stating that transgenderism is socio-economic, though the World Health Organisation defines it as health-related.On Jan 1, 2019, a transgender was murdered and the headline of The Star Online was “Transgender dies after phone row”. The report stated that the motive of the murder was an argument over a stolen handphone. Really?Society associates certain stigma with transgenders. These are:a) That transgenders are believed to consume drugs. From 2010 to 2016, there have been 131,841 drug addicts registered in Malaysia and over 95 percent of the drug addicts were reported to be male;b) Shoplifting and theft are assumed to be caused by transgenders. The transgender community is believed to be around 24,000 as of 2014, according to the Malaysian Ministry of Health. Compare this group to the national population of 31.62 million. The fact is that theft and robbery are increasing by over 50 percent in Kuala Lumpur alone, while the crime rate is generally decreasing. This clearly shows that it is a national issue and not only solely a socio-economic circumstance of a minority group; andc) Transgender women are believed to be solely sex workers with sexual transmission diseases. From the data of the Ministry of Health Malaysia, it is clear that human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) is most often transmitted through sexual contact among bisexuals - 50.3 percent as of 2014. The same data proves that sex workers only account for approximately 0.6 percent of the total reported HIV cases.One of the prevailing stigmas that surfaced and remains omnipresent after the murder on Jan 1, 2019, is theft. Malaysian officials and authorities blame robbery as the cause of the death of this transgender human being.Though stigma and stereotypes are prevailing and given the current situation, our society decides to execute self-justice on transgender women. Because Malaysia fears the unknown, judges the difference and does not perceive transgender women as part of Malaysian society.Let’s face reality: It was and has always been a crime of hatred against transgenders.We demand the police to protect Malaysians, despite nationality, gender, religion and sexual orientation. NGOs have already taken the first step to provide shelter and facility services for 10 to 12 individualsGovernmental institutions should follow this example and support the transgender women community through services that protect transgender women from self-justice practising citizens, violence and discrimination. This should only be a start, for there are other areas in which the community should be supported: the employment market, educational system and healthcare.As a very first step, we demand that the authorities be accountable for their reporting on the crimes relating to the transgender women community and to keep the quality of investigation at a standard of excellence.ELISHA KOR KRISHNAN is the founder of Pertubuhan Kesihatan dan Kebajikan Umum Malaysia (PKKUM). This letter was originally sent as an Open Letter to Prime Minister Dr Mahathir Mohamad.The views expressed here are those of the author/contributor and do not necessarily represent the views of Malaysiakini.

quote: .the country loses billions of ringgit to corruption every year and drastic action must be taken against those involved in corruption.
content:
Just a few days ago, during an interview with Channel News Asia, Tun M said that he was THINKING ABOUT replacing the ringgit.
Whoah. What does that even mean!? We going to change currencies from Ringgit to dollar is it? Or use kerang ah?
Kerang sellers sure very rich already lor. Img from merdeka.com
Well, in further detail, he said his administration is currently researching on either going cashless or changing currencies. What he means by changing currencies is that he would consider invalidating the old Ringgit note, and creating a new one. Then there would be a period where the public can exchange their old notes for the new ones. Ideally it would be the 50 and 100 ringgit notes as they account for 84.6% of the currency in circulation.
The term for this process is Demonetisation.
 
But why would anyone wanna get rid of… money!?
The main reason given by Tun M is to combat corruption and to keep track of the money being spent especially by the gomen.

Considering the recent events where cash amounting to RM116mil was seized from Najib, and RM53.7mil worth of cash was found at the Sabah Water Department’s Director and Deputy Director’s houses back in 2016, it is pretty apparent that there is a huuuuge corruption problem that needs our immediate attention.
Wow… make sense right? No more ringgit, no more corruption yay!
But HOW does this actually work?
No, this is not how modern banks do million dollar transfers. Img from gstatic.com
Well in simple terms, there are two main types of money these days.


Cash – all the notes and coins you use and keep in your wallet
Virtual/digital – Money that’s just a record on a data repository, like recorded by banks, passing to other banks, or from one digital wallet to another

Amazingly, about 92% of the world’s total money is DIGITAL! The money is transferred into your bank account and you have the option to withdraw the money. Ironically, although no paper is involved in such exchanges, these transactions leave a paper trail. So if you do something that gets you in trouble, the police can go through your bank details to see what you have been up to. Bank statements can tell a lot about you than you think.
Think about it. Everytime you see bags of money, you automatically think something bad is going down right? That’s cos unlike digital money, cash is much harder to track. Er… unless of course MACC surprise visit you la.
Image via CNN
So in simple terms, when the ringgit is no longer a valid form of money, ALL the cash ppl keep in their apartments and sock drawers will be invalidated lo. If your Ringgit can’t be used to buy anything then it no longer has any value.
 
So how exactly would the gomen remove all the ringgit?
One way to get rid of the ringgit? Img from tenor.com
If they were to actually go through with this, there would be a lot of planning and procedures involved. And of course costs as well.
“It’s not an easy thing because when you want to replace currency, you must know how much currency is in circulation … because we have to replace what is in circulation and that is a very big amount,” – Tun M–

First of all, the gomen will need to figure out how much money is in circulation, inside or outside the country. Bank Negara will have to go through records of the money they printed and sent out into circulation and figure out the ones they destroyed (central banks tend to do that every year to ensure that the money is fit to use).
Next, they will have to print the new notes to replace the ones we are currently using. Printing will require certain special tape, ink, and paper that will cost money. It costs the US Federal Reserve (USD) 13.2 cents to print one 100 dollar bill. Imagine printing billions of those.
On top of this, normal banks will have to work extra to help Bank Negara change the money also. So must give them some duit makan also mah… in such cases, Bank Negara may waive transaction costs to make things easier for them.

As you can see, the process can be quite tedious … but will this policy actually work? How to test if never do before!?
 
Luckily for us, India has already tried this whole process before. How’d it work for them?
On November 8th, 2016 (same day Trump got elected), India’s Prime Minister, Narendra Modi stole the limelight by suddenly announcing that he was going to discontinue the 500 and 1000 rupee notes. These notes made up of 86% percent of the total cash that was in circulation. He gave everybody until December 31st to exchange their cash at their nearest banks.
Why did they do it? Well, they had the same problem as us. Too much black money and corruption. Sommore their country so big which means lagi la the magnitude of corruption is bigger. All the preparations were done in secret and the announcement came as a surprise to the whole country.
 
India’s Prime Minister Narendra Modi seen waving his approval ratings goodbye. Img from indienheute.de
The result? Looong snaking queues started forming outside banks and some even died while queuing. It had become almost impossible to buy or sell anything because people kept trying to pay in the old notes and the small business owners wouldn’t accept it because if they did, they would have to go and queue up at the banks too and who want to jaga kedai in the meanwhile?
People would start queuing hours before the banks opened. Img from hindustantimes.com
The news initially reported that it was the rich that were troubled more, having to burn their money la, they are suffering la, etc. just to console the public and make them feel like they are helping the nation. However, when the official annual report by Reserve Bank of India (RBI) got released almost a year later, the truth was out for everyone to see. They found that 99% of the demonetized money had been deposited back to the central bank.
Much technical. Very wowe. What does this mean?
This means that from the amount of money the RBI had printed, they had estimated that they would only get back about 75% of the money. But 99% of the money came back to them. Which means either India didn’t have any dirty money, or someone cleaned it.
As it turns out, people found a lorong tikus to this issue. Complex money laundering networks sprung up that would help rich people “manage” the money. Simply put, they would get poor people to deposit the money into banks for them by paying them a little bit of the money. This way all the undeclared money could now be legal.
Modi’s critics even accuse him of providing a safe passage to the rich people to convert their black money into white through this demonetization.
Cartoons like this emerged throughout the country. Img from goodtimenation.com
Hmm…so means cannot la right? If all this lorong tikus can happen in India, what’s to say it won’t happen here? If we fail, all the corrupt people won’t have hidden money already and would legally be able to declare their money.
Another important point is that demonetization only targets cash. What about all the Hermès bags and diamond tiaras?
“… tax authorities have documented that the most important form of holding illegal earnings is not cash, but physical assets like land/bullion and financial assets like shares. Another part of the illegal earnings is seamlessly transferred as capital invested in productive activities,” R Ramakumar, dean at the Tata Institute of Social Sciences, Mumbai.
Hyah, if like that means don’t do la! Why risk it? We could just go the normal way by raiding people’s houses and collecting evidence to send them to jail.
Well, this process could take decades. Even for one case, MACC needs to do thorough investigation and collect evidence. Imagine busting hundreds of tax evaders and corrupt individuals.
Plus, there is a difference between India and Malaysia. While India had the right reasons for demonetization, their execution was less than ideal. There were reports of loopholes, empty ATM machines, and people having to take time off from work just to withdraw their own money. Which evidently made people unhappy and created unnecessary chaos.
Economy, not so much, but India’s meme game surely improved. Img from newindianexpress.com
Malaysia might have an advantage as a smaller country with only 32.4 million people. As of 2016, total number of ATM machines in India per 100,000 adults was 21.24, whereas, the number of ATMs in Malaysia is 44.62 per 100,000 adults for the same period of time. This indicates that we have a tad bit better facilities than India and if we were to have demonetisation, it miiight be easier.
Whether or not we will do a better job, we’ll have to wait and see… but with the indisputable rise of corruption in Malaysia over the last few years, something needs to be done eventually…
“…the country loses billions of ringgit to corruption every year and drastic action must be taken against those involved in corruption.” – Subromaniam Tholasy, Malaysia’s Customs director-general, Malay Mail, June 30, 2017
And barring one recent exception, Tun M seems to be a man on a mission.

quote: Tengoklah nanti selepas saya menjalani pembedahan mengeluarkan besi dari kaki saya pada 5 November ini.
content:
TABAH: Nina ketika berkongsi keperitan hidupnya kepada wakil media selepas menerima Ijazah Sarjana Muda Sains dengan Kepujian (Sains Kognitif) pada Majlis Konvokesyen UNIMAS Ke-22.

KOTA SAMARAHAN: Kehilangan ibu tersayang dan kecederaan parah dialami Nina Bayang selepas terlibat dalam nahas jalan raya lebih setahun lalu tidak melunturkan semangatnya untuk menamatkan pengajian. 
Ini terbukti apabila beliau berjaya menerima Ijazah Sarjana Muda Sains dengan Kepujian (Sains Kognitif) pada Majlis Konvokesyen Universiti Malaysia Sarawak (UNIMAS) Ke-22 semalam.
Nahas yang turut meragut nyawa sepupunya itu berlaku di Simpang Bajau berhampiran Saratok pada petang 26 Januari 2017 apabila kereta dipandunya bertembung dengan sebuah kenderaan SUV ketika dalam perjalanan dari Saratok ke Spaoh.
Kemalangan itu juga telah menyebabkan Nina, 28, patah tangan kiri dan kaki kanan, selain beberapa tulang rusuknya retak dan terdapat darah beku di kepala.
“Ibu meninggal di tempat kejadian... sepupu saya juga (meninggal dunia). 
“Secara jujur, pada mulanya memang saya berasa putus asa untuk meneruskan pengajian selepas kehilangan orang tersayang sekelip mata dan kecederaan parah yang saya alami,” katanya sambil menangis ketika ditemui selepas menerima ijazahnya semalam.
“Ketika itu hanya doa penenang hati dan kehadiran ayah sentiasa di sisi memberi semangat untuk saya terus hidup dan meneruskan pengajian,” tambahnya dalam nada sebak.

KONGSI GEMBIRA: Nina bersama ayah dan abangnya di luar DeTAR Putra UNIMAS selepas menerima Ijazah Sarjana Muda Sains dengan Kepujian (Sains Kognitif) pada Majlis Konvokesyen UNIMAS Ke-22.

Nina berkata disebabkan kecederaan dialaminya, dia terpaksa bercuti selama dua semester dan bergantung kepada kerusi roda untuk bergerak selama beberapa bulan.
Graduan itu berkata, disebabkan beberapa keretakan pada tulang kaki bermula dari pinggang hingga lutut, doktor pakar memasang besi (titanium) dari paras pinggang hingga lutut dan tangan kirinya.
“Saya susah nak bergerak dan duduk pun susah. Kalau saya nak pergi kelas, kena lihat dulu kelas kat mana, kalau di tingkat atas terpaksa minta kelas diadakan di tingkat bawah.
“Saya lebih banyak mendapatkan maklumat tambahan secara dalam talian kerana tidak boleh pergi ke CAIS (Pusat Perkhidmatan Maklumat Akademik),” katanya.
Kini keadaan Nina bertambah baik dan dia hanya menggunakan topang untuk bergerak, namun pergerakannya masih terbatas.
Di sebalik kekangan itu, dia tidak pernah putus asa malah menyimpan impian menamatkan pengajian dengan jayanya.
Malah, dia tidak pernah menagih simpati orang ramai apatah lagi terpaksa mengurus dirinya sendiri dan memandu dari rumah dibeli ayahnya di Bandar Baru Samariang, Petra Jaya untuk ke kampus.
Ini kerana katanya, abangnya tinggal di Johor atas tuntutan kerja, manakala ayahnya perlu menjaga neneknya yang sakit di kampung.
“Saya cekalkan hati, kuatkan semangat kerana mahu menamatkan pengajian dengan berjaya dan didedikasikan khas untuk mendiang ibu,” katanya.
Ditanya mengenai perancangan masa depannya, Nina berkata beliau akan memikirkan perkara itu buat masa ini kerana mahu memberi tumpuan kepada keadaan kesihatannya.
“Tengoklah nanti selepas saya menjalani pembedahan mengeluarkan besi dari kaki saya pada 5 November ini.

quote: Ayah memang suka buat kejutan untuk ibu. Ia merupakan acara wajib setiap tahun. Setiap kali tiba hari jadi ibu dia akan ajak kami buat kejutan untuknya.
content:
SETIAP wanita pasti mengimpikan untuk memiliki pasangan yang romantik dan kejutan pastinya menjadi momen paling dinanti-nantikan kaum Hawa.
Begitu juga pasangan ini yang menjadi perhatian netizen gara-gara gelagat mereka ketika meraikan ulang tahun kelahiran isterinya, baru-baru ini.
"My dad suprised my mom for her birthday, and this was her whole reaction. (Ayah buat kejutan untuk hari jadi ibu dan ini reaksi ibu)," tulisnya pada video yang dikongsi di akaun Twitter @Izzatierahmat pada Selasa, sehingga ia menjadi tular.
Video berdurasi satu minit 43 saat yang dirakam anaknya, Nor Izzatie Rahmat, menunjukkan reaksi ibunya, Asmah Mohammad, 43, tersipu malu selepas menerima kejutan sebentuk cincin yang diletakkan di dalam kotak dipenuhi coklat sempena meraikan hari jadinya di sebuah restoran, 4 Februari lalu.
Rakaman itu menerima lebih 177,000 tontonan dengan 11,000 ulang kicau dan lebih 15,000 tanda suka di laman sosial.

Rata-rata netizen memberikan komen positif terhadap aksi romantik pasangan ini.
Izzatie yang memuat naik video tersebut berkata, kenangan manis itu dirakam ketika mereka sekeluarga meraikan sambutan ulang tahun kelahiran ibunya yang ke-43 di sebuah restoran di Shah Alam.
Gadis berusia 22 tahun itu yang lebih dikenali sebagai Izzatie memberitahu ayahnya, Rahmat Mokhtar, 49, merupakan seorang yang romantik dan sering membuat kejutan untuk ibunya.
"Ayah memang suka buat kejutan untuk ibu. Ia merupakan acara wajib setiap tahun. Setiap kali tiba hari jadi ibu dia akan ajak kami buat kejutan untuknya.
"Sehingga sambutan hari guru pun dia tetap akan beri bunga, coklat dan ucapan cuma tahun ini agak istimewa sebab ayah rancang nak hadiahkan ibu cincin.
"Ayah suka tunjukkan kasih sayang terhadap ibu dan itu membuatkan kami adik-beradik mendamba untuk memiliki suami seperti ayah," katanya ketika dihubungi mStar Online.


Pasangan ini, Rahmat Mokhtar dan isterinya Asmah Mohammad dikurniakan tiga cahaya mata perempuan.
Izzatie yang merupakan anak sulung daripada tiga beradik itu turut menyifatkan kedua ibu bapanya sebagai pasangan yang romantis dan suka berjenaka.
Katanya, ibunya yang bertugas sebagai guru tadika adalah seorang yang pemalu manakala ayahnya pula suka menyakat.
"Apa yang anda lihat dalam video tu, begitulah ibu dan ayah saya. Ayah memang suka menyakat ibu dan dia seorang yang sangat romantis.
"Walaupun sudah lama berkahwin tetapi mereka tetap sweet seperti pasangan baharu bercinta," katanya sambil menambah ibu bapanya telah membina rumah tangga lebih 23 tahun.
Sementara itu, Izzatie berkata dia tidak menyangka reaksi comel ibunya menerusi video itu mendapat perhatian ramai.
VIDEO
Video yang dimuat naik Izzatie mendapat perhatian di laman Twitter miliknya.
"Ada di antara komen mereka yang buat saya rasa simpati kerana ada ibu bapa mereka yang sudah berpisah. Ia membuatkan saya bersyukur mempunyai keluarga yang sangat bahagia.
"Saya harap video ini dapat memberi inspirasi kepada orang lain untuk saling melengkapi pasangan masing-masing. Cinta sejati tak pernah mati.
"Ia bukan semata-semata kerana cincin itu sebaliknya bagaimana anda menyayangi pasangan anda. Ibu juga sering buat kejutan kepada ayah tapi ayah macam biasalah reaksi dia acah-acah macho, katanya.

quote: Saya tahu kerajaan tidak akan meratifikasikan ICERD dan orang Melayu kata kita sudah menang.
content:
Shahrir Samad (kanan) tidak pernah mempercayai apa yang diperkatakan Dr Mahathir Mohamad mengenai ICERD.
KUALA LUMPUR: Ketua Umno Bahagian Johor Bahru, Tan Sri Shahrir Samad mahu parti itu meneruskan himpunan membantah Konvensyen Antarabangsa Mengenai Penghapusan Bentuk Diskriminasi Kaum (ICERD), walaupun Putrajaya memutuskan tidak meratifikasi triti global itu.
Katanya, himpunan pada 8 Disember itu perlu diteruskan demi tujuan dan hasrat terselindung serta tersirat, selain untuk meraikan Perlembagaan Persekutuan.
“Saya tahu kerajaan tidak akan meratifikasikan ICERD dan orang Melayu kata kita sudah menang.
“(Umno Bahagian Johor Bahru) sudah tempah 5 bas, pada saya, kita akan teruskan,” katanya yang menjadi panel dalam forum “Pelaksanaan ICERD: Adakah Kedudukan Orang Melayu dan Islam Tergugat?” di Pusat Dagangan Dunia Putra (PWTC) hari ini.
Semalam, Pejabat Perdana Menteri mengumumkan Malaysia tidak akan menandatangani ICERD, sebaliknya terus mempertahankan Perlembagaan Persekutuan yang termaktub kontrak sosial dipersetujui wakil semua kaum ketika pembentukan negara.
Susulan itu, Ketua Sekretariat Gerakan Pembela Ummah, Aminuddin Yahaya dipetik Malaysiakini sebagai berkata, himpunan pada 8 Disember ini tetap akan diteruskan di Dataran Merdeka.
Katanya, himpunan yang pada asalnya bertujuan membantah ICERD itu akan menjadi majlis kesyukuran dan beliau yakin orang ramai akan hadir untuk meraikan kemenangan rakyat.
Timbalan Presiden PAS, Tuan Ibrahim Tuan Man dipetik portal berita sama berkata, himpunan pada bulan depan itu tetap diteruskan, walaupun parti Islam itu menyambut baik keputusan kerajaan tidak mengiktiraf ICERD.
Sementara itu, Shahrir yang juga bekas ahli Parlimen Johor Bahru berkata, beliau tidak pernah mempercayai apa yang diperkatakan Tun Dr Mahathir Mohamad mengenai ICERD.
“Pasal hari ini dia cakap lain, esok dia cakap lain. Betul dia perdana menteri, tetapi saya tak terima dia sebagai pemimpin negara, dia mempunyai pemikiran sayang orang Melayu dan Islam.”

U.S. envoy in charge of the quest for a peace deal in Afghanistan encouraged by recent progress, but hurdles remain.
It’s telling that the biggest news about the ongoing Afghan peace process is that negotiators have “agreed to agreements in principle” on some key issues. On Monday, following six days of talks in Qatar with Taliban representatives, U.S. envoy Zalmay Khalilzad said in a statement that progress on vital issues had been made and the two sides had “agreed to agreements in principle on a couple of very important issues.”
Khalilzad went on to acknowledge that more work needs to be done. According to the Associated Press, the statement continued: “There is a lot more work to be done before we can say we have succeeded in our efforts but I believe for the first time I can say that we have made significant progress.”
In an interview with the New York Times, Khalilzad said “We have a draft of the framework that has to be fleshed out before it becomes an agreement.” Back in Kabul as of Sunday, Khalilzad said,“The Taliban have committed, to our satisfaction, to do what is necessary that would prevent Afghanistan from ever becoming a platform for international terrorist groups or individuals.”Enjoying this article? Click here to subscribe for full access. Just $5 a month.
Khalilzad was named Special Representative for Afghanistan Reconciliation in September 2018 by U.S. Secretary of State Mike Pompeo. A former U.S. Ambassador to Afghanistan and also Iraq, Khalilzad was tasked with finding a peace settlement for the war in Afghanistan. Since, Khalilzad has engaged in significant shuttle diplomacy, bouncing around the Middle East and South Asia. In the last month alone, Khalilzad led a delegation to India, the United Arab Emirates, China, Afghanistan, and Pakistan before heading to Qatar and then Afghanistan again.
Reuters quoted a Qatari Foreign Ministry official in reporting that the two sides have “agreed tentatively to reconvene on February 25.”
An apparent draft of the deal, referenced by the New York Times and Reuters, reportedly contains provisions for a withdrawal of U.S. troops and a pledge by the Taliban to not allow Afghan soil to be used by others, presumably al-Qaeda and the Islamic State.
On Twitter, Khalilzad said meetings in Qatar were “more productive than they have been in the past. We made significant progress on vital issues.”
“[We] will build on the momentum and resume talks shortly,” he continued. “We have a number of issues left to work out. Nothing is agreed until everything is agreed, and ‘everything’ must include an intra-Afghan dialogue and comprehensive ceasefire.”
A Taliban official speaking to the New York Times didn’t comment on the issue of a ceasefire and direct talks between the Taliban and the Afghan government. These two issues are the most difficult to surmount. The Taliban has steadfastly refused direct talks with the Afghan government, casting the leaders in Kabul as American puppets. Meanwhile, fighting continues across Afghanistan with the Taliban enjoying influence over an estimated half of the country’s districts. 
Back in Kabul for consultations, Khalilzad will continue to serve as a bridge between the Afghan government and the Taliban. For its part, the Afghan government led by President Ashraf Ghani continues to work with Khalilzad while trying to reassure the Afghan people that they will not be abandoned. As Tolonews reported it, on Monday Ghani gave a national address calling on the Taliban to enter direct talks, assuring “the people that their rights will not be compromised in the name of peace and that the country’s sovereignty will be upheld.”
On Monday in Kabul, Khalilzad told Afghan media that there is a “moment of opportunity for peace.”
“The key for finding the solutions for Afghan problems is at the hands of Afghans now,” he said.
It’s important to reiterate that nothing has actually been agreed to, not even the principles. The checklist to achieving peace is long, with each side having different priorities for what ought to come first. For the Taliban, a U.S. troop withdrawal is a top item; for the United States, a ceasefire would be among the top priorities but as hinted last month, the Trump administration is keen to drawdown troop levels too; and for the Afghan government, both a ceasefire and direct talks are near the top of the list, with the troop withdrawal much further down and contingent on security improvements that at this stage are far from realized.
The next iteration of talks for Khalilzad are reportedly set for late February.

quote: more productive than they have been in the past. We made significant progress on vital issues.
content:
U.S. envoy in charge of the quest for a peace deal in Afghanistan encouraged by recent progress, but hurdles remain.
It’s telling that the biggest news about the ongoing Afghan peace process is that negotiators have “agreed to agreements in principle” on some key issues. On Monday, following six days of talks in Qatar with Taliban representatives, U.S. envoy Zalmay Khalilzad said in a statement that progress on vital issues had been made and the two sides had “agreed to agreements in principle on a couple of very important issues.”
Khalilzad went on to acknowledge that more work needs to be done. According to the Associated Press, the statement continued: “There is a lot more work to be done before we can say we have succeeded in our efforts but I believe for the first time I can say that we have made significant progress.”
In an interview with the New York Times, Khalilzad said “We have a draft of the framework that has to be fleshed out before it becomes an agreement.” Back in Kabul as of Sunday, Khalilzad said,“The Taliban have committed, to our satisfaction, to do what is necessary that would prevent Afghanistan from ever becoming a platform for international terrorist groups or individuals.”Enjoying this article? Click here to subscribe for full access. Just $5 a month.
Khalilzad was named Special Representative for Afghanistan Reconciliation in September 2018 by U.S. Secretary of State Mike Pompeo. A former U.S. Ambassador to Afghanistan and also Iraq, Khalilzad was tasked with finding a peace settlement for the war in Afghanistan. Since, Khalilzad has engaged in significant shuttle diplomacy, bouncing around the Middle East and South Asia. In the last month alone, Khalilzad led a delegation to India, the United Arab Emirates, China, Afghanistan, and Pakistan before heading to Qatar and then Afghanistan again.
Reuters quoted a Qatari Foreign Ministry official in reporting that the two sides have “agreed tentatively to reconvene on February 25.”
An apparent draft of the deal, referenced by the New York Times and Reuters, reportedly contains provisions for a withdrawal of U.S. troops and a pledge by the Taliban to not allow Afghan soil to be used by others, presumably al-Qaeda and the Islamic State.
On Twitter, Khalilzad said meetings in Qatar were “more productive than they have been in the past. We made significant progress on vital issues.”
“[We] will build on the momentum and resume talks shortly,” he continued. “We have a number of issues left to work out. Nothing is agreed until everything is agreed, and ‘everything’ must include an intra-Afghan dialogue and comprehensive ceasefire.”
A Taliban official speaking to the New York Times didn’t comment on the issue of a ceasefire and direct talks between the Taliban and the Afghan government. These two issues are the most difficult to surmount. The Taliban has steadfastly refused direct talks with the Afghan government, casting the leaders in Kabul as American puppets. Meanwhile, fighting continues across Afghanistan with the Taliban enjoying influence over an estimated half of the country’s districts. 
Back in Kabul for consultations, Khalilzad will continue to serve as a bridge between the Afghan government and the Taliban. For its part, the Afghan government led by President Ashraf Ghani continues to work with Khalilzad while trying to reassure the Afghan people that they will not be abandoned. As Tolonews reported it, on Monday Ghani gave a national address calling on the Taliban to enter direct talks, assuring “the people that their rights will not be compromised in the name of peace and that the country’s sovereignty will be upheld.”
On Monday in Kabul, Khalilzad told Afghan media that there is a “moment of opportunity for peace.”
“The key for finding the solutions for Afghan problems is at the hands of Afghans now,” he said.
It’s important to reiterate that nothing has actually been agreed to, not even the principles. The checklist to achieving peace is long, with each side having different priorities for what ought to come first. For the Taliban, a U.S. troop withdrawal is a top item; for the United States, a ceasefire would be among the top priorities but as hinted last month, the Trump administration is keen to drawdown troop levels too; and for the Afghan government, both a ceasefire and direct talks are near the top of the list, with the troop withdrawal much further down and contingent on security improvements that at this stage are far from realized.
The next iteration of talks for Khalilzad are reportedly set for late February.

content:
Barring opposition MPs from schools a BN relic, says Nik Nazmi




            Updated 1 week ago ·

PKR MP Nik Nazmi Nik Ahmad says that despite serving as the Selangor exco for education from 2014-2018, he was barred from entering schools in the state and had once been forced to pretend to be a student to enter a forum held in Universiti Malaya. – The Malaysian Insight pic by Afif Abd Halim, November 20, 2018.


PKR lawmaker Nik Nazmi Nik Ahmad slammed fellow Pakatan Harapan leader and Education Minister Dr Maszlee Malik for replicating one of Barisan Nasional’s “worst abuses” by barring opposition MPs from entering from public schools without prior permission.
In a statement today, Nik Nazmi said the new federal government must adopt more open policies “to take the moral high ground”.

quote: reassures markets the viability of their supply cuts and even impose deeper ones as some members have suggested
content:
A pumpjack operates above an oil well at night in the Bakken Formation on the outskirts of Williston, North Dakota. (Bloomberg pic)
SEOUL: Oil prices were mixed on Wednesday as the US benchmark rebounded from steep losses in the previous session, even though concern over the health of the global economy continued to overshadow the market.
US West Texas Intermediate (WTI) crude futures, were up 13 cents, or 0.31%, at US$42.66 per barrel, at 0748 GMT. Prices earlier rose as much as 2%. They slumped 6.7% in the previous session to US$42.53 a barrel, the lowest since June 2017.
Brent crude oil futures were down 29 cents, or 0.57%, at US$50.18 a barrel and earlier fell to the lowest since July 2017. They skidded 6.2% in the previous session to US$50.47 a barrel.
“US$50 is a psychological support level (for Brent),” said Margaret Yang, a market analyst for CMC Markets in Singapore.
“But market confidence needs to be restored for oil price…that includes an equity market rebound and/or a bigger production cut from major oil exporters,” Yang said, referring to an Opec-led agreement to lower output starting next month.
Broader financial markets have been under pressure on worries about a global economic slowdown amid higher US interest rates and the US-China trade dispute.
“US equity futures are trading a bit firmer this morning triggering some little buying interest in the oil markets,” said Stephen Innes, head of trading for Asia-Pacific at futures brokerage Oanda in Singapore.
But Innes added macroeconomics fears will continue unless the Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries (Opec) “reassures markets the viability of their supply cuts and even impose deeper ones as some members have suggested”. Opec and allies led by Russia agreed this month to cut oil production by 1.2 million barrels per day.
Russian Energy Minister Alexander Novak said on Tuesday that oil prices would become more stable in the first half of 2019, supported by Opec and non-Opec countries’ joint efforts to cut output.
Kazakhstan, a party to the supply cut agreement, expects the participants of the Opec and non-Opec agreement to stabilise oil prices in the first quarter of next year and make a joint statement next month to support the market, Energy minister Kanat Bozumbayev said on Wednesday.
Elsewhere, US political turmoil triggered by the partial shutdown of the federal government is also adding to market concerns. President Donald Trump said on Tuesday that a government shutdown could last until his demand for funds to build a US-Mexico border is met.

quote: Placing workers related contract under OSA a smoke screen
content: Ahmad Zahid Hamidi  - Photograph: WikipediaThe Penang division of the Malaysian Trades Union Congress refers to an FMT post yesterday about the “monopolisation and manipulation” of the recruitment of workers from Bangladesh and is shocked at the revelation that Malaysian politicians and officials were allegedly paid bribes in the employment of those workers. It is also shocking that even human resources managers were bribed in the exercise.We note FMT’s post, which cites the Daily Star newspaper of Bangladesh as the source of the matter. According to the newspaper’s report, the then Home Affairs Minister, Ahmad Zahid Hamidi, placed the monopoly, given to IT company Synerflux, under Malaysia’s Official Secrets Act.Penang MTUC had registered its objection to such an unjustified abuse of the home minister’s power even then (FMT, 17 March 2016, “Placing workers related contract under OSA a smoke screen”).In the light of this latest exposure, MTUC Penang Division calls upon the authorities to immediately commence investigations to identify the government officials, human resources managers and anyone else implicated in the matter. Such investigations must include the then Home Minister, Ahmad Zahid Hamidi, and even government officials who have left service.If the Daily Star of Bangladesh’s report is of substance,  it would stand as testimony to the fact that workers of that country were subjected to exploitation that can only be best described as bonded labour and, that too, allegedly for the enrichment of politicians and civil servants in Malaysia.MTUC Penang Division, noting that the Dhaka High Court of Bangladesh has ordered an inter-ministeral committee to be formed to investigate the matter within six months, hopes that the same urgency over the matter can be adopted by our government.MTUC Penang Division wishes to extend our salutations to the Daily Star newspaper of Bangladesh for its exposure of the said issue.  K Veeriah is secretary of the Malaysian Trades Union Congress, Penang Division.Thanks for dropping by! content:
Penunggang motosikal maut di LDP




MALINDA ABDUL MALIK
25 Disember 2018 6:36 PM


PETALING JAYA - Seorang wanita maut selepas menjadi mangsa kemalangan langgar lari di Kilometer 13.5 Lebuhraya Damansara-Puchong (LDP) arah utara petang tadi.

Dalam kejadian pukul 5.40 petang itu, mangsa, Hasnina Norsafri,22 tahun yang menunggang motosikal jenis Yamaha Y15 maut di lokasi kejadian.
Satu sumber berkata, kejadian itu diketahui ketika peronda LDP membuat rondaan cegah kemalangan di lokasi kejadian.
“Mangsa dipercayai mangsa langgar lari dan kita belum ketahui kenderaan lain yang terlibat dalam kejadian tersebut.
“Wanita berkenaan disahkan meninggal dunia oleh oleh pegawai perubatan akibat mengalami kecederaan parah pada kepala,” katanya sebentar tadi.
Menurutnya lagi, orang awam atau saksi yang melihat kejadian diminta tampil membantu siasatan atau menghubungi mana-mana balai berdekatan bagi menyalurkan maklumat. - K! ONLINE

quote: Suaram strongly encourages the current administration to review its policy and decision-making procedures and implement processes for a more inclusive engagement and decision-making process with civil societies and the broader public.
content: Putrajaya has been urged to conduct more public engagements, particularly on matters concerning human rights, before making policy pronouncements.Suaram, in conjunction with the launch of its annual report on human rights today, said this was necessary to ensure more public awareness and de-escalate attempts to derail human rights reforms."Suaram strongly encourages the current administration to review its policy and decision-making procedures and implement processes for a more inclusive engagement and decision-making process with civil societies and the broader public."This is to ensure that the public is aware of the stakes involved and to de-escalate the on-going campaign of misinformation that may derail the human rights reform that Malaysia sorely needs," it said in a statement today.Suaram said that the failure to properly engage the public had led to substantial backlashes, such as attempts to ratify the International Convention on the Elimination of All Form of Racial Discrimination (Icerd) and attempts to abolish the death penalty."The answer to the backlash thus far has been 'U-turns'," said Suaram.It added that the new government has many human rights issues that were inherited from the previous government, which needs urgent attention.These include the continued detention without trial of individuals under the Security Offences (Special Measures) Act (Sosma) 2012 and the Prevention of Crime Act (Poca) 1960.According to Suaram, there are currently 286 people detained under these two laws. However, Suaram noted that there have not been cases of new application of this law since May 9.Suaram also noted that Putrajaya appeared to lack coherence in dealing with the issue of child marriage.On the plus side, Suaram noted a "remarkable improvement" in how government agencies were accountable to the public and stakeholders."While there is a notable improvement in government communications with stakeholders, decision-making process still takes place in a vacuum where human rights NGOs and thinktank are not necessarily engaged," said the group.Suaram's Human Rights Report 2018 Overview will be available on its website soon.

quote: Belum lagi... kita hanya bincang cara umum.
content: KUALA LUMPUR, 1 Feb (Bernama) – Hanya seorang individu bawah umur yang masih ditahan di bawah Akta Pencegahan Jenayah 1959 (POCA) kerana terlibat dengan kegiatan jenayah kekerasan iaitu rompakan bersenjata.  Timbalan Perdana Menteri Datuk Seri Dr Wan Azizah Wan Ismail berkata pesalah juvana itu sedang menjalani tahanan dua tahun di tempat tahanan berasingan daripada tahanan dewasa di Pusat Pemulihan Khas Kluang, Johor.  Beliau mengulas gesaan Suara Rakyat Malaysia (SUARAM) dan Suruhanjaya Hak Asasi Manusia (SUHAKAM) supaya kerajaan membebaskan 142 kanak-kanak dan juvana yang ditahan di bawah POCA, kerana akta itu banyak memberi kesan trauma kepada golongan muda itu.    “Saya berasa terkejut dengan pendedahan itu, jadi saya segera memanggil menteri dan (pegawai) kementerian yang bertanggungjawab… polis (PDRM) memaklumkan kepada kami sebenarnya tinggal hanya seorang sahaja di bawah POCA sehingga 30 Jan,” katanya kepada pemberita di sini, hari ini.  Terdahulu, beliau mengagihkan kotak limau mandarin kepada penduduk setempat di Pasar Taman Muda dan Pasar Pagi Pandan Perdana.  Ketika ditanya sama ada mereka di bawah umur yang ditahan di bawah akta itu wajar dibebaskan, Dr Wan Azizah berkata perkara itu perlu dikaji terlebih dahulu, bagaimanapun beliau menyerahkan kepada pihak polis dan kementerian yang berkaitan.  Mengikut statistik Kementerian Dalam Negeri, seramai 27 orang tahanan bawah umur masih lagi menjalani perintah sekatan (pengawasan polis di luar penjara) selama dua tahun berikutan terlibat dengan kongsi gelap, rompakan berkumpulan, curi motosikal, samun dan lain-lain kesalahan.  Mengenai peranti pemantauan elektronik (EMD) yang dipasang pada kaki tahanan bawah umur, beliau berkata hanya mereka yang diluluskan dan ditapis oleh Lembaga Pencegahan Jenayah kerana terlibat dalam jenayah berat dipasang peranti itu.  Dr Wan Azizah, bagaimanapun, tidak menyatakan jumlah tahanan bawah umur yang dipasang EMD, namun perbincangan akan dijalankan bersama Menteri Dalam Negeri untuk  mengkaji lebih mendalam sistem penahanan pesalah kanak-kanak dan juvana.  “Walaupun pesalah bawah umur tidak ditahan bersama tahanan dewasa, namun kita mungkin boleh lihat kembali untuk pastikan mereka tidak disamakan dan disatukan langsung dalam satu persekitaran bersama mereka yang disabitkan kesalahan, orang yang kena tahan dan orang yang kena tuduh,” katanya.  Dalam pada itu, ketika ditanya adakah sebarang perbincangan dibuat mengenai bakal calon pada Pilihan Raya Kecil Dewan Undangan Negeri Semenyih, beliau menjawab, “Belum lagi... kita hanya bincang cara umum.”  -- BERNAMA

quote: It takes time. The infrastructure and incentives must be there for us to see further growth.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR — July 30, 2018: The Malaysian Automotive Association has described the plan by the government to limit the access of foreign cars into the local market as a regressive move for the growth of the automotive industry.
Instead it believes that there should be a level playing field for local and foreign car makers, as many of these foreign cars carry a lot of local components and provide business and employment to locals.
“It is a very regressive move. I don’t think it’s right for the government to say that they want to stop all cars other than Proton to be brought into the country,” MAA president Datuk Aishah Ahmad said to reporters after a meeting with the Council of Eminent Persons today.
She made clear that for the local automotive industry to move forward, the government must create a conducive environment through liberalisation, as is the case in Thailand and Indonesia.
“Thailand is exporting more than 1.3 million cars a year and Indonesia more than 100,000 vehicles. What is Malaysia exporting? Twenty to thirty thousand units a year,” she noted.
Aishah said the National Automotive Policy, last updated in 2014, was also due for another review to ensure more vehicles were exported from Malaysia.
She also wants the government to review its plan for another national car, saying this would disrupt the local industry which only has a small market with a total volume of about 600,000 a year.
“What we don’t want is further incentives being provided for the new national car, which will really disrupt the industry. It does not help the industry at all,” she emphasised.
On electric cars, Aishah said further investments and incentives were needed to grow the segment, which only saw 13 cars sold last year.
“It takes time. The infrastructure and incentives must be there for us to see further growth.”
In Parliament today, Prime Minister Tun Dr. Mahathir Mohamad said the previous government’s policy which favoured foreign cars had made it difficult for Proton to make a profit.
“The previous government allowed foreign cars to come in without giving Proton the opportunity to expand overseas,” he remarked, creating difficulties for the national car maker to compete with global automotive giants.
Thus he sees a need to impose conditions to limit the access by foreign cars into the local market. — Bernama

quote: Kita membuat keputusan meninggalkan Umno kerana perjuangan perlu diteruskan bersama kerajaan untuk membela nasib rakyat terutama di kawasan pedalaman ini yang masih jauh ketinggalan.
content:
KETUA PENERANGAN UMNO BAHAGIAN PENSIANGAN IKUT JEJAK ABDUL GHANI


Oleh Alfred Petrus

KENINGAU: Ketua Penerangan Umno Bahagian Pensiangan Marutin Ansiung mengikuti jejak bekas Ketua Umno Bahagian, Datuk Abdul Ghani Datuk Yassin yang meletakkan jawatan dan meninggalkan parti.
Menurut Marutin, beliau mengambil keputusan itu kerana ingin meneruskan perjuangan dalam wadah yang boleh menyokong kerajaan.
Ketua Penerangan Umno Bahagian Pensiangan Marutin Ansiung
Bagaimanapun, beliau belum menyatakan hala tuju politiknya buat masa ini kerana akan mengikuti jejak Ghani yang akan membuat pengumuman mana satu parti yang disertai untuk meneruskan perjuangan mereka.
“Kita membuat keputusan meninggalkan Umno kerana perjuangan perlu diteruskan bersama kerajaan untuk membela nasib rakyat terutama di kawasan pedalaman ini yang masih jauh ketinggalan.
“Kalau di bandar kita boleh jadi pembangkang kerana segala kemudahan sudah ada tetapi di luar bandar terutama kampung-kampung yang terpencil masih memerlukan kemudahan yang hanya boleh dilakukan oleh parti pemerintah” katanya kepada media mengenai hala tuju politiknya di sini baru-baru ini.
Justeru itu, katanya tindakan menyokong kerajaan masa kini adalah langkah yang paling sesuai untuk kesinambungan pembangunan yang telah dirancang oleh kerajaan lalu.
Pada Rabu hampir keseluruhan kepimpinan badan perhubungan Umno Sabah termasuk lima ahli Parlimen, sembilan Ahli Dewan Undangan Negeri (Adun) dan dua orang Senator isytihar keluar parti serta merta.
Pengumuman dibuat oleh bekas Pengerusi Umno Negeri, Datuk Hajiji Mohd Noor dalam sidang media khas hala tuju Umno Sabah. -SabahNewsToday

Berkaitan

quote: US Navy Built Largest-Ever Amphibious Assault Ship for F-35 Fighters
content:
The USSAmerica will be replacing the USS Wasp as the U.S. Navy’s largest forward-deployed amphibious assault ship in the region.
The lead ship of the U.S. Navy’s newest class of amphibious assault ships, the 45,000-ton USS America, designated Landing Helicopter Assault (LHA) 6, will deploy to Japan in 2019 replacing the older Wasp-class amphibious assault ship, USS Wasp, as the biggest forward-deployed big deck in the U.S. Navy’s 7th Fleet.
Like its predecessors, the USS America is expected to be homeported at the U.S. naval port of Sasebo, Japan.
“[Wasp] is coming around because of maintenance – her time in [the Forward-Deployed Naval Force] is over out in Japan, America‘s going out there. She’s coming back because of maintenance and dock loading and stuff like that,” Vice Admiral Richard Brown, the commander of Naval Surface Forces and Naval Surface Force Pacific, was quoted as saying by USNI News during a January 11 phone call with reporters.Enjoying this article? Click here to subscribe for full access. Just $5 a month.
According to the U.S. Navy’s Personnel Command’s Decommissioning and Homeport Change webpage, the transfer of the USS America to Sasebo will likely be completed by May 2019, the Military Times reported in December 2018.
This will not be the USS America’s first deployment to Asia. As I reported previously, the America Amphibious Ready Group (ARG) consisting of the USS America, the San Antonio-class amphibious transport dock USS San Diego, and the Harpers Ferry-class dock landing ship USS Pearl Harbor, along with the 15th Marine Expeditionary Unit (MEU), deployed to the Pacific, Middle East, and the Horn of Africa from July 2017 to February 2018.
The USS America is an aviation-focused flattop. Unlike the USS Wasp, the flattop was designed with no well deck that floods to launch landing craft. As I noted elsewhere:
The new warship is armed with 12 defensive weapons systems, including two rolling aircraft missile RIM-116 Mk 49 l launchers; two Raytheon 20mm Phalanx CIWS mounts; and seven twin .50 cal. machine guns. The ship’s most potent weapon system, however, is the (…) fifth-generation F-35B Joint Strike Fighter (JSF). In November 2016, the U.S. Navy conducted operational testing of the F-35B aboard the ship, followed by a number of weapons load tests involving the fifth-generation fighter jet.
As I noted elsewhere, (See: “US Navy Built Largest-Ever Amphibious Assault Ship for F-35 Fighters”),  the USS America, next to the F-35B, can accommodate MV-22 Osprey tiltrotor aircraft, CH-53 Super Stallions, and UH-1Y Huey helicopters. In detail, an America-class amphibious assault ship can carry up to nine F-35Bs, four AH-1Z Viper attack helicopters, four CH-53E Super Stallion helicopters, 12 MV-22 Ospreys, and two MH-60S Search and Rescue helicopters.
The USS Wasp only replaced its sister ship USS Bonhomme Richard, as the flagship of Task Force 76, which includes all of the 7th Fleet amphibious forces, in Sasebo in early 2018.

quote: Polis turut menjalankan ujian saringan awal pernafasan menggunakan alat SDII terhadap 22 pemandu dan mendapati tujuh daripada mereka positif alkohol.
content:
KOTA KINABALU: Polis Kota Kinabalu mengeluarkan 33 saman atas pelbagai kesalahan lalu lintas dalam Op Mabuk dan Samseng Jalanan di dua lokasi di bandar raya itu pada Sabtu dan awal pagi Ahad.
Ketua Polis Kota Kinabalu ACP Habibi Majinji berkata sebanyak 125 kenderaan diperiksa dalam operasi selama lima jam bermula 1 pagi itu yang membabitkan 142 pengguna jalan raya.
“Polis turut menjalankan ujian saringan awal pernafasan menggunakan alat SDII terhadap 22 pemandu dan mendapati tujuh daripada mereka positif alkohol.
“Pemeriksaan lanjut menerusi ujian pernafasan kedua menggunakan alat EBA II mendapati empat daripada pemandu terbabit positif melebihi paras alkohol dibenarkan dalam darah,” katanya dalam kenyataan Isnin.
Habibi berkata pemandu yang berkenaan boleh disiasat menurut Seksyen 45A (1) Akta Pengangkutan Jalan 1987 yang memperuntukkan hukuman denda RM1,000 hingga RM6,000 atau penjara sehingga 12 bulan jika sabit kesalahan.
Penguatkuasaan seumpama itu akan terus dijalankan bagi memastikan pemandu mematuhi undang-undang dan peraturan lalu lintas sekali gus mencegah pengguna jalan raya memandu bawah pengaruh alkohol, katanya.

quote: Saya mengalu-alukan pengurusan baharu FGV yang membawa kepakaran dan pengalaman serta keupayaan dalam menguruskan organisasi melalui kepimpinan mereka.
content:
FGV Holdings Berhad (FGV) mengumumkan pelantikan Datuk Haris Fadzilah Hassan sebagai Ketua Pegawai Eksekutif Kumpulan yang baharu, berkuatkuasa hari ini.
Serentak itu, Datuk Azhar Abdul Hamid melepaskan jawatannya sebagai Ketua Pegawai Eksekutif Interim yang dipegangnya sejak 24 Oktober tahun lalu.

quote: The government must also reveal if a ceiling price will be set before subsidies are given.
content:
The government has announced a subsidy system that allows cheaper petrol for those with smaller capacity vehicles.
GEORGE TOWN: Umno’s Khairy Jamaluddin today alleged the government has been selling RON95 petrol at higher than market prices for the past six weeks, adding by doing so, it has “profited” at the expense of people.
The Rembau MP said according to world market prices, the price of RON95 should have been RM1.94 this week, and five weeks ago, should have hovered between RM1.95 and RM2.18.
After the general election, the prices of RON95 and diesel were set at RM2.20 and RM2.18 respectively, while the price of RON97 is set by the weekly price float system.
Writing on his Facebook page, Khairy said on top of increased prices, the sale of fuel has also been taxed in the past six weeks.
“Not only are you not getting (fuel) subsidies, for the past six weeks, but the people have been paying ‘taxes’ to the government at every fill-up.
“But I suppose the rakyat can’t complain because remember, their (PH) election promises were not to reduce prices but just to ‘stabilise’ them instead.
“So, if the world fuel prices are down, the government is not obliged to reduce them, but merely stabilise them. Looks like you’ve got it good,” he said.
Khairy said in reality, fuel prices have been lower than RM2.20 since Nov 8, based on the Mean of Platts Singapore or MOPS. It is an average price of oil indicator used in most countries in the region, including Australia.
He said the Domestic Trade and Consumer Affairs Ministry must reveal how much the government “profited” from the people in the past six weeks after the hike on prices and as well as tax on fuel sales.
Khairy said an automatic pricing mechanism or APM introduced during the Barisan Nasional (BN) era was the best bet in the view of the instability of fuel prices, adding that PKR’s Rafizi Ramli shared his view.
Rafizi had earlier called for fuel prices to be revised weekly, and not monthly as previously practised.
Khairy said the government must now reveal the tentative pricing for fuels under the APM system, which will kick in from Jan 1, so it can be compared to market prices.
“The government must also reveal if a ceiling price will be set before subsidies are given.”
Last month, the government revealed that Malaysians used 1.2 billion litres of fuel each month, with 90% of them choosing to buy the cheaper RON95.
Under the 2019 Budget, those with cars with 1.5-litre engines and motorcycles with 125cc and below may buy RON95 petrol at a lower price.
The lower prices apply only to the first 100 litres of the month purchased for cars and 40 litres per month for motorcycles at the cost of 30 sen per litre.
As many as four million car owners and 2.6 million motorcycle owners are expected to benefit from this subsidy. The subsidy, however, will not be extended to owners of multiple vehicles.
The Parliament was told the scheme announced under the budget will likely begin from the second quarter of 2019.

quote: We just need to make sure to put in place the required safety procedures.
content:
PETALING JAYA: Set up a centra­lised national agency to really control slope safety, suggests the Institution of Engineers.
Its president David Lai (pic) said IEM had proposed the setting up of such a body years earlier and hoped that the government would look into this urgently.
“We had actually put in a position paper in 2002 on the classification of slopes into four categories according to the height and angle of the slope.
“We also had an update on the policy in 2009,” he said in an interview, adding that the two papers were conveyed to the Housing and Local Government Ministry that looked into building by-laws. 
“We are still actively pursuing this matter,” said Lai.
He said there should also be a slope information management system put in place to identify risky zones. 
“The government must take the lead in coming up with such a system. We can give recommendations but the government is the statutory body,” said Lai. 
He was responding to Nasa data that put Malaysia among the top 10 countries with the most frequent landslides in the world between 2007 and 2016.
Lai said Malaysia should learn from Hong Kong which had to deal with several landslides in the 1980s until it set up a geo office. 
“From then, they started to repair the old slopes and impose new guidelines. Now, they have managed to control slope failure,” he said. 
He said IEM, which had some 48,000 members, had put in a recommendation that for development on critical slopes between 25° and more than 35° angle, there should not only be a submissions engineer but also a geo-technical specialist to check on the design. 
Asked if there was a need for engineers to change their designs such as cutting or fortifying the slopes, Lai said: “We actually don’t need to change. 
“We just need to make sure to put in place the required safety procedures.
“We just need to get the correct people and whether all these procedures have been implemented.”
He added that enforcement was a necessity. 
He said with more hillside development, there was a need now for specialised geo-technical engineers, who knew soil conditions and behaviour, and incorporate this into slope design.Related stories:Malaysia among countries especially prone to landslides'Main cause is man-made'PWD working to keep landslides downApartment dwellers live in fear

quote: as everyone had lots of fun.
content:
By BORNEOTODAY
KOTA KINABALU: More than 100 ‘Pokemon Go Trainers’ or players from Kota Kinabalu and its suburbs had an unofficial gathering at Tanjung Lipat Park Sunday afternoon.
They played games – ‘catching pokemon’ and ‘raid gym’ competition. This is a first time ‘Pokemon Go’ players get-together.
A spokesman said all of them are all players, and since they seldom meet each other, they decided to have a ‘day-to-meet’ and “raid gym” together.
During the game format, players were divided into three teams; Valour, Mystic and Instinct.
Under the new game system, players had to work together to ‘raid the gym boss’ irrespective of the player being from which team.
The theme for the gathering was “Pokemon Go Sabah Unity”.
More gatherings are in the offing, said the spokesman who gave his name as Lee, “as everyone had lots of fun.”

quote: The connection between Tengku Adnan and the directors of these companies will raise queries as to a serious conflict of interest in the dealings.
content: C4 Center wants former federal territories minister Tengku Adnan Tengku Mansor to be investigated over the land deal relating to the development of the Taman Rimba Kiara green lung in Kuala Lumpur.The anti-graft NGO's executive director Cynthia Gabriel said it had analysed the ownership structure of Memang Perkasa Sdn Bhd (MPSB) which is developing the land in a joint venture with Yayasan Wilayah Persekutuan (YWP) and found potential conflicts of interest involving the former minister.She noted that one "Rosmanira Junoh" has an effective interest of 19.09 percent in MPSB, while also being involved with Dataran Hartajaya Sdn Bhd through Aman Ikhtisas Sdn Bhd.Gabriel added that Aman Ikhtisas owned 33.3 percent of Dataran Hartajaya while the remaining 66.7 percent is owned by Tadmansori Holding Sdn Bhd of which the majority shareholder is Tengku Adnan.Tengku Adnan was also YWP chairperson by virtue of his position as federal territories minister. YWP is the charity arm of the Federal Territories Ministry."The connection between Tengku Adnan and the directors of these companies will raise queries as to a serious conflict of interest in the dealings."C4 urges the MACC to investigate YWP and Tengku Adnan for their involvement in the land deals," she said.Criminal charges laid against Tengku Adnan had suggested that Tadmansori was his business vehicle.The former minister was charged in November last year with accepting RM2 million from developer Aset Kayamas Sdn Bhd while having dealings with the company. The amount was paid into the bank account of Tadmansori Sdn Bhd.He was also charged with allegedly accepting a RM1 million bribe to increase the lot ratio of development along Jalan Semarak by Paragon City Development Sdn Bhd.Gabriel noted that Taman Rimba Kiara initially belonged to the state comprising 0.6 acres where a Hindu temple is located, 4.4 acres of longhouses and 20 acres of a park."In 2014, YWP somehow procured the issuance of a title to itself (PT 9244) for 12 acres out of the 25 acres. This was a purported transfer of state land to YWP."This development involves building eight blocks of 42 to 54 storey high-end service apartments which will be known as Pavilion Taman Tun and building only one 29-storey block of 350 units for the current residents of the Bukit Kiara longhouse community."While the TTDI residents agree with the affordable housing project for the longhouse residents who have been waiting for it since the 1970s, they are opposed to the development of the high-end service apartments," she said.Gabriel said there are questions as to why YWP, as a charitable foundation, would be involved in a joint-venture luxury project.She also urged the current Pakatan Harapan government to disclose information relating to the project in the interest of transparency, including the circumstances of the deal."C4 further reasserts our call for greater scrutiny over the sale of government assets and property and demand the right to know and the right to greater information over the dealings of government procurement and sales of property," she said.

quote: Saya telah memberikan kerjasama baik dengan pihak polis dan berharap pihak media tidak memanjangkan perkara ini kerana ia menjejaskan maruah anak perempuan tersebut
content:
KUALA LUMPUR – Bekas Menteri di Jabatan Perdana Menteri, Datuk Seri Shahidan Kassim menggesa pihak media tidak mensensasikan kesnya didakwa mencabul seorang gadis sedangkan laporan polis telah ditarik balik.
Beliau berkata, tindakan pihak media terus melaporkan kes terbabit hanya akan menjejaskan masa depan gadis terbabit yang juga merupakan seorang penyanyi sebuah kumpulan buskers di Perlis.
“Saya telah memberikan kerjasama baik dengan pihak polis dan berharap pihak media tidak memanjangkan perkara ini kerana ia menjejaskan maruah anak perempuan tersebut
“Anak perempuan itu ada masa depan yang harus diberi perlindungan oleh semua pihak dengan menguar-uarkan cerita yang tidak sewajarnya ia boleh menjejaskan masa depan,” katanya pada sidang media di lobi Parlimen, hari ini.
Isnin lalu, Pengerusi Badan Bertindak Pemantau Jenayah Malaysia (MyWatch), Datuk R Sri Sanjeevan, dilapor mendakwa wujud cubaan ‘menutup’ satu kes cabul remaja perempuan berusia 15 tahun oleh seorang kenamaan, baru-baru ini.
Sanjeevan mendakwa remaja perempuan itu dicabul Ahli Parlimen berkenaan dalam sebuah kereta di Kangar, Perlis, pada 20 Oktober lalu, namun belum ada tindakan diambil polis.
Shahidan juga berkata, beliau sedia diserang oleh musuh politik berhubung kes cabul remaja bawah umur membabitkan dirinya, namun kehormatan penyanyi buskers terbabit perlu dilindungi.
“Saya sebagai orang politik sudah pasti saya akan dibuat macam-macam oleh musuh-musuh politik tapi tak apa saya akan hadapi dengan rela dan redha.
“Saya menganggap anak-anak buskers ini lebih kepada anak-anak dan cucu-cucu saya sendiri,” katanya.
Ahli Parlimen Arau Datuk Seri Shahidan Kassim bercakap kepada pemberita di lobi bangunan Parlimen, Kuala Lumpur.
Katanya lagi, ketika kejadian, Shahidan mendakwa beliau mengunjungi tempat pertunjukan busker DSSK yang turut dihadiri gadis berkenaan untuk menyerahkan bantuan kewangan.
“Saya telah tiba di tempat pertunjukkan tersebut lebih kurang jam 11.40 malam. Ketika itu salah seorang ahli pasukan buskers dan pengurus telah berjumpa dengan saya.
“Saya telah menyerahkan sedikit bantuan kewangan untuk kumpulan tersebut yang mana ketika itu ahli keluarga dan rakan-rakan penyanyi serta ahli kumpulan DSSK berada berhampiran dengan kereta saya
“Selepas memberikan dana, saya balik,” katanya.
Beliau turut menjelaskan, keesokkan harinya beliau dikejutkan dengan satu laporan polis telah dibuat ke atasnya bagaimanapun keluarga gadis terbabit telah menarik balik laporan itu kerana salah faham.
“Pada keesokkan hari Azhar memaklumkan ahli keluarga penyanyi kumpulan DSSK ingin berjumpa dengan saya.
“Saya berjumpa dengan ahli keluarga penyanyi tersebut dan terkejut dimaklumkan kepada saya yang mereka telah membuat laporan polis atas dasar salah faham dan mereka telah menarik laporan tersebut.
“Saya tidak mengambil hati kerana kami telah bermaaf-maafan dan saya pasti keluarga anak perempuan tersebut memahami,” katanya lagi. – MalaysiaGazette

Sanjeevan mendakwa remaja perempuan itu dicabul Ahli Parlimen berkenaan dalam sebuah kereta di Kangar, Perlis, pada 20 Oktober lalu, namun belum ada tindakan diambil polis.
Shahidan juga berkata, beliau sedia diserang oleh musuh politik berhubung kes cabul remaja bawah umur membabitkan dirinya, namun kehormatan penyanyi buskers terbabit perlu dilindungi.
“Saya sebagai orang politik sudah pasti saya akan dibuat macam-macam oleh musuh-musuh politik tapi tak apa saya akan hadapi dengan rela dan redha.
“Saya menganggap anak-anak buskers ini lebih kepada anak-anak dan cucu-cucu saya sendiri,” katanya.
Ahli Parlimen Arau Datuk Seri Shahidan Kassim bercakap kepada pemberita di lobi bangunan Parlimen, Kuala Lumpur.
Katanya lagi, ketika kejadian, Shahidan mendakwa beliau mengunjungi tempat pertunjukan busker DSSK yang turut dihadiri gadis berkenaan untuk menyerahkan bantuan kewangan.
“Saya telah tiba di tempat pertunjukkan tersebut lebih kurang jam 11.40 malam. Ketika itu salah seorang ahli pasukan buskers dan pengurus telah berjumpa dengan saya.
“Saya telah menyerahkan sedikit bantuan kewangan untuk kumpulan tersebut yang mana ketika itu ahli keluarga dan rakan-rakan penyanyi serta ahli kumpulan DSSK berada berhampiran dengan kereta saya
“Selepas memberikan dana, saya balik,” katanya.
Beliau turut menjelaskan, keesokkan harinya beliau dikejutkan dengan satu laporan polis telah dibuat ke atasnya bagaimanapun keluarga gadis terbabit telah menarik balik laporan itu kerana salah faham.
“Pada keesokkan hari Azhar memaklumkan ahli keluarga penyanyi kumpulan DSSK ingin berjumpa dengan saya.
“Saya berjumpa dengan ahli keluarga penyanyi tersebut dan terkejut dimaklumkan kepada saya yang mereka telah membuat laporan polis atas dasar salah faham dan mereka telah menarik laporan tersebut.
“Saya tidak mengambil hati kerana kami telah bermaaf-maafan dan saya pasti keluarga anak perempuan tersebut memahami,” katanya lagi. – MalaysiaGazette

content:
AKSI MENGECEWAKAN: Sanchez (kiri) bergelut untuk merampas bola daripada penguasaan pemain pertahanan Valencia, Jose Luis Gaya Pena ketika bersaing pada perlawanan di Old Trafford, Manchester Rabu lepas. — Gambar AFP

MANCHESTER, England: Pengurus Manchester United, Jose Mourinho, menepis lebih banyak kritikan tentang gaya permainan beliau selepas satu lagi aksi hambar menyaksikan pasukannya hanya seri tanpa jaringan dengan Valencia dalam aksi Liga Juara-Juara di Old Trafford Selasa lepas.
Penyokong United bersorak mendesak pemain Mourinho lebih menyerang dalam separuh masa kedua dan bekas pemain tengah United, Paul Scholes, mendakwa Mourinho memalukan kelab dengan berulang kali meluahkan kemarahan kepada pemainnya menerusi media.
“Saya tidak berminat. Kebebasan bersuara, negara bebas, anda boleh berkata apa yang anda suka,” kata Mourinho ketika merujuk komen Scholes.
“Kebebasan bersuara, terutama sekali untuk penyokong Man United yang saya hormati sepenuhnya.”
Sudah ketinggalan sembilan mata di belakang pendahulu Liga Perdana Inggeris, Manchester City dan Liverpool selepas tiga kekalahan dari tujuh perlawanan liga, Mourinho berharap untuk satu reaksi dari pemainnya selepas permainan hambar ketika tewas 1-3 kepada West Ham United.
“Saya sememangnya agak terkejut kerana beliau (Mourinho) dapat bertahan selepas (kekalahan) Sabtu lepas, prestasi pasukan sangat teruk,” kata Scholes.
“Beliau hadir pada sidang media dan sering mengkritik pemainnya, beliau mengkritik orang di atas beliau (pengurusan kelab) kerana beliau tidak mendapat apa yang beliau mahu.
“Saya fikir mulut beliau tidak dapat dikawal dan beliau memalukan kelab.”
United sekali lagi kelihatan tidak mempunyai idea dan kreativiti melakukan serangan dengan satu mata itu menyebabkan mereka ketinggalan dua mata di hadapan pendahulu Kumpulan H, Juventus, yang mencipta kemenangan kedua dengan menewaskan Young Boys 3-0 pada hari yang sama.
Satu mata sekurang-kurangnya mengekalkan kedudukan United di tangga kedua, tiga mata di hadapan Lyon.
Malam United bermula dengan buruk malah sebelum perlawanan apabila sepak mula perlawanan tertangguh lima minit kerana bas pasukan terperangkap dalam kesesakan jalan raya.
Mourinho menyalahkan pihak polis kerana enggan mengiringi bas pasukan berbanding pengurusan kelab.
Mourinho menurunkan semula Alexis Sanchez, yang tidak langsung berada dalam skuad pada perlawanan menentang West Ham untuk antara empat pertukaran dari skuad hujung minggu lepas.
Tetapi bintang antarabangsa Chile itu sekali lagi mengecewakan sebelum ditukarkan 15 minit sebelum tamat permainan.
Dengan corak permainan yang hampir sama sejak beberapa bulan, ada sedikit perubahan dari corak serangan berbanding hantaran-hantaran jauh kepada penyerang Romelu Lukaku.
Tetapi Mourinho mendakwa beliau tidak mempunyai pemain yang mampu bermain lebih bagus seperti yang beliau mahukan.
“Kami tidak mempunyai kualiti teknikal untuk memulakan serangan dari pertahanan,” tambah Mourinho.
“Kami tahu kami tidak akan mencipta 20 peluang. Penyerang kami tidak berada di tahap keyakinan dan prestasi terbaik ketika ini.
“Kami fikir dengan tiga atau empat peluang, kami akan menjaringkan gol dan menang.” — AFP

quote: biggest such bust Malaysia has seen to date
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: Malaysian authorities have made a record seizure of about 30 tonnes of pangolins and their scales worth some US$2 million in raids on major processing facilities, police and environmentalists said Tuesday (Feb 12).The haul included about 1,800 boxes full of frozen pangolins stuffed inside three refrigerated containers, 572 more frozen pangolins in six freezers, 61 live pangolins in cages, and 361kg of pangolin scales, according to police.
The Southeast Asian nation is battling to clamp down on rampant poaching and smuggling of pangolins, the world's most heavily trafficked mammal.The critically endangered creatures, also known as scaly anteaters, have long been targeted as their body parts are highly valued in traditional medicine in countries including China and Vietnam while their meat is considered a delicacy.Following a tip-off, wildlife officials in Sabah state raided a factory and a warehouse on Thursday, according to a statement from local police chief Omar Mammah.Police arrested a 35-year-old man suspected to have been in charge of the factory as part of an illegal syndicate.
The operation is believed to have been running for the past seven years, and police believe the pangolins were bought from poachers to be distributed locally.Traffic, a Malaysia-based group that monitors wildlife smuggling around the region, said it was the "biggest such bust Malaysia has seen to date"."No threatened species can withstand industrial levels of extraction such as this," Kanitha Krishnasamy, the group's Southeast Asia director, told AFP.The seizures also shone a light on Sabah's major role in animal trafficking - the state on Borneo island has been implicated in smuggling cases involving over 40 tonnes of pangolins since August 2017, according to Traffic.Malaysia regularly foils attempts to smuggle pangolins and their parts out of the country but usually on a far smaller scale.

quote: Begitu juga berkenaan isu AES. Kerajaan PH terus menerus melakukan pusingan u-turn.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR – Isu memalsukan sijil pengajian dan penambahan kamera Sistem Keselamatan Kesedaran Automatik (AES) membuktikan kerajaan Pakatan Harapan (PH) kini berdepan dengan defisit kepercayaan rakyat.
Ahli Parlimen Setiu, Shaharizukirnain Abdul Kadir berkata, rakyat ketika ini sedang memerhati tindak tanduk pemimpin PH dan menilai perbuatan mereka sebelum serta selepas mengambil alih kerajaan.
Katanya, dalam hal berkaitan isu sijil pengajian palsu, beliau masih ingat bagaimana DAP ketika masih pembangkang sebelum ini bermati-matian mendesak ahli kabinet kerajaan Barisan Nasional (BN) ketika itu, meletakkan jawatan.
Namun, selepas menjadi kerajaan, DAP diam seribu bahasa apabila Timbalan Menteri Luar kerajaan PH dikatakan memiliki sijil palsu.
“Begitu juga berkenaan isu AES. Kerajaan PH terus menerus melakukan pusingan u-turn.
“Sebelum ini, pelaksanaan AES ditentang habis-habisan oleh pemimpin PH yang menyifatkan sistem itu suatu tindakan kejam kerajaan BN kepada rakyat.
“Bagaimanapun, kini di bawah kerajaan PH, menterinya kata pelaksanaan AES bertepatan dengan Maqasid Syariah,” katanya dalam kenyataan kepada media di sini, hari ini.
Beliau mempersoalkan, di mana kredibiliti pemimpin PH apabila sanggup memalsukan sijil pengajian dan sentiasa pula membuat pusingan u-turn.
Kata Shaharilzukirnain, isu PTPTN, penghapusan tol serta lantikan ahli politik dalam syarikat milik kerajaan (GLC) juga membuktikan segala janji kerajaan PH kepada rakyat turut hilang kredibilitinya.
“Saya berharap kredibiliti pentadbiran negara dapat diatasi. Selagi mana kemelut kepimpinan tidak dapat diselesaikan, selagi itulah semakin terhakis ‘trust deficit’ rakyat terhadap kerajaan yang sehingga kini semakin membarah,” katanya. – MalaysiaGazette
